Reviews.Title: “not good except for the location”
Reviews.Author: kstkt K
Reviews.Content: extra small bed, not so clean toilet seat( yellowish) behind the seat. NO WIFI in lobby or anywhere. INternet is $8.99 a day. 2 computers in lobby for free use but if you have 150 staying at hotel, 2 is not enough. NO POOL either

Reviews.Title: “Feeling tricked”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie S
Reviews.Content: I just purchased a nights stay at The Bond Place hotel under a special on the Jaunt website. They advertised the room on for 119 a night for a deluxe suite stating the regular rate was 198 a night. However I just recieved an email stating there was a mistake and the special is only for a standard room. However a standard room on The Bond Place hotel is for 129 a night. Very disappointed in this false advertising the hotel used to get me to purchase a night. I can say with confidence I will not be staying at this hotel again. Stephanie

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: magical20
Reviews.Content: I was in TO for a very serious matter.....my son having kidney transplant surgery. I found the Bond Place (recommended by the hospital) to be very accommodating and friendly. The Front Desk Clerk I had the pleasure to deal with (Paul) was very very helpful and friendly. My room was perfect......small but complete in every way. Breakfast was reasonably priced and provided in a very nice room. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Next time I'm in Toronto (hopefully for a less serious reason) I will definitely stay here. Thank you for making a difficult time for me very much easier!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina M F
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic, very central and walking distance to downtown. 5 mins walk from the Eaton Centre, a great shopping mall which numerous eateries. The airport bus drops/picks up right at the front, costs about €26 euro return. The outside of the hotel is not that attractive, but on entering the lobby it is clean bright and welcoming. The rooms were great, we booked one with a double and 2 twins which was quite spacious, and the price for such a central hotel was very reasonable. Nice views from the upper floors, it is an 18 floor hotel with 2 lifts. There is not that many rooms on each floor so isn't much traffic passing your door, and had no trouble with noise from other rooms. The rooms were cleaned every day, with fresh towels and the beds were very comfortable. There is free internet usage in the lobby, two computers for use by clients. Only thing that annoyed us, was that the staff did not bother to inform us of the availability of breakfast downstairs, or about the 2nd floor gym. Instead we had to locate breakfast in various cafes in the area each morning. I assumed when it was not mentioned to us, that it was not available, but I see recent reviewers have mentioned it. This would have saved us a bit of hassle trying to find nice places to eat! Other than that this is a brilliant hotel. Based on other negative reviewers I was a little dubious about booking as we stayed for 5 nights. But I am delighted to say this hotel was in a fantastic location, very clean and comfortable, and was a contributing factor to ensuring that our visit to Toronto was amazing! I hope to be back here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, good for one night. It's all about location.”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed one Sat night through Hotwire. Check-in area has a stark appearance. You'll need your room card for elevator, except to get down to Lobby level. What I liked: - good price - downtown location, convenient to shopping, subway, theatres - remodelled rooms, white bedding - well designed bathroom with newish tub - sheers and blackout drapes on wall to wall window, with a window that opens - mini fridge, something I wasn't expecting - iron and board, coffeemaker, hairdryer - ice and drink machines on every 3 floors - noon checkout, even though back of door indicates 11am - 2nd floor gym was better than I was expecting, although closes at 10pm. LifeFitness equipment includes eliptical, bike, 2 treadmills, a multifunction. Also, there were mats, an exercise ball, free weights, a washroom, water cooler, flat panel wall TVs, handtowels Didn't like - room is very compact; mine had two twin beds. - heat/air conditioner immediately next to the one bed - narrow shelf desk with cheap chair - the 'make room up' on the back of 'do not disturb' signs. I had housekeeping knocking, likely because someone passing by chose to flip it around - flat panel TV takes a while to switch between stations - sliding bathroom door rattled terribly; bathroom lights really slow to come on; cheap towels - the only free internet is if you use one of the 2 computers in the extended lobby - no plastic bag to line the room ice bucket - no swimming pool/hot tub/sauna - closed restaurant; although there's continental in the basement until 9:30am. Ask about breakfast vouchers at the front desk. Breakfast included yogurt, quality baked muffins, cut melon previously from a bottle, even cookies

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for One Night”
Reviews.Author: cyndytrhapsody
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were clean and modern. Employee at the front desk was very friendly. Stayed in a twin room and it was a tight fit with my daughter's keyboard. The room reminded us of a cabin on a cruise ship, everything you needed with little wasted space.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, homeless guys in the lobby.”
Reviews.Author: DBP_RS_BRazil
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a nice location it's close to the eaton center, restaurants and cinemas but the neighborhood to the oposite side of the eaton center doesn't seem a very nice place. The Wi-Fi is charged separately but the hotel has two iMacs available for the guests for free. I used in the computers twice for quite a long time and nobody bothered me. I even used Skype to call my family and copied my camera's photos to my hard drive. What bothered me was that twice homeless guys got in the lobby and asked me for change. They just got in and out without anybody of the staff realizing it. I think that's something usual to the hotel since to operate the elevator is necessary to have a key. The room is very nice, it is not big but it has a good size. In the bathroom's shower's box there's a curtain, a glass would've been better. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant of the hotel is closed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to sleep! Like a college dorm...”
Reviews.Author: N_Bibi
Reviews.Content: If you stay here on a weekend, you had better be partying like mad - just like the rest of the patronage. It's just like staying in a college dorm - it seems every other room is filled with a group of young people having a party. The room itself is lovely and the bed so comfortable, but it's not worth staying here if you need rest. Breakfast is REVOLTING. You get a choice of: croissants that taste like paper, froot loops, rice krispies and toast. No fruit or anything.

Reviews.Title: “Fast Checkin and excellent services.”
Reviews.Author: bushwick2002
Reviews.Content: check-in was a breeze. I was located on the 3rd floor of the hotel. It looks like they just recently renovated this place since everything appeared brand new in the hotel room. there was a few slight issues but nothing serious except the AC Unit. The AC kept turning on and off randomly for 1-2 mins every 45mins or so. Even when i set the AC unit and the thermal stat unit to "OFF" mode. Dropping the "SET" temperature did not help either. Another problem was how thin the wall was. You could hear everything that goes on outside your room. That includes people talking in the hallway and opening and closing their room doors. There is no pressure spring for the hotel door so the door will slam hard every time somebody enter a room. The bathroom is a sliding door with no lock so if you have friends traveling with you; you would want to let them know. Turning on the shower head with hot water set all the way will stop it from working. You had to turn on the shower head with cold water and slowly adjust it to hot. kind of annoying but nothing serious. These was problems located in my room. your stay could be different. Either way, I did not feel these problems was serious enough to report to a hotel staff. the hotel staff was really friendly about everything. One last thing, the room did not come with a In-room safe like it was advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but walls are not sound proof and front desk doesn't care.”
Reviews.Author: etoilevy
Reviews.Content: The room is very clean and small, but I didn't mind the size because it was modern and in a great location. However, the walls are very thin and you can hear everything going on in the room next to you. We had a group of young people next door partying and being extremely loud. I could hear them yelling, "Drink! drink! drink! When I went to the front desk to let them know, they said they would not do anything about it because it was not 10 pm yet. As far as I'm concerned, it shouldn't matter what time it is. The front desk person, Kevin didn't even apologize for the noise and just sent me on my way. I like the hotel, but there needs to be a better policy for dealing with disruptive guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, expect small but comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: JamesEdinburghNapier
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms even though they are small. Well equipped and worth the money,

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a good night's rest”
Reviews.Author: Nunu M
Reviews.Content: If you have short trip and you want a convenient location in downtown TO then this your place. Although internet and break fast aren't part of the deal, the price per room was affordable eatons is nearby and so is dundas station - what more can you ask for :)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomended”
Reviews.Author: Heege
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a few days in Toronto! The location was lovely, right next to Dundas Square (Torontos times sqeare), very good shopping, and returants, bars and a lot more! The rooms were nice, maybe a bit small. But new and clean! We acually chose this hotel because it had a good price, and if Im going back to Toronto Im definatly staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “great location but...”
Reviews.Author: Crystal J
Reviews.Content: The Bond Place Hotel has a great location in the heart of downtown Toronto, spitting distance from yonge-dundas square and the eaton centre. The hotel is newly renovated and overall has nice decor, in the lobby and guest rooms, the hallways seem to not flow very well with the rest of the hotel i find. Free wifi as also a plus! The only downfalls I found was the rooms are on the smaller side and the wall are very thin, you could clearly hear conversations in the hallways, and from other rooms. Also a plus is the hotel has its own parking garage across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: sphygmos
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Toronto for a conference in November, and after checking TripAdvisor chose the Bond Place Hotel. My flight was delayed so I checked in late, and the staff were very nice. The hotel was clean and modern, with a cute coffee bar in the lobby. It's also walking distance from several restaurants, bars, and the mall. Very convenient. The only issue I had was that because I was delayed, I changed the name on the reservation to my friend's name so she could check in. Then when I arrived, we checked in at the front desk and I told the concierge my bad would be coming from the airport. He never asked my name so I assumed he still had both names on the register. When my bag did arrive in the middle of the night, he almost sent it back because he hadn't taken my name! This despite the fact that we both asked if he would make sure to hold onto my luggage and confirmed that he knew who I was, and I had checked with him several times over the phone to see if it had arrived. Perhaps it's my fault, but he tried to blame me for it in the morning which I didn't appreciate. Other than that everything was fine!

Reviews.Title: “Just around the corner from Eaton Centre Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Isaac_10
Reviews.Content: Is the perfect place to stay if you want to be in downtown Toronto and just around the corner from Eaton Centre, Hard Rock Cafe and Dundas Square. The hotel is all renewed, the standar bedrooms are a little small, but it have flat screen, good heat, and good renewed furnitures. The price is very accesible.

Reviews.Title: “Basically a college dorm room”
Reviews.Author: BarbadosBum
Reviews.Content: The actual rooms were decent and clean, however they were smaller than my bedroom at home and the walls were paper thin; you can hear everything. I have never stayed in a smaller hotel room. We bought this hotel on hotwire.com after a great deal came up, and then found out after we booked it that the standard room was two single beds so we had to pay $15 to upgrade to a queen, and $15 for parking so we didn't even save that much money which was very disappointing. The rooms were like walking into an ikea bedroom set. The bathroom is a sliding door and was not aligned properly so it doesn't close all the way, theres a huge gap that you can actually stick your hand through so you can see and hear everything ( awkward if you are staying with someone you aren't that close with). The room itself was alright- clean which was important, however the building it is in feels like a university residence. The building is very sketchy and full of interesting individuals. There were tons of completely drunk people just wandering the halls, there is no security here. The AC/heating unit is extremely loud which made it hard to sleep ( apart from all the people you can hear). Elevator was very sketchy. The staff however was very nice and they try the best they can with what they are given. I would not return here; it felt like we were renting a college dorm for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great value”
Reviews.Author: jordanrenaud
Reviews.Content: The Bond Place was recommended to us by family. Rooms are perfect for what we needed. Price was great! Service was superb. Located beaked Nathan Phillips Square, literally 2 minutes from the Eaton Centre downtown. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but great location and very cleancut”
Reviews.Author: Archie_757
Reviews.Content: Only steps from Yonge-Dundas Square, Eaton Centre. Right in the heart of downtown Toronto. Rooms are clean and nicely decorated, however the rooms are very small. I booked a 2 Twin-size beds for 1 night since it was the cheapest, but wouldnt recommend it unless your travelling for business or with friends, or pay more and get a larger bed or room. Great for crashing after a night on the town. Paid $90 night

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: scotgrl3
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler. Usually stay in a different part of Toronto but needed to be close to St. Michael's hospital for a workshop.Hotel turned out to be literally only 3 minutes away - at the other side of the block walking south!! Booked through Booking.com as did not realize I could have booked for only $88 on TripAdvisor! Still - good deal at $106 for downtown. Room on 16th floor meant I had lovely night view and incredible red rising sun view over the lake. Photos never do justice but I am posting anyway. Read the reviews of small room so was prepared (thanks). Actually felt cozy for just one person. Liked the desk which faced the window. Had free internet access which I used before bed. Actually felt a little like a cruise ship room in size but had an Asian vibe. Loved the shower (no bath) and the glass wall and door in the bathroom made it feel very light and airy (& definitely i\bigger than cruise ship size!). Had all the amenities that I needed for an overnight pit stop. Unfortunately no time to sample the expresso bar or to sample the wine/beer in the lobby bar in the evening (late arrival and early departure). I did not find it noisy but I was there on a Monday night. I would stay again and may do so in a couple of months when I have to leave for a vacation and will need to get to airport following my stay. Will check out the Airport Express bus prior to re-booking.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable stay”
Reviews.Author: Saif1979
Reviews.Content: Me & my wife have stayed at the Bond Place Hotel for 14 nights during our first visit to Toronto. The location is perfect - right near Eaton Centre, Dundas Yonge Square and Union Station. We enjoyed our stay, the service is good, receptionists are friendly and the b esspresso coffee bar downstairs has a great coffee (better than Tim's by far). Downsides are the small size of the room (King size bed is not really king size) and beacuse floors, walls and all rooms are all made of wood, it becomes really annoying to hear a mobile phone ringing in the room next to yours in the middle of the noght (or a couple fighting...etc). also there is no water hose in toilets.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: antohny
Reviews.Content: Located right in the heart of Toronto city centre. The rooms are small but very clean and simple decor. And Airport Express bus stops right in front of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: TanyaG76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bond Place Hotel for 2 nights during our first visit to Toronto. The location is perfect - right near Eaton Centre and Union Station. Easy to get a cab and walk wherever you want to go. The staff were some of the most accommodating staff I've ever dealt with: they allowed flexibility on check out time, securely stored our baggage, and had a great relationship with Beck Cabs - I felt like I had my own personal car service and never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a cab. We were in a Queen Junior Suite (I believe that was the style of room) and the size was perfect for the two of us, two suitcases, two carry-ons, and our two laptops. The rooms were clean and had a fridge and microwave. I agree with some of the other comments about the shower set up, we tried in vain to not get water all over the floor. We were on the 17th floor and had great sleeps, we didn't hear any noise from the busy streets below. The gym is a decent size for a small hotel and has 2 treadmills, an elliptical trainer, and a bike. There are also free weights, an exercise ball, mats, and a universal machine. Water cooler and towels provided as well.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and great location!”
Reviews.Author: sduncan13
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline and I got it in August for something like $60-$70/night. For being so close to Eaton center, that is an awesome deal! It's right in downtown where you wanna be. I didn't spend much time in my hotel room, but when I did come back I was pleased that it was so clean, tidy and simple. The rooms aren't big(no more than 2 ppl for sure!), but who really cares if you aren't going to be in them much. The rooms are equipped with a fridge and microwave which was nice. Besides the smaller size of the rooms, the only other complaint I have was one of the girls working at front desk. She seemed like one of those females who doesn't like other females/seems threatened by them. I asked her a few questions and I got major attitude and utter rudeness in return. I should have reported her when I left. The rest of the staff was friendly and very helpful. Because of the location, cleanliness, and price, I would FOR SURE stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Northeagle66
Reviews.Content: We were three nights in this hotel and we enjoyed our stay. The room was small but modern and really functionnal. Beds were OK and the shower worked really well. Sound insulation is somewhat below average but without being a real problem. This hotel is clean. It is extremely well located in downtown Toronto close to the Eaton Center and less than 5 minutes from a Subway Station. In the 90 - 100 $ price range in January, I think it is an excellent value for the money. Interior parking is across the street but safe and spacious at a reasonnable 15 $ a day. Internet worked fine at 9 $ a day. I would definitively stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If your not fussy and want value for money in a great location this is the hotel for you.....hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Taylor53
Reviews.Content: I came to canada for an event with my boyfriend we are in our 20's and wanted to be central however I didnt want to pay a lot of money so after research decided to stay at the bond place..... Postives...the location is fantasic we couldnt believe the location for the price we had paid. it was right next to the sqaure and shopping centre, staff were very friendly and helpful they helped us when we asked about the area, the rooms were LOVELY! great choice on TV normally I dont spend much time in the hotel but I did in this one :) Negatives....worse thing about this palce is the lifts, Im not fussy and hate moaning but the lifts were a nightmare, there was a lot of buidling work going on in the hotel when I stayed so the floors looked at times like a work site (but what else do you expect when they are doing building) --- on a plus if the hotel was that good with building going on then I can imagion its much better when its finished I would def recommend this hotel and if I was to come back I would def stay here, it is such value for money and a hidden gym :) I still to this day cannot believe the vaule for money :)

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: datawx
Reviews.Content: Wow! great position. 20 Seconds to Dundas Square. another 20 seconds to Subway. Staff were super friendly. Room service lady was a delight. Room could be considered small but clean, clean, clean. Bathroom was brand new and spotless. Bath plug was busted but did not cause me an issue. I stuffed a face cloth in the hole! LED lighting in all rooms which is good. Flat screen TV too. Only criticisms: no safe in room and my pet peeve of all hotels that charge for it......$11 for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, modern (tiny) rooms, great value.”
Reviews.Author: misscrusty
Reviews.Content: Not much else to say. Definitely a lot of bang for your buck here as compared to other downtown Toronto hotels. We had a queen room that was definitely Euro-sized. Amenities were modern and room was generally clean. Toiletries were included which was a nice touch. Only problem is that our bathroom door was little more than a sliding piece of pressboard that really didn't close all the way. That said, be sure you are very comfortable with the person you're sharing the room with!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but good location”
Reviews.Author: AJGSudbury_ON
Reviews.Content: Located on the far side of the block adjacent to the 'back' of Dundas square places this hotel right in the middle of Downtown Toronto's version of Times Square. The staff are friendly, the decor in both the lobby and guest rooms is clean and modern. The base level room is tiny, with two twin beds, a bathroom and built-in armoir instead of a real closet. The tiny beds were comfortable. The bathroom was clean and modern, although lacked any form of hook or bar to hang a towel or clothing on. Underground parking, located across the street is only $15 a night (very reasonable for downtown Toronto) and felt safe, although the height clearance felt scary in a minivan (no crunching, however). The immediate neighbourhood has a somewhat 'sketchy' feel to it, but the hotel itself felt safe with key-card required to access guest floors from the elevator. If you are looking for a cheap, no-frills stay in downtown Toronto, but don't want the typical budget motel chain experience, this place is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “best location, highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Chloe Skye K
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night as our stopover for our Europe trip. The hotel is so close to Dundas Square, the best location in Toronto. I LOVE the room, not too small (compared with hotels in Tokyo!) but very modern. I loved the wood floor, flat screen tv, marble tile bathroom, love the modern square sink, super clean and very comfy bed. We had a great view from 16th floor. Cons: no breakfast & no free wifi. If those two were included, it would be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Elisinha
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, just by Dundas Square, a block away from Eaton Centre. The price you pay, it's for the location, the hotel itself is okay. It's clean, the lobby looks great but the rooms have nothing special, they are kinda small.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: yorkie90
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly placed in Toronto to see everything on foot I personally do not recommend Toronto I found it dirty with a lot of not so friendly people ,Noisy and with a sleezy feel which could be because it was winter The normal hotel rooms are very small but spotless .We upgraded $30 anight and the room was perfect on the 17 floor

Reviews.Title: “Toronto visit January 2nd, 2012”
Reviews.Author: mwtraveller1949
Reviews.Content: Room was clean but small, smaller than a cabin on a cruise ship. No place for 2 to sit with only 1 chair provided. We had a business Queen and rented this because of the glass shower, which turned out to be a partial glass wall, no shower curtain. The underground parking... well it was underground but up and across the street so you had to go out in the weather and carry your belongings and walk to the hotel, not exactly what I took underground parking to mean, thought it would be under the hotel. I have knee problems and my husband has a foot problem not what we were looking for.Once you got over the very hard edge on the mattress it was ok and the pillows were ok. Walls between rooms were not soundproof, we spent from the time we arrived until 11:00 pm listening to the TV from the next room and their conversation. Our TV came on at volume 29 and the remotes did not work very well. We even had them replace them, both were taped together. So if you didn't think to check on the TV itself to turn the volumne down or change channels it remained high. Bistro - DELUXE breakfast included, not what you think.. orange juice, bagel, coffee or tea. You could get cheese and something else on the bagel. I had mine toasted with butter and this was very good. Bistro only open 7am until 2 in the afternoon so no onsite restaurant for dinner or later and no room service. Guess it would be ok for a business person by themselves that only wants a place to sleep for one night but we would not stay again. Of course you have to like listening to ambulances and fire trucks to stay here. We did have a great view and the heating unit worked well. On the elevator I would insert my key card, remove and push the floor button and it would stop somewhere else so I would have to insert the key card again. This morning took 3 tries to get us back up to our floor.

Reviews.Title: “If IKEA designed a hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Spaceace
Reviews.Content: We stayed ath the Bond Place for three nights on a leisure trip. It was a terrific stay for our purposes. Parking is across Dundas St (behind the Subway) from the hotel and costs $15/day. Not bad overall as it was much more affordable than most cities and garaged. Check in was flawless. The front desk manager that checked us in was professional an efficient. The concierge was witty and helpful. The rooms were something totally out of an Ikea catalogue. Although small as mentioned in many other reviews, they were Clean and overall smartly designed. we had two single beds and there was a coffeemaker. The bathroom 'door' was my least favourite feature as it 'slides' along the outside of the opening. Needless to say, it does not provide full privacy whilst in the bathroom as it does not full cover the door opening. Wasn't a huge deal to us, but word of advice may be to bring along some air freshener and prepare to do some 'courtesy flushing'. Location cannot be beat for the price. Front door essentially opens out to Yonge and Dundas Square on one side, and the south end of Church St on the other. To sum it all up, if youre looking to spend a few days in town and have extra cash to enjoy out on the town, this is your place! Don't come with the expectations of a grand five star hotel, but enjoy it for what it is... A clean, comfortable, friendly, modern hotel in a great location, this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Cool looks impair basic functionality”
Reviews.Author: creationwaits
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, very modern hotel, with an excellent location. Unfortunately, some of its cool looks impair basic function, which prevents me from recommending it to anyone who isn't traveling alone. Most of the problems are connected to the bathroom. First of all, there is no curtain or door to enclose the shower - instead, a solid glass wall blocks off the half of the shower closest to the faucet. There are two problems with this. First, you will inevitably splatter a lot of water onto the bathroom floor. Second, if you happen to turn on the shower at too high of a temperature, there will be no way for you to turn it off without scalding yourself. (We didn't do this, but I imagine other people have.) The other problem was the door to the bathroom - a semi-opaque glass sliding door that is offset from the bathroom wall by a couple of inches. This means, first, that you can see into the shower from the room. I suppose that might be titillating if you're traveling with the right person, but if you're with a child or friend it might just be awkward. Secondly, the door does absolutely nothing to muffle noises coming from the bathroom - and that's awkward for just about anybody. A couple more warnings - this hotel has rooms with two single beds. Beware of that when booking through services that allow you to name your own price - we ended up paying $15 per night to upgrade to a queen size bed. The hotel website also mentions a "nominal" charge for internet access - $40 per week is the cost (proportionally more if you pay by the day). And it isn't very fast, at least in our room - my Flickr uploads kept timing out. So, that's the bad. The good - well, it's clean and modern, as I said. The staff was friendly. The location, near Dundas square, the Toronto PATH, and a subway station, is excellent. The bathroom included shampoo, soap, and conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for a great location”
Reviews.Author: VWOttawa
Reviews.Content: The Bond Place Hotel is styled as a "European" hotel -- by which I mean, the rooms are smaller than what you might expect from other chains like the Marriott, and there's no storage space apart from a wardrobe, albeit well-equipped. The twin bed I had during my stay was comfortable enough, but soundproofing could use some work as the street noise was definitely audible. Wireless internet access is available in the rooms, but as a separate service; you can purchase access based on session, 24 hours or full week. The location is a block away from Yonge Street and Eaton Centre, and it's across the street from the Imperial Pub, so dining options aren't a problem. It's also one of the stops for the Airport Express shuttle service. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for families, especially with young children, but for singles or couples who are flying into Toronto to enjoy the Entertainment District, it's definitely one to consider for trip planning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Nice Decor”
Reviews.Author: beajolley
Reviews.Content: My partner picked out this hotel for a few nights in Toronto. We spent our first night there at the Royal York and I found that this hotel was much better for what we wanted. The location was much better than the Royal York, it's super close to the Subway as well as the Eaton's Centre. It was well priced, there was a nice cafe in the lobby to get our morning coffee and you can use the Internet for free on the computers in the lobby. I was really impressed with the rooms that are newly renovated and really nice. All in all, I was really impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Nice, Affordable”
Reviews.Author: fiset35
Reviews.Content: Affordable room just a one minute walk from the busy intersection of Yonge and Dundas, with a nice place to grab a beer and a bite with the Imperial Pub right across the street. This hotel was perfect for what I needed. Clean, comfortable QUIET rooms. Espresso bar on ground floor. Bond Place doesn't have all the bells and whistles of the four diamond hotels, but it's a nicely priced hotel that's fifty steps away from one of the busiest intersections in Canada. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The little Hotel that could...”
Reviews.Author: KnowAboutTravel
Reviews.Content: While searching for a boutique hotel in downtown Toronto, I was offered up the Bond Place. Lots of good reviews here at Trip Advisor and it's no small wonder. Located a few steps from one of Canada's busiest corners (Yonge & Dundas), the Bond Place is, what could best be described as, a newly renovated upscale hostel. The rooms are small, but adequate.. clean and affordably stylish. The staff was polite, attentive and helpful. I wouldn't hesitate to visit again. That said, if you're looking for an experience complete with indoor pool, spacious yet non-descript rooms and a 5 star restaurant, this isn't the place for you. But if you're looking for something affordable and a great place to drop your bags and rest your head at the end of the day, this is a great choice. After all, who spends time in their room anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: robjay2
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are tiny. The two single beds in the room were pushed up against the wall with barely any room to move about. The washroom also was very cramped. The 90s teal decor was a little much as well. This hotel's redeeming quality is it's proximity to Dundas Square and the Eaton Centre. Though, for a little more comfort in a hotel, I would be happy to walk a couple of blocks.

Reviews.Title: “The best value in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: EcoMerrickville
Reviews.Content: Great location, AMAZING rates and a beautiful property! If you book ahead of time online, the rates are unbelievable! The hotel is boutique-style, very modern, very well-maintained, decent exercise room, great espresso bar and friendly staff! All of this within a two-minute walk to the subway, a couple of blocks away form Yonge street and the Eaton Center and almost across the street from a movie theater.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but for the price was very good”
Reviews.Author: Creatto
Reviews.Content: I like it when a hotel puts an effort in trying to re-invent themselves, and the Bond Place seems like it is doing just that. I must confess that at first, I was a bit nervous about this hotel since It looked dated from the outside and got it for like $75 CAD / night, so I wasn't sure what I was going to get, so considering that I had lowered my expectations, this hotel managed to exceed them. On the up side, The rooms are clean and the furniture is modern and inviting. The space is interesting and I liked the ambience of my room. I got a room on the 16th floor, so it was quiet and comfortable. The rooms have flat-screen TVs, and the space was adequate. I also liked their Lobby area, and I found their staff friendly, acommodating and willing to help. On the down size, the bed was smaller than other hotels and the room is kind of small. The corridors on the floors are a bit dated, but other than that, the hotel did the trick! The best thing about this hotel though has to be the location. I did not need to ride the subway at all, it is super central, and you can get to most interesting places within a 20 min short and pleasant walk. Just keep in mind that because this hotel is cheap, it can attract some odd characters, but the staff managed to keep it all under control :)

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DUDU-BH
Reviews.Content: excellent location. front desk staff is helpfull. the room is quite small but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are true: a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Davy_Gam
Reviews.Content: I recently spent several nights at the Bond Place Hotel, largely because of the reviews on Tripadvisor. Those reviews did not steer me wrong. My room was immaculate and a study in fitting as much into a limited space without it feeling crowded. I was on the sixth floor and did not hear much in the way of street noise (though there is an elementary school close by and I could hear the children in the morning). The mattress was obviously new and the linen was crisp. Staff, from the front desk to housekeeping and the woman supervising housekeeping, was uniformly pleasant and helpful (though I would have preferred the desk clerk had told me of all the food courts in the neighborhood rather than recommmend to me a priceier bar restaurant). The Dundas Square neighborhood is indeed convenient, with its subway station and multiple eating and shopping possibilities. There was a brew pub around the corner and a dive bar across the street. My one complaint is that there is very limited space to put the car when checking in/out and loading/unloading. I would go back to this family run and recommended it to all, without hesitation, for its value and comfort. Your 'comfortable in the Big Smoke, eh' pal, Davy

Reviews.Title: “Great location..”
Reviews.Author: laura r
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in this hotel for a week. The location is really great because it is close to all the main attractions and has a huge shopping mall (Eaton Centre) very close by. We booked through Otel.com and had a prepaid voucher (which worked out perfectly!!). The hotel was clean and the rooms, even if small, are well furnished. We overlooked a backyard, which was a little noisy at times. Staff was always very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location put very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: AHMED81
Reviews.Content: the elevators are always busy and 1 of them is not working at all. the rooms are clean and the building was lately renovated. the noise is a common thing because the bathroom of other rooms can be heard in your room. it is good for short stay where you need to be in the center of every thing.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: AnnaCallus
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a weekend between the 25th and 27th November ... the staff were to nice and the room so comfy I just did not want to leave. The hotel is central but quiet and very clean. Good value for money and were a shot. I would definitely return. The underground stop "Dundas" is just 2 minutes from the lobby. A very good find!:)

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Joe G
Reviews.Content: Visited on 11/26/2011. Older bldg. but completely modern rooms,lobby etc.Rooms are small but immaculate with very comfortable bedding. Price $100per night [on7&8floors]with 2 single beds.Located near Dundas and Yonge, a great location in Downtown. Excellant value for short stays.V good tv but no wi fi in room but free internet access in lobby. Lite breakfast in lobby one morning was good. Parking available for $15 per across street.Service personel were all friendly and helpful.1 of 3 elevators were out of service causing slow service.Min. street noise on our floors with window open.

Reviews.Title: “A Cozy Hotel very well located in the Toronto Downtown”
Reviews.Author: AnaM11
Reviews.Content: Great location..very kind staff and enviroment. I enjoyed my stay! I will definitely come back again!:-)

Reviews.Title: “No better place to stay in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: RoseZinck
Reviews.Content: The prices are so amazing at The Bond Place I had doubts on just how great it would be and was so surprised by our room, the staff and amenities! The rooms are very Euro style, small/minimalist but so clean. White crisp linens on a very comfy bed, including white bedspread so YOU know it is changed regularly. Sound proof rooms ( just ask to be away from the elevator), large flat screen TV, fridge, coffee and machine. Superb friendly staff and very accommodating. The hotel is situated a very small block from The Eaton Centre on Yonge and Dundas which is the heart of the city. Fully recommend this hotel and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Emma F
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, conveniently located and great value. Service was very friendly. Only negative is very slow Wifi, which I could tolerate if I wasn't paying an additional $10 per day for access!

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: PEIsland_Gamz
Reviews.Content: We stayed Sept. 29 - Oct. 4. For what we paid, I debated rating this "very good". At $119/night before taxes (except the final night, when that rate was unavailable - $199), it was outstanding. Location is exceptional - basically a small city block from the Hard Rock Cafe, Dundas Square, and Eaton Centre and subway platforms. A couple of blocks and you can be on Yonge St., at several theatres, the World's Biggest Bookstore, the city's oldest diner "The Senator" (awesome breakfast and decor), etc. The room had hard surface finishes. Bed was comfortable. The room (a standard) was quite small room but very clean and great value. Great for a single person or couple that just want a clean, comfortable place to sleep and shower. It would be pretty claustrophobic to be in with a friend, or with a child along, etc. Also, the bathroom door was odd - again, not an issue travelling with hubby, but with someone else it would have been uncomfortable. The door slides, but isn't hidden - it just slides along the outside wall of the bathroom and covers the doorway opening, so it doesn't close tightly. This means any sounds/odors and you can peek in to see what's happening if you wanted to. Didn't check out the fitness centre or any meeting facilities. We were in town for pleasure and also for a meeting for me. The location was perfect for that as it was within two blocks of the business tower. We have been to Toronto many times and didn't make many requests of the Front desk staff, but when we were departing they were very helpful with arranging our early morning transportation. We would definitely return to this hotel if we are travelling solo or as a couple again. A clean, comfortable hotel at this location for the price - excellent!

Reviews.Title: “A winning formula for a budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugVietnam
Reviews.Content: Other budget hotels should copy the winning formula of the Bond Place Hotel. The rooms are small but I had the most comfortable bed I have had in a hotel anywhere. The rooms have all the essentials but none of the frills, and this is what most people want. There was an ironing and ironing board, a coffee machine, ice bucket, empty fridge to fill with your own food and drink, a large flat screen TV, and a bench under the window with a phone and office chair. In the bathroom, the shower was over the bath, and there were 3 large shelves (often overlooked in hotels), a large wash basin (useful for doing laundry), a large mirror, hair dryer, shampoo, body lotion, soap and shower cap. There were wooden floors, a luggage rack and heating and cooling. On the ground floor next to reception was a bright lobby and an excellent coffee shop used by the locals. This was a great place to have a healthy breakfast, catch up with a newspaper and enjoy their excellent coffee. There were also a couple of computers for guests use and free safe deposit boxes behind the reception desk. There is a dedicated concierge to answer all your questions of how to get around Toronto etc. Best of all was the location right next to Eation Square, the subway station and a myriad of department stores with food courts where you could bring back food to the comfort of your hotel room. Although it is located on a main street I was unaware of any traffic noise. The maintenance man came up to replace a light globe and showed me how to work the TV and heating and didn't expect a tip. Room service even came up with a box of tissues when I developed a cold to save me going out in the cold October weather. The bus from Pearson International airport drops you right at the door and if you are going on a day trip to Niagara Falls, the bus collects you and drops you off. This was the best value for money hotel I think I have ever stayed in and I have visited over 40 countries, some of them many times. Congratulations Bond Place. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Dre0303
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right downtown and is attractively priced, the rooms are modern and tidy, but what you get is on the small side in terms of space (by North American Standards). The rooms have been renovated and a standard room has a queen size bed and about 3 feet clearance space all around. I didn't like the sliding door for the bathroom, if you are modest, this migth be an issue. The place is clean and efficient but a bit small with 2 people trying to get dressed and running around in the morning. The floors are laminate, the furniture modern (like IKEA), so you don't have a sense of luxury, but the price is really good, the location ideal for downtown Toronto. It's great for busnisess people and ideal if travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nickiford
Reviews.Content: I was encouraged to book by the online pictures of this newly renovated hotel as well as it's proximity to the Eaton's centre. When we arrived, the room that we had pre-booked and paid for was no longer available. We were a party a 3 and had booked a Queen room with two singles. We were told we were being upgraded to a Double Queen room...but we really wanted the three beds. They did not have any available, the manager came out and apologized, I asked for complimentary internet and a late checkout and received both as compensation for their overbooking. The internet is normally a charge of $10 which is completely ridiculous, it should be included. It was excellent wireless access, fast and easy to log in. The room was very nice, very clean and exactly what we were hoping it would be. The underground parking was $15 located across the road, it is only good until 12:00 pm the next day, we didn't leave until 1 pm and were charged an extra $5. I would stay here again anytime we are in town. It was a quick one block to the Eaton's Centre and lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for downtown.”
Reviews.Author: SimonW14
Reviews.Content: OK, so the rooms are small - but if you're there to visit the city & not just to lounge about in your room then that shouldn't matter. You're only 5 minutes walk from Dundas Station & 2 minutes from the streetcar stop. My room had recently been refurbed & was very clean. However, wifi should be free. Probably the place could use a breakfast room but there's plenty of places to eat nearby (I suggest Frans for breakfast). Front desk staff efficient & friendly without being overbearing. Cleaners nice if you bump into them. If you like starspotting, the BT studio is just round the block.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ronald v Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights. Rooms were clean, well maintained. Staff were friendly, and helpful. Only one draw back for me, and this depends on how important internet access is to you, of which it is extremely important to me. One has to pay for internet usage, there is no free wifi. Had I paid more attention for this, which I assumed there would be free wifi, I would not have booked the room. If you are just looking for a nice room, close to downtown, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Grand and a good location!”
Reviews.Author: Lisao82
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the price at first when we booked through hotels.com, but when we wanted to stay a few extra days the price for 1 night was practically what we paid for the 5 days we originally booked! In fairness its a basic hotel but spotlessly clean and a great location, just 30 seconds to Dundas Square! I would stay again if they kept the price reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: k0ke
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is right next to the Eaton Centre so great for shopping and on the rail network. You can even walk here from Union Station if you are feeling energetic. The rooms are compact but very new and contain everything you need for a short stay - big flat screen TVs, air conditioning, bar fridge, brand new bathroom. The hotel does not have a formal restaurant but the cafe downstairs sells great coffee and snacks. There is a small gym with a couple of machines and some weights, enough to get in a bit of a workout and there are internet stations in the lobby. The airport shuttle stops here and there was a tour booking service. Would stay here again. Ideal if you are just in Toronto to check out Niagara etc.

Reviews.Title: “Its a Hostel”
Reviews.Author: jean t
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small, there is no pool or gym, the corridors and interior are very shabby. The rooms are clean except the windows are so filthy you cannot see out. Would stay for a night, if running the marathon or passing through on route to somewhere, but other than that its uncomfortable being shut in a cell.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a short break in Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: MagsaLondon
Reviews.Content: The Bond Place hotel is well situated for the visitor who wants to pack lots into a short break. It is centrally located and a short walk from the tour bus stop and "the hub" of life in downtown Toronto. The reception staff were extremely helpful when we were planning our action packed days and with giving directions and advice.Our room was clean and comfortable and we compliment our housekeeper! Crisp white sheets and plenty of fluffy white towels....just what we needed at the end of a hectic day! One minor gripe is that although there is hanging space there are no drawers to store clothes and we had to use our suitcase for storage...not a big deal if it's only for a few days. Use the Bond Place if you want to maximize your time in Toronto as a holiday maker!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: sleepyash
Reviews.Content: If you want location and conscious of the budget, this is it. Despite the rooms being recently renovated, they are poorly done. The walls and doors are very thin and you can hear next door if they are loud. The interior design is odd. The bathrooms have 90â€™s looking cubicle shelves combined with the modern fittings. What was really bizarre (room 1404), was a broken 60 year old heater still fixed behind the bathroom vanity, where the tradesman mustâ€™ve found it too hard to remove. Situated next to the Square, it is certainly an ideal location, however it borders an undesirable area where we saw a homeless person having a sleep outside the hotelâ€™s front entrance. One night at around 3am, a helicopter was landing what appeared to be the nearby hospital - it was quite a racket. The next morning I merely enquired if there was a hospital near by, but the reception girl was adament my experience was a passing train! A suspended object 300m in the air with flashing lights, didnt quite match a train to me!! Hilarious. I have seen some budget hotels in my time, but this takes the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but well located”
Reviews.Author: Guillou_Guillou
Reviews.Content: It was our second stay at this hotel (1st time December 2010). To be fair, the hotel is good for the price and it location. However, the staff is not very friendly so I did not like to deal with them but the room keepers were always very nice and helpful. I recommend this place if you are looking for a economical place to stay. Internet not included so must consider adding $10 per day to the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small but great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Puzzpouding
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Bond place Hotel are quite small. They are however very clean. The hotel was recently renovated: no carpet in the room (wood floor), flat screen tv, and a modern look that is rarely seen in hotels. And the beds are very comfortable. Very good location, right downtown Toronto. The only drawback is that you have to pay for wifi in your room. If you prefer not to pay 8,99 per 24h for internet, there are 2 imacs in the lobby. Overall, a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is just right EXCEPT no free wifi!”
Reviews.Author: Benicio
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel 5 stars if only they didn't have painful user-pays internet access. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and modern. The bed was super comfortable. There were more tv channels than I knew what to do with. The location is smack bang in the heart of Toronto. The cafe downstairs make a mean espresso Why oh why is the internet not included? In this day and age, that simply is not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Julep
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot, great staff, very nice and well organized room. The only thing very noisy toilet when flushing but that did not ruin our stay. We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly.”
Reviews.Author: Amanda L
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, October 22nd and 23rd. I'll start off with the good. The location couldn't be any better. You are a 3 minute walk from the doors of the Eaton Centre, minutes from the Subway and street cars, and only a $12 dollar cab ride from downtown attractions like the CN Tower and Air Canada Centre. The room was small, but *mostly* clean (more on that later). Our plane got in around 12, so we checked in early with no problems and the people at the front desk seemed pleasant. You need to insert your room key to use the elevator which is a nice safety feature. The room was nicely renovated and the bed was comfortable and surprisingly enough, we had no problem sleeping at night because there was no noise coming from Dundas square. The bad: The lobby stinks like burnt coffee at all times, the restaurant/cafe thing that is in the lobby is overpriced for the quality of the food. The ugly: This made me cringe. We brought our suitcases up to our room and left them there as we went to explore Kensington market (which is a 5 minute ride away) and came back to have a nap before dinner. I pulled down the sheets and what did I find? Yellow stains in multiple spots all over my side of the bed. Disgusting. My fiance went to go downstairs to complain and there was a cleaning lady in the hallway so he just got a new sheet from her and told her what was wrong. She apologized and offered to put the sheet on for us but we just did it ourselves. The hotel needs a pool, that is the only improvement I would suggest. It is a great stay for the price and the location can't be beat. I would stay here again for sure, I would just make sure the sheets were clean before I got into bed. The rooms are small, but they are fine if you don't plan on spending much time in your room. Ours was only for sleeping and getting ready so we had no issue with the small room, and they look exactly as they do on the website, no false advertising there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, but a bit quirky / noisy”
Reviews.Author: LoveTimeshares
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bond Place Hotel the night before we were to run the Scotiabank Toronto Waterfront Marathon. The hotel is nicely renovated. The rooms have new laminate flooring (which actually feels cleaner than a hotel room with carpet), comfortable beds and good amenities. The shower was one of the best hotel showers we've ever had! We stayed on the eighth floor, and found it to be very noisy due to the downtown location. We can't complain, though, since the downtown location (for the marathon) was the very reason that we had selected the hotel. I slept well with earplugs. My husband had no earplugs, and said he could hear people down on the street all night long. We tried to watch TV, but it was stuck on an X-rated channel. We called down to report the problem, and we were told that someone would come up to address the problem. No one ever came. The next morning, we spoke to the front desk about it. They said there was nothing they could do about it, even though we essentially had no television for the duration of our stay. They said they would "speak to the manager" regarding a possible reimbursement to our credit card for a portion of the hotel rate, but we never heard anything. One other curious thing - there are sliding doors (vs. hinged, locking ones) for the bathrooms in each hotel room. We found that they were VERY noisy / squeaky (thereby waking people up if you use the bathroom during the night), and they have a 1-inch gap between the door and the wall - goodbye privacy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: alison h
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near the Eaton Center and close to the subway. The rooms were spotless and the maids were pleasant and accommodating. We needed an accessibility room and asked for three other rooms that were quiet. There was no traffic noise although some of us were on the 2nd floor. The front desk staff were very helpful, especially Paul, who went out of his way to accommodate our needs. The price was very reasonable for such a great location and we would definitely recommend staying at the Bond Place hotel.

Reviews.Title: “European style budget hotel - to be recommended”
Reviews.Author: dgf106
Reviews.Content: Although many older reviews say sth different, Bond Place is a very good choice in Toronto. It is centrally located, staff is very helpful and friendly and the indoor Espresso Bar offers good Italian style breakfast at very reasonable prices. The hotel can be compared to French Ibis or German Motel One hotels. The newly refurbished rooms are stylish and offer all you will need for a city trip. It fits European likes and needs for a hotel of its category. The Airport Express Bus stop right in front of the door is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “location was great shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller48915
Reviews.Content: The location was central and some of the staff were pleasant but overall not a great experience. I had to ask to speak to the manager to get a kettle for my room as I'm not a coffee drinker...It was noisy all night long and didn't get any sleep in the 4 days I was there. My room was directly opposite the lift and people were coming out of the lift shrieking and screaming drunk at 3am. As I was studying I asked to be moved and was told no. It was the worst experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: kelly s
Reviews.Content: For the second year in a row my friend and I stayed here for caribana weekend. It is conveniently located close to amenities, the subway and being that it is right in Yonge and Dundas square, it is right in the middle of the action. Great price, perfect location! We will definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Newbie_Vacationer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bond Place for one night on a business trip. Front desk staff are very friendly and professional. I was also pleasantly surprised that I had been bumped up to a business suite on the top 18th floor, which provided a very good view of the city. The room is very clean and contemporary with a big glass sliding door as entry to the washroom. Bed was comfortable. The only complaint I would have is that the room was quite small and thus the air conditioner is right adjacent to the bed. I easily fixed this by sliding the chair up close to the unit. The hotel is quite close to the action, being a block away from the north east corner of Eaton Centre mall, AMC theatre, and a bunch of restaurants. I also found that you can get a discount by going through their Facebook page. Definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, clean but functional rooms”
Reviews.Author: chambelle
Reviews.Content: Eaton Centre is just a few minutes walk away. Neighbourhood is quite touristic and vivid. Other interesting areas are near by. Wlan only free of charge in the lobby. Rooms were clean and reasonably priced. Windows could have been cleaner - despite that the outlook was gret. Everything needed is there, what we liked is that there was no carpet on the floors. A/C worked pretty well, possibly too well for the person sleeping next to it - quite windy.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep”
Reviews.Author: Norcanman
Reviews.Content: The hotel has undergone a reno and shows as a modern retro look. The lobby is not particularly inviting but I wasn't planning on sleeping there anyway. The small coffee shop is a nice surprise - good espresso drinks and fresh baked goods. No need to find a Starbuck's when you can get better here. The biggest issue I had was noise. I asked for a quiet room and was placed in a room facing Bond St. At one a.m. I was awakened by garbage trucks backing up, then using their hydraulic compactors. Later it was sirens. At 3 a.m. there was a helicopter hovering just outside and later around 4:30 it returned and proceeded to land and shut down. Evetually I got up around 5:30 just because I couldn't sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: elansyd
Reviews.Content: Rooms are exactly as described on the hotel website. Staff are friendly. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: Katmo79
Reviews.Content: The hotel has recently been renovated. It is located quite centrally next to Yonge/Dundas Square, at a block from Hard Rock CafÃ©. So expect a bit of noise from the street even at night, you are in the middle of the city. My room brand new, very clean, with flatscreen TV & free Internet! Oh and if you are wondering what to do in the city ask the Concierge, Donna, she is amazing! She helped me book tickets to the Royal Alexander Theatre and reserve a meal on a Friday night at the CN Tower in no time ;)

Reviews.Title: “Small, modern, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: phoenix71
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it's convenient location and reasonable rates. The rooms are small but very clean and well designed. Having spent time in Japan small rooms no longer bother me but I no this is an issue for some so be warned. As for service every staff member that we ran into from the janitor to the manager was friendly, respectful and extremely helpful. On several occasions staff would press the elevator call button for us when they saw us approach. The location cannot be beat. A block from the Dundas metro station, 2 from Eaton's Centre, 2 or 3 from the bus terminal and lots of restaurants all around. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, staff and location. Very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Joan C
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Deluxe Double/Twin Room for three nights with two friends and would definitely come back again. Although the exterior is very plain and the hall carpets are rather ugly, everything else was great: friendly, helpful and courteous staff, extremely clean, super location, very comfortable beds, good security. In short, great value!

Reviews.Title: “Always Pleasant & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: NorthernerP1B
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel anywhere from 2 to 6 times a year and I have always enjoyed my time there. The staff: Sam, Zia, and Ariana are very courteous and pleasant to deal with. If I ever need something, it is provided and I have never had to complain about noise from other rooms. I have had to complain about noise at other hotels. As well, I really like the central location and convenience for all my shopping and dining needs. The rooms are very nice and clean, especially since the recent renovations. It is also always nice to have access to the gym for a workout.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and more location!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth F
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one block over from Dundas and Younge Square which was an unexpected bonus as we had no idea on what to expect. The hotel is older and has fairly small rooms, having said that, they are very well appointed, making use of every inch of space and clean. We stayed for three nights in the Business Queen bed room on the fourth floor at the very end of the hall and it was quiet. We could not hear too much outside noise or from other rooms. What we did hear were the exhaust fans but it was a constant whirring type of noise, did not bother us at all. Our friends were on the same floor farther down the hall and saw out onto Dundas St, which had quite a bit of road noise. It has been our experience that just about any hotel located in an older downtown will have small rooms. We have run into it in New York, Rome and Venice... and some of those rooms cost a heck of a lot more. The front desk was great about a later check out as our flight was much later in the day and kept our luggage once we checked out. Very accommodating staff. On sight there is a small coffee shop open at 7am for pastries, breakfast sandwiches and the sorts remaining open for lunch the the later afternoon with an assortment of sandwiches closing at 7pm... was handy for a quick espresso and croissant in the morning or a snack. Definitely would stay at the Bond Place Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishindependent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at this hotel. Toronto film festival was on and we were worried that prices might be inflated which they were not. It is not a luxury property but it is clean and bright and the location is excellent(two minutes walk to Dundas Square). The rooms have all that you would need and the staff are courteous and friendly. We did not eat there so cannot comment on the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - what a steal”
Reviews.Author: arthurlord
Reviews.Content: Don't be dissuaded by the exterior - it's newly remodeled and very nice inside. Very clean, comfy rooms. Extremely helpful staff. Amazing location-- at half or even a third of what the other big brand name hotels in the area charge. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near Eaton Centre area”
Reviews.Author: DML08
Reviews.Content: Great place if you just want to put down your head at nighy. Close to everything downtown. Small but very clean hotel with friendly and helpfull staff! Ariana at front desk was so nice and helpfull during my stay. Thanks...very much appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with modern and clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Dan_H_10
Reviews.Content: - Pleasantly surprised, had a really pleasant stay. - Front desk helpful despite being really busy - Good pub opposite the hotel - Near Dundas station metro - If travelling from the airport take the 192 Airport Express to Kipling Station and change onto the Metro to Dundas for $3 (bargain) - Gym OK - No free WIFI! Come on Bond Place don't be tight and make me go to Starbucks!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Cwz6455
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend in Toronto, found a good rate at this hotel (rates around town were elevated due to the Film Festival). The building didn't look to be much from the outside but upon entering our room it was comfortable and modern. The staff was very warm and courteous as we arrived very early and were unable to get into our room immediately, but the staff allowed us to freshen up in the bathroom and leave our bags so we could explore the city until the room was ready. Once we returned to check in as well as when we needed toiletries or concierge assistance, every staff member was pleasant and helpful. I believe the employee's name was Zia who helped us with our bags several times, as well as contacting our restaurant to find the proper subway stop. Thrilled with our stay here, will strongly consider on any future trips to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would return”
Reviews.Author: Smeg21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 7 nights over August/Sept. Check in was quick and easy, 3 elevators up to the rooms which took no time to come. You need to insert your card to select a room which gets a little annoying when there are a lot of ppl in the lift! Lobby was nice but i did not agree with the charge for the internet.. 5 dollars for a day, i think it would be so much fairer to create an account and have 5 dollars for 24 hours as we only used the net an hour at a time but ended up spending 5dollars each day. I hear the wifi is also charged. The rooms were very nice, compact but big enough to facilitate us for our 7 night stay. The only thing i really disliked about the room was the sliding door on the toilet... it really doesn't give much privacy. It would be nice to have been able to get room service or breakfast in the hotel but they don't offer this. We had coffee and cake in the cafe once and that was really nice. The Hotel is in a Great location, we got the air bus to and from the hotel as it stops right outside at least every 30 minutes. Right beside eaton centre, subway, multiple restaurants and many other Amenities.. We stayed on the 15th floor which gave us good views but still heard some traffic (Nothing that would keep you up at night but it was there) Also we were not facing Dudas square so im not sure what the noise is like on the other side of the building.. we walked by Dundas square every night and the only time we heard loud music was a Friday night. Comfy beds (stayed in a double) and good air con although a little tricky for us europeans to switch off at times!! Its located right beside the bed so could be a little irritating for the person sleeping right next to it! Very small complaints on this place, would def return.

Reviews.Title: “Very unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: Gillblackuk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great location. That is about the only thing going for it. The staff are a reflection of the management team and clearly the lack of leadership skills and professionalism let's the hotel down considerably. Upon check in we were not advised that any credit would be taken from the credit card. This was not the case despite the whole holiday being booked through a travel agent, there was no need for my card details to be taken!!!!!! Arrived back in the uk to find I could not withdraw any money as this so called hotel were holding Â£265 of our money for no reason or without being informed upon check in or out. Upon speaking to the reception manager his response was "I didn't check you in". From working in the catering and hotel industry I found this appalling and would never stay in this hotel again as nobody ever seems to know what they are doing. Nor would I recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely time here”
Reviews.Author: dorothy90
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days here at end of August. A great central hotel, close to Eaton Centre for shopping, Dundas Square for street and cinema entertainment plus Hard Rock Cafe. The Bus station is only a block away. I was given a warm welcome at reception and was very pleased with my room which was spacious, clean and comfy. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mdTravelerz
Reviews.Content: Our vacation plans this year included a 2 night, first time visit to Toronto. We wanted to experience downtown Toronto and so we selected the Bond Place Hotel based on its central location at Dundas Square and the fact that it was newly renovated. This turned out to be a great selection for us. Not only was the hotel in a good location, it turned out to be a great place to stay. Without a doubt, the staff at this place were the friendliest and most helpful we encountered throughout our journeys. We knew nothing about Toronto and we got great advice on where and how to get around. Their service was A+++. Our room was small, but modern, very functional and most important of all, clean. Instead of an old carpet lying on the floor, there were beautiful wood floors in the room. Instead of a big desk, there was a long shallow counter lining the window with plenty of room to spread out maps, literature and laptop. The AC outlet was obviously and conveniently placed for recharging all the portable electronics (there was no searching under tables and beds). The queen bed was very comfortable and we ended up oversleeping on the second night. We liked this hotel very much especially for the great staff that ran the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated”
Reviews.Author: luvtomovetosouthwest
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and they were still in the midst of their renovation. I got the business queen room and it is very comfortable. The furnishings are modern, minimalist design. The rates are very reasonable if you book in advance. Hopefully, they would have completed the renovations by now. I must say that the room we had was a lot cleaner than other higher rated hotels I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jessica E
Reviews.Content: Bond Place hotel was very clean and comfortable. It was a small room which we did not mind as we are two friends travelling around, but adults may mind this. There is no free wifi which there should be. It is in a great location, right by Dundas square and the Eaton Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located and recommended”
Reviews.Author: christiana_eva
Reviews.Content: It is a boutique hotel which was in the process of renovation when we went there for 2 nights and the hotelâ€™s logo was not even visible from outside. Location Located in the center of Toronto, Bond Place is practically on the Dundas-Yonge Square opposite Eaton Center with a subway station nearby. The area is full of shops, restaurants and cafes but although it is a central location, it is rather unsafe to walk around. There are also plentiful parking spots around the hotel with different prices but the hotel offers its own parking lot underground across the street and therefore we chose the safest and cheapest solution. Room Our room was brand new on the 13th floor, slightly narrow but super clean. Wireless internet has to be purchased and the whole building is non-smoking. Housekeeping and front desk service was very good. We would return to this hotel if we go back to Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RB_from_VA
Reviews.Content: After reading some mixed reviews, I was a little concerned about staying here but those concerns quickly went away after checking in. A very friendly front desk allowed me to check in early and I found the room . . . interesting. Very European and as someone else wrote, a bit of Ikea. I've never seen hardwood floors in a hotel room before but it made no difference to me. I must have had a remodeled room since everything looked new. Though the room was a bit small, it was clean. Soap, shampoo and lotion was provided along with a hairdryer and coffee maker. A nice surprise was the mini fridge in the room. My room was facing a parking lot and alley so it was rather quiet at night. The bed seemed new and was very comfortable. I read some comments here about rude staff. Either I got lucky or I had different people to deal with. I found the staff extremely friendly and helpful - from the front desk, to the concierge to the housekeeping staff, I was always greeted with a smile. My only complaint was that on one Sunday morning, I did not have hot water - just lukewarm - but it was fine the other days. Overall, I was very pleased with the Bond Place and with its excellent location and rates, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charged my credit card twice for the room. Disgusted by service.”
Reviews.Author: sw224
Reviews.Content: This trip was PREPAID through expedia/hotwire and a charge had been placed on my credit card for the room. When I checked in I confirmed this with the front desk who pleasantly told me my room was paid for already. Upon check out, the same guy and his assistant now told me they were unable to understand how the expedia booking goes through and therefore needed to charge me again. Needless to say I am furious. I have now paid $250 for a room which was worth $100 at best. Having stayed in many places in Toronto my earnest recommendation: Stay somewhere else! Their decision to charge me twice was illegal and I will continue to dispute it. Do yourself a favour, stay somewhere else. The bathroom doors leave an inch open so there is no privacy and the hallways provide a very creepy and unsafe atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value with Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: MichiganBanjoMan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Bond many times in the past, attracted especially by its convenient location. Apparently some of the rooms have been renovated recently, and during our most recent stay we were pleased to have one of them. Although small and a bit cramped, the style is reminiscent of Ikea, with clean, appealing lines. Oddly, however, there was no luggage rack in the room, and there were no hooks or towel racks in the bathroom. The shower had no ledge or soap holder, so there was no place to put the shampoo. Inexplicably, however, the shower presented two fixed dispensers of hair conditioner. Wi-fi is anything but free; it's very expensive -- a policy left over from the Dark Ages. We were offered a "special" combination of parking and breakfast. The breakfast consisted of a microwaved bagel festooned with a pre-cooked egg and a piece of cheese. We asked about substituting a muffin for the bagel, but that was not allowed. You might as well walk a few blocks up Yonge Street for an Egg McMuffin and free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: Karine P
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst night I have ever spent in a hotel! There are helicopters taking off and landing on the roof of a nearby building (the hospital?) at any time of the day AND NIGHT. While this noise can be tolerated during the day, it is a very different story when you hear it at 3:30 am. This hotel should provide ear plugs to its guests! The Business queen room is very small, poorly decorated and the pillows are hard as rock. I will not come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Larajeanp
Reviews.Content: Great deal for downtown Toronto right off of Dundas Square. Remodeling was nice. Hallways still looked a little sketchy but the rooms were as nice as you could ask for. Would recommend again.

Reviews.Title: “good value for downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: snoogle
Reviews.Content: It was a simple room, but nice, the mattress has too hard but other than that it was a nice room, clean and comfortable. Its a great location right in downtown Toronto and you get good bang for your buck in terms of cost and location. Its mere steps away from multiple restaurants, the subway station, and various shopping. Biggest downside is that they charge for wifi access (at a ridiculous $10 per day!), there's not many hotels that do that anymore but sadly this is one of them. The staff were very friendly and helpful, I would stay here again.
