Reviews.Title: “Bathroom door is completely inadequate and unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: BeenTo7Continents
Reviews.Content: We took a girls' weekend to Toronto. We picked this hotel SOLELY based on the fact that they had triple rooms so we could each have our own bed and no one would have to sleep on a sofa bed. We booked months in advance. When we got there, they were out of triple rooms. We were given a queen bed and a sofa bed. For the price we paid, no one should have to sleep on a sofa bed. The bathroom door is "modern"--glass that isn't completely clear. However, you can still see outlines of what's going on in the bathroom if the light is on in there (and who wants to go to the bathroom in the dark?) Also, the bathroom door doesn't close all the way: it slides in _front_ of the opening and leaves a 1 inch gap all around the door. No privacy of any kind. Their attempt to be stylish didn't work, this was impractical design that's completely wrong to experiment with in a bathroom. The phone in the room switched itself from "regular" to "speaker" and then hung up on us more than once. I had no response to the feedback card I left with all of that information even though I gave my email.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dmb987654321
Reviews.Content: A good place to stay in Toronto, right in the city centre and only 15-20 mins walk to the water. Room was smallish, but I thought good value. Didn't try the breakfast, so can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Boutique Hotel, conveniently located, reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: darcibuoy
Reviews.Content: Totally renovated small hotel located @ Dundas Sq. in the heart of downtown Toronto walking distance to shopping, restaurants and attractions. Well appointed, quiet, adequate queen room with contemporary design, flat screen TV, frig and desk with cupboard but no drawers. Bed was very comfortable but felt the pillows could be upgraded. Service charges for all phone calls and internet. Small lobby area with Cafe. No pool and did not use fitness area. All staff friendly and accommodating and would definitely return for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, perfect location, newly renovated!”
Reviews.Author: JamesM80
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay in downtown Toronto without breaking the bank. Between their reasonable parking rates and low room prices, this is the one to stay at. Parking is just across the street and it is less than a block to the Eaton centre and Dundas Square. Movie theatres close and it is easy to get around to other locations in the downtown area. I like it!

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: travel4dawah
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent as its very close to Dundas subway station and Eaton center (one of the biggest malls in the city). Ofcourse the downside to that is there are many bums lurking around the area. The hotel is aesthetically pleasing to the eyes. I had a King bed and the bed took up most of the room. One of the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in to date. The hotel is kept very well so it is tolerable. I would not stay there at their regular price but will be happy to stay there if I can get a bargain off the net again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service and suspected bed bugs and spiders”
Reviews.Author: ElysiaMarie
Reviews.Content: Our daughter has been ill and we had stayed at this hotel for the easy access to Sick Kids. Our first stay was ok. The room was outdated, and the hallways stunk horribly but other than that, I had no complaints. Our second stay was a complete nightmare. Our daughter had an MRI scheduled for 7 30 am the next day, so we had to wake up at 6 am. The night before, we asked for extra towels, soap and shampoo so we could bathe our daughter, and then shower ourselves. 20 minutes later, a service man smelling like motor oil came to our door and shoved at me a tiny bottle of shampoo. I explained that we had ordered three shampoos, three soaps and three extra towels. He was running away from our door and into the elevator before I finished the word shampoo. We waited for an hour and a half, and guess what? No one came too bring towels or soap, or other shampoos. (Not saying that I would have used towels that someone obviously covered in some sort of oil anyways) Also, to top it off, our telephone in the room did not work so we had to go downstairs to ask for the extras to begin with. So 7 30pm rolls in, and our daughter hasn't eaten dinner, and no one has returned with towels, or to fix the phone, so we go down again to the front desk. I told them we were stepping outside so my partner and I could have a cigarette, and would prefer if they didn't send anyone in our room while we were not in it (as we have expensive jewelery in our bags) When we got back to our room, two towels were placed on our bathroom sink... with black smears on them. Luckily, none of our personal items were taken that I can think of. However it is now pushing 8 pm, and we still have not been able to go out and get dinner since we were waiting on towels to begin with... and we can't order food as the phone does not work. A few minutes later, another "service worker" brought us a new phone... we tried to order a pizza to the room, but the phone died in the middle of our order. We then take our daughter in her pajamas, go to the front desk to tell them how incompetent this hotel is, and have to walk down Young st to grab a slice of pizza for dinner, it is now pushing 9 pm in the evening! Needless to say, it was 10 30 before we were back at the hotel, done eating and washing up, and in bed. And our daughter had to wait till 9pm to eat. Now, here's the real kicker. I cannot sleep cause I am constantly itching in bed! Feels like little bugs all over my body. Found the telltale signs of bedbugs (little black dried blood balls) in the sheets. Also found a spider near my daughters bed the next morning. After the MRI we go to catch the elevator to check out. And a housekeeper immediately presses the "door close" button when the elevator opened on our front door right in my 9 year old daughters face! We check out and the young lady at the front desk informs us that we have four telephone calls that we have to pay for! After trying to explain that the phone did not work, she just kept repeating that we would have to pay. I asked to speak to the manager. I told him this exact story. He covered the $1.46 phone charges, and nothing else. Horrible customer service! That night should have been free considering the hardships. I would much rather sleep on a urine covered cardboard box than stay at the Bond Place again. At least the homeless people will have better manners, and I would have saved $180. Normally, I would not bother writing a review, but this place is so horrible, I feel I have a duty to warn anyone considering staying here. I am taking my valuable time to warn you with complete seriousness and honesty. I highly discourage anyone from ever staying here, unless you like the worst service possible, and bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Milnergirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bond Place hotel last June while on my way to a Conference in Ottawa since I wanted to see Toronto. the Location is great very close to the Eaton Centre since Im from the Caribbean and it was my first time there I would suggest you use it as a Landmark. My room was great but the smell of paint I couldnt deal with since the hotel was being refurbished at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kawp
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in mid-June -- hallways were humid, dark, and stuffy. The hotel room was bright and had been recently updated; however, the air conditioner was startlingly loud. Would recommend this hotel if you won't be spending a lot of time in your room and want to be right downtown. Extremely convenient -- close to numerous restaurants, shopping, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would go back”
Reviews.Author: TheBallards
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly helpful staff. Recently refurbished therefore room was lovely. Plasma tv on wall and v.comfy bed. We were on 10th floor and heard no noise. Very clean. Would certainly recommend this hotel to others and would stay here again when we return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: StoutGnome
Reviews.Content: We booked on the hotel's own web site and ended up paying about $100 per night for a queen bed, which is very good value for your money at this location. The hotel sits right on Dundas Square, with Ryerson University right across the street. Floors are quiet and smoke-free, the AC cools the room very well, and the rooms, although small, feel very modern, clean and neat. Comfortable beds, TV and cable work well. Staff seemed very friendly to us. Front desk was helpful with any questions we had and with ordering a cab for us. Cleaning staff is friendly and they will respect the do not disturb sign. We were attending a wedding and just wanted to spread our stuff out and not have anything moved around. Some reviewers didn't like the $15 per day parking garage, which I can sort of understand if you're not used to that sort of thing. Considering the location, I found it a good alternative to outdoor parking. If you prefer outdoor parking, there is a 24 hour pay lot (not affiliated with the hotel) on the other side of the street although I don't know the price. All in all a great stay. We were very happy in spite of the concert going in Dundas Square the weekend we visited. That's hardly the hotel's fault. Be advised that the hotel does not have any complimentary meals. You can buy breakfast/lunch type food from a cafe on the lobby floor, but we didn't try it since there are so many coffee and bagel places around Toronto. They also charge for wifi, but there are a couple of computers in the lobby that you can use for free.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sleeptight10
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location -close to Eaton, Dundas sub-way, tram lines, coach station and is also the drop off point for the Airport Express bus. Rooms were renovated, bathroom absolutely new, comfortable bed. Have not been to the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this hotel- great location, rooms clean and mordern”
Reviews.Author: missdixiedoo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Bond Place Hotel for 9 nights at the end of June 2011. On arriving via the Toronto Airport Express (well worth the $34) we where dropped right outside the hotel- couldn't of asked for more after a tiring journey! Yes first impressions of the hotel wasn't great but we can look beyond the current 'facelift' the hotel appears to be going through. The reception staff (front desk) where efficient, polite, friendly and happy to suggest places of interest. Our room 601 was located on the (surprise surprise the 6th floor) next to the lift. Thought this may be an issue with noise, however the only thing that I heard during our 9 nights was a 'squeaking' of the lift going up and down- not really an issue with either one of us. We booked a twin room (as cheaper than the double) and actually really glad we did! its was really hot and humid during our trip and I think being stuck together in a double bed would of been horrid! The room does have A/C however the unit is on the floor directly next to one of the beds so unless you want to wake up with icicles forming on your nose you cant sleep with it on- real shame due to the heat. The room was on the small side as I believe everyone else has mentioned howerver you have to bear in mind you are slap bang in the centre of a city so we had no problems with the room or the amminties in it- A/C, large flat screen TV, coffee making unit, and clean towels every day. The maid service was very good; the room on our return at the end of the day was cleaned, beds made and bathroom cleaned and bins emptied. We had no view of Dundas Sq and did ring down to reception to ask for a change of room however the hotel was fully booked until the last 3 nights. The hotel where more than happy to move us then- we decided that as we where only in the room for a short period of time the view was not that important. There is no 'eatery' as such in the hotel but there is a nice coffee lounge and of course you are only meters away from the Eaton Centre with its numerous fast food units and the PATH system that is a labyrinth of shops and food courts. Eating out can be expensive plus when you are on a 'budget' you have to factor in the tax being added on to the ticket price. We like many others found the food court in Dundas & Younge subway station a real life saver- there is a fab bagel shop on the lower floor that do cheap bagels and tea/coffee for about $4-5 each. Would recommend 'Eggspection' on Younge Street for lunch/brunch, 'The SenatorDiner'- Victoria Street(a lovely old fashioned diner with booths) just around the corner from the hotel for a good fried breakfast, and for a really cheap and delicious dinner head back to Younge street to Paramount restaurant (authentic Lebanese food and bakery) or The Asian Bowl' - super for price and quality of food! There is loads to do and see while in Toronto. The yellow tour bus is good value as the ticket runs for a week so we used it as our means to get around town. It included a boat cruise around the Toronto Islands (which you have to go over and visit and only $6 return). The CN Tower of course is a must and the museum of Ontario (ROM) is really good also. WE really enjoyed our trip to Toronto and would definitely return to The Bond Place Hotel as we thought the location was fab- slap bang in the middle of a bustling friendly, safe city. Enjoy your trip, am sure you will!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, everything else bad...”
Reviews.Author: DUtrainertom
Reviews.Content: The hotel was arranged for a large wedding that I was attending, and thus I was able to get others experiences as well. The hotel was finishing its' major renovations. The front of the building had no sign, and literally had vinyl sheeting peeling off of the front. It looks like subsidized housing. I drove by the hotel multiple times over an hour trying to find the place, always wary of going into the building that ended up being the hotel. The management really needs to put at least a temporary sign on the front until construction is done; having your clients drive around for an hour trying to find the place does not make for a return visit. The rooms are nicely appointed, however there are no towel racks at all. Your towels have to sit on the toilet while you shower. The parking garage is across the street, and underneath a rather decrepit building. It is very tight, but is at least very well secured. Unfortunately, the garage does not take credit cards, but is cash only. They do not tell you this until you are leaving the garage. Luckily you can put the parking charges on your hotel bill, but only if you re-park your car and go back into the hotel and ask for a voucher. It costs $15 CDN per day, with unlimited in-out privelages. Now we get to the really bad. The staff is horrible. They either do not care, or are not interested in helping you. Regardless, rather than finding solutions to simple problems, they are condescending. I simply will not stay at this hotel again soley based on the staff. There are many other chain hotels near by the location that are similarly priced and I know do not have this problem. Botique hotels such as this have to cut a niche in order to make it. Unfortunately, this hotels niche is in a polished interior with a rotten exterior and rotten staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Attractive, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyAtlantaGA
Reviews.Content: Many other reviewers have complained that the rooms are small. It is true they are small, but they are cleverly designed so that they are comfortable and have everything you need. I was very happy with the room and recommend staying at this hotel. We stayed in a twin room on the 5th floor for three days. We found the room attractive, clean, and easy to use. There was a coffee kit (we didn't use it), a small fridge (we used it every day), a small standing wardrobe, and a folding luggage stand. There was no dresser, but we didn't miss it. The desk was a built-in shelf that ran the width of the room under the windows, and was convenient for our laptop and as an extended night table. The floors are laminate, which I expected to be noisy, but they weren't. The windows ran the width of the room, letting in lots of light, and had both sheers and block-out drapes. The AC unit was new, with a digital thermostat on the wall. The bed linens were new and comfortable, though the mattresses are quite hard. There were several electrical outlets around the room, giving us plenty of options for charging our gadgets. I hate paying for Internet at a hotel, but we did buy 48 hours of service at the Bond. It was easy to connect to and we could use it on multiple devices at once, so I can't complain. For those who only want a quick check of email or maps, there are a couple computers in the lobby to use. The bathroom was also small, but newly refurbished and stylish. Because of the narrow vanity space, they built a shelf/cabinet at one side of the sink, which offered a lot more space. The shower had good water pressure and plenty of hot water. The toilet flushed very loudly. The fan failed to remove any steam from the air. The door was a sliding door, which was excellent for making the small space more useable, but as others have commented, this allowed more bathroom noise to be heard in the room. It didn't bother us, and I didn't find the bathroom noise any worse than any other hotel I've been in. The towels were a little rough and they were stingy with the supply: one washcloth, one hand towel, and two bath towels per day. We were supplied with small bar soaps, shampoo and hand cream, which were good quality and pleasantly scented. Housekeeping honored our Do Not Disturb card, but still serviced the room every day even though we didn't leave til noon each day. Besides making the beds and cleaning the bath, our things were straightened up and our luggage was not disturbed. Street noise was an issue for me, though it didn't bother my husband. Yonge-Dundas Square is only a block away, and the bars and restaurants around it are open until 11pm. The pubs serve until 2am, including the Imperial just across the street. Traffic noises--trucks and street cars--continued until about midnight, and drunken revelers laughed and sang til well after 2am. It was not that bad, though, and simple ear plugs would have solved the problem. I usually travel with some, but forgot them this time. The neighborhood is typically urban. Yonge-Dundas Square and its surrounding shops a block away are bright and new. We ate in the YD food court most mornings and caught the subway there, too. Neighboring streets are a little shabbier, but I never felt unsafe or afraid. We went to a convenience store most nights around 11 or 12 to buy sodas and had no troubles, other than the ubiquitous panhandlers. I wasn't impressed with the front desk staff, but they were adequate. Our first night we arrived after 11pm, and we were starving. The front desk directed us to the late-night Subway or Pizza Pizza shops nearby. We had Pizza Pizza, which was very disappointing. I wish we'd been told there were two all-night breakfast diners nearby. They would have been much better choices. On our second day we asked for more towels and pillows in our room as we left for the day. We never got them. On our last day we asked them to hold our luggage several hours until we caught the airport shuttle in the afternoon. They did so happily, giving us a claim check. The hotel has a little cafe/coffeeshop in the lobby that we didn't try. After visiting the food court, I can say the cafe's prices were decent. The hallways are a little dim and claustrophobic. I could see they had been updated to the new dÃ©cor, but the carpets on our floor were already stained and dirty. The room doors had been painted, but were obviously old. The insides of the rooms are much nicer than the hallways make you expect. Overall, very pleased. The price was a bit high for my budget, but was very good for the heart of downtown. I didnâ€™t find anything else even close to the same price in that neighborhood that was anywhere near the same quality. You can certainly stay cheaper in the â€˜burbs or near the airport, but for downtown, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, good location. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: LJMorken
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and his parents stayed here on June 18, 2011. We had a very nice experience. Based on others' reviews and warnings, I requested a room away from construction (although they said it was over, which did appear to be the case once we got there) and on a higher floor to minimize street noise. We ended up on 17 and had lovely city views and a totally acceptable noise level. Yes, the rooms are a little small, but that didn't bother any of us. After all, you're in the middle of a city. They're clean, modern, interestingly designed, have cool lighting, and still offer classic amenities like a fridge, coffee maker, hair dryer, flat-screen TV, etc. I appreciated the wood floors, as carpet always seems so dirty. Another reviewer said this hotel is in a bad area. This is not at all true. Not only is it close to streetcars and the Dundas subway stop, the neighborhood is actually very touristy with a lot of activity. It's close to Eaton Centre, the Financial District, a big H&M, an AMC movie theatre, etc. Wireless isn't free, but the espresso bar in the lobby turned out great coffee. One minor complaint is that there is nowhere to hang towels. Not even one hook, and the showers don't have shower curtain rods, so you can't drape them over that, either. Seems a strange oversight for bathroom design. Certainly not a reason to avoid this hotel, more a note to management in case they happen to be reading! We got a great deal using the early bird online special, which gave us a lower rate but you pay immediately and it's totally non-refundable, which was no problem in our case. Parking was $15 in a nearby underground lot. I'd definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, modern comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: faceInTheCrowd
Reviews.Content: Really good location if, like me, you're in Toronto as a tourist. It's right next to Dundas Square in the heart of Toronto, which is where all the city tour buses leave from. There are quite a few restaurants and bars (e.g. Hard Rock cafe), and the square itself seems to have live events taking place regularly. The hotel was modern, comfortable, and reasonably priced. Happy to have chosen it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: MichelleR85
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just off Dundas and Young square, amazing location, not far to walk to anywhere. 5 minutes to the Eaton Centre (where i was in quite alot.). No great views out of the window, mine was a car park, but your not really there for the view out of your hotel window. Rooms were very clean, everything we needed, very friendly staff. Had a few issue with the electricity going off but they sorted it very quickly. Maid cleaned every day. Nice plasma TV in room. Was a very busy hotel. They were going through a refurbishment when we were there but there wasn't too much disruption. They have a cafe which was basic but nice. Very nicely decorated hotel, very modern. I would go back to this hotel if i ever go back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “OK as transit hotel for one or two nights.....”
Reviews.Author: reny641772
Reviews.Content: Clean Room with coffee machine facilities, recently renovated bathroom. 2 small beds with small corridor in between 2 beds. For groups breakfast offered in meeting room. Too fat bacon with scrambled eggs with toasts and that it was ! Hotel indeed close to EATON Shopping Centre. We travelled in Canada from May 25 -> June 8 and this was of the less pleasant hotels (outside dark red hughe building and renovation works ongoing all over the hotel). there are PCs available in the lobby area next to the coffee corner for email checking, free newspapers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, good location”
Reviews.Author: Laura352
Reviews.Content: Nice clean modern room, also bright and modern communal areas, small cafe for breakfast. Convenient area 1 minute from Dundas Square (Toronto's equivalent to Times Square) with lots going in. Very convenient for Yonge Street, Eaton Centre and cinemas

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy in a bad area”
Reviews.Author: Josie1985
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights with a tour company. The area was really bad but the rooms seemed all new but way too small. Things still hadnt been finished. The bathroom door slid closed and you could see and hear everything. The rooms are tiny with 2 single beds close together but the decor was nice and new. Reception staff were fairly nice. I used their laundry service for my clothes to be laundered and filled out the form correctly but when I got them back they had been dry cleaned which came to $70 for 6 items. I was not happy especially considering they were not clothes which needed dry cleaning

Reviews.Title: “Great for one night and its on the airport shuttle route”
Reviews.Author: DRMB
Reviews.Content: I needed to overnight between Beijing and Havana and chose this hotel as it was on the shuttle and seemed reasonable price. It was good. The shuttle service was great and the drivers very polite and friendly. Stayed here twice, on the way to Havana and on the way back. Would recommend as it is also walking distance to centre of town and shops, food, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option”
Reviews.Author: Megan_Adelaide_AU
Reviews.Content: Great value. Rooms are small but it suited our budget. Close to eaton centre and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - wonderful location and extremely clean”
Reviews.Author: culture_vulture_15
Reviews.Content: The hotel is currently being renovated and we managed to get one of the newly refurbished rooms - the room was lovely - everything seemed brand new and the bathroom was amazing. Tje room was equipped with a coffee machine, fridge, tv, iron etc all mod cons you could want. The check in was very smooth - staff were very helpful. The location of the hotel is just great - right in the middle of toronto round the corner from the eaton centre and dundas square. There was some live music going on at Dundas square next to the hotel on our first night but it stopped at midnight and didn't really bother us. There is a cafe in the lobby that does breakfasts, coffees etc but there are lots of places in the area to have breakfast that offer more choice and value for money. Would recommend eggspectation and also the Senator round the corner from the hotel for breakfast. The Senator doesn't look much from outside but it has some great booths and provides an authentic retro breakfast experience with lots of choice on the menu and good service. The portions were very large and good value! In general, a great stay and fabulously clean hotel in a great location. Would definitely stay here again. great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: elewisOttawa_On
Reviews.Content: Me & my wife stayed at this hotel from May 21 - 23, 2011. There is some renovations going on right now but that didn't bother us. The room is small but all we want is a comfy bed to sleep on. The only thing i didn't like about our room was that the bathroom has a sliding door with see through gaps at each end. So when someone goes to the toilet, you can hear everything when you're in the room. The parking garage is at the corner of Bond/Dundas at a cost of $15 a day. I'd stay at this hotel again. The location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a good price and in great location”
Reviews.Author: 186402Paul
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 10 night stay at Bond Place Hotel. My friend found the hotel through the Rough Guide book to Toronto and it recommended it as a good 3 star hotel. Yes the hotel is going through a bit of a renovation (so you have to accept there may be some disruption..how else are they to carry out the work)... but it is nearly now complete. I shared a room with two other male friends and we had a large room with one double and two single beds up on the 12th floor .. There is no safe in your room.. which would be nice.. but they do have safe deposit boxes in reception which are free. We caught the airport shuttle bus and it drops you off and picks you up outside the hotel ( runs every 30 mins). We found all the staff pleasant and helpfull and the cleaner of our room did an excellent job. There is a small coffee bar in the hotel but we tended to go to the Daily Brew cafe in Dundas Road for moning brekfast (run by a lovely Chinese couple). You can also get meals and bar snacks at the Imperial Pub opposite the hotel (we mentioned we were stopping at Bond Place and got a discount). What did we think of Toronto?.... My friend Dave made a list of places and bars to visit before we went so each day map and list in hand we set off. Best places.. Chinese quarter for bargains.. Kensington District (1970's England with quaint bars,cafes and shops). All the bars we visited were very nice and offered good food but if you want an imported beer prepare to pay the price (you should also budget for additional cost of taxes (13%) on all purchases and tips in bars and restaurants. Rembember the weather can change by the hour this time of year .. so yes take some summer clothes but pack that jumper and pac-a-mac.... you may need them.

Reviews.Title: “Back pain due to the bad quality mattress”
Reviews.Author: nisha_kaur
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 night and it was the worst night for me as i have bad back pain due to the mattress was very firm and not a good quality mattress bed, the next day when i call the reception was no help and according to the reception they cannot do anything or change my room, please those who have back problem or those who are senior this hotel are the bad hotel for the stay. I did not had the choose to check out as i paid in full in advance and its was a non refundable fees. My three day vacation was spoil due to the bed condition. The staff was non cooperative.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but”
Reviews.Author: verdims
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Bond Place Hotel for 4 days. I found the hotel location is very good (only 3 mins walk to Eaton Center and Subway stn). Internet access speed is reasonable ( I booked the business room with internet access included). The hotel still undergone some major renovation on the lower floor (I stayed on 16th Floor, so it doesn't disturb me too much) however the elevator is quite dirty since the worker is using the same elevator used by guest (I guess no service elevator). I had allergy problem with the dust and it caused me some problem every time the elevator stopped on the floor which undergone renovation. Had internet problem (couldn't send my emails, none of the staff can actually assist even the ISP call center number given was useless). The service given by hotel staffs were indifference. John (?) and Jacklyn was the best I believe. Bed is not too comfortable, very thick on the side, make it harder for you to go up and down the bed. Bathroom is small and not being designed too well. ie. no soap holder inside the shower room! I must put my soap in the shower floor. Toilet paper holder is basically useless (too low and hard to reach) so basically the housekeeping do not bother to fill the toilet paper instead just put the rolls on the sink table. Overall, if I have another option in nearby area with similar price level, I'd rather stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, but Toronto had better options”
Reviews.Author: laetitiaGermany
Reviews.Content: At first sight this hotel seemed to be uncomfortable, it was in renovation and the corridors seemed pretty thrilling. But then they gave me a just renewed room, which was very small but clean, tidy, comfortable. I stayed there only for one night, just because the Novotel was overbooked, but then I transfered to Novotel. I would say the localization is good, just across the Eaton Centre and Hard Rock Cafe, bars, etc. And the hotel is ok, but I prefere not to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - shame about the noise!”
Reviews.Author: CMMB1977
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 6 night stay in the Bond Place Hotel. On the plus side the location is fantastic - it's just around the corner from Yonge-Dundas Square and is within walking distance of most of the main attractions. The service was ok - the staff were pleasant enough but didn't really seem too helpful. Now onto the cons - firstly the noise! The hotel is undergonig a renovation at the moment and on a few occasions I had to call reception early in the morning and ask them if they could have the drilling/hammering etc on our floor to be stopped - it didn't so I had to use earplugs! Then there is the room - although nice an newly decorated, new bathroon etc, the rooms are very small, there are no drawers, not enough shelf space and no handrail in the bath which I thought was quite dangerous. Overall I think it was good value for money (we paid $90 CAD per night) if you can put up with the noise!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location, Awesome City!”
Reviews.Author: xcatch
Reviews.Content: I've had the good fortune of staying at the Bond Place Hotel three times now and look forward to going there whenever I return to Toronto. The quaint rooms were renovated since my last stay, resulting in a modern contemporary look that suits the hotel well. The location is outstanding, right in the middle of everything, and the staff is top notch. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: loverofchocolate
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Just a stones throw from the shops around and in the Eaton Centre. The airport bus stops right outside the hotel and the sightseeing buses go from Dundas square which is a two minute walk away. There are lots of places to eat nearby also. The room was recently renovated and was nice and clean. The corridor had not yet been renovated but that didn't bother me. I knew from reading previous reviews that the hotel was being renovated and could be noisy as a result but I didn't hear anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Toronto Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: amtrak
Reviews.Content: It took me a while and alot of research until I finally decided on the Bond Hotel. This hotel was perfect - location was great - right by a mall -and many restaurants plus a short walk to the St. Lawrence Market and the CN Tower - and even close to the Harbour Front and the Rogers Centre - perfect location - the best part was the cleanliness of this hotel. They are remodeling it so the hallways are still in process of being remodeled but the rooms were perfect - had a room with a queen size bed plus two twins - perfect for us - plus wooden floors and very little furniture which made the room very clean -- even the beds are on wheels so they could clean under the bed - loved it!! The workers couldn't be any friendlier - they were always trying to help and knew who we were even the following day - if I was to come back to Toronto - this is the place I would stay - thanks so much for a wonderful and clean stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place”
Reviews.Author: Azadkavoosi
Reviews.Content: What i write here is really true. The hotel had a complete renovation and because if this some down floor are filled with workers. There are lots of glue and detergent smells. There is no gym in hotel now which is write at the site. Another tjing is that this hotel has a rate of 15 $ a day for just using 24h internet connection which is very wierd. Nobody accept tjis rate. The hotel has a bad place for breakfast. Totaly i will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing behavior from the GM”
Reviews.Author: peterson563
Reviews.Content: Came to see one of my friend who came to attend the CICE confernce and was staying in the hotel. That evening I saw one gentleman greeting the GM of the hotel but it seems the GM did not had ears so it just walked away from the guest. I could not believed that it was the GM of the hotel, I saw the face of the frontline staff who had no answer. Later my friend said that he was the one who organise the conference. wow - what a customer service relationship from the GM -that poor guy must had his day!

Reviews.Title: “reasonable price for their service”
Reviews.Author: Jae2Kim
Reviews.Content: receptionists are not really friendly.. i felt a bit tired woth their service! they have not noticed their renovation of corridor.. it was not really happy thing for like a tourist!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: SomeGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night booking through Priceline for $65 so for that price combined with the location there really can't be any complaints. A couple of observations follow: *There's no place for short-term parking at check-in so it felt a little iffy pulling up to the Bond Street side and risking a ticket. Luckily check-in was very fast so there was no issue. *The parking garage across the street is really easy to get to, secure and very inexpensive at $15. You're good there until noon the following day. I didn't check on my car even once. *My 11th floor room was fine. I haven't slept in a single bed for 30 years but it was comfy nonetheless. The absence of carpet seemed a little odd but the floors were clean. The shower was awesome with a large free-flowing head and great water pressure. *The renovations continue so I was awoken a little earlier than I would have liked. Didn't complain about it though. I read revews ahead of time and figured it might happen.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Caskett Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this hotel and found it excellent value for money. I got a single room for a discounted price of 45 pounds/night, which is lower than what is usually charged, but the room was worth every penny and I would have even paid slightly more if necessary. The hotel is located on Dundas Square (Toronto's mini-Times Square), which is within walking distance of all the major attractions. Dundas Square subway station is almost just across the street, as is the bus station. There are also tramway lines stopping nearby. My room was spotlessly clean, on the 16th floor, with great views of the city skyline. The hotel is undergoing an extensive refurbishment, but I didn't hear any noise. My floor (and room) had been completely renovated and the room had a clean, modern look. The walk-in glass shower was great, and I generally had an excellent, comfortable stay. Lots of TV channels to choose from, as well as a large selection of movies (for a fee). The staff were friendly and helpful. My only concern was the lack of free wifi, which would be a plus. At the moment you have to pay 8$ for a 24-hour access period. I'd be happy paying a nominal fee (like 2-3$ per day), but 8$ is a bit steep. There's free wifi available at the Eaton Centre shopping mall just across the street, if you really need it. Overall, excellent value for money in Toronto, I definitely would recommend this hotel and come back again.

Reviews.Title: “basic clean hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: seagrove_11
Reviews.Content: fantastic location for shops, cinema and theatre. Walking distance to underground trains and street cars. The staff are friendly and polite, The rooms were small but clean and basic but everything we needed for our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Under Renovation â€“ Be Careful, cash only parking”
Reviews.Author: WNY_Voyager
Reviews.Content: At least two of the floors (12 & 13) had hallways that looked like something out of a creepy movie. The hotel is currently under renovation. My colleague found a file in her room. After the third night a chair appeared in my room â€“ you can see part of it in the picture â€“ I guess they assume you can use a window ledge as a desk. Be careful because the â€œhotelâ€� parking garage is cash only but they donâ€™t tell you when you check in. I asked twice about putting the parking on my bill or paying with my credit card but both times the front desk told me not to worry about it. When leaving I interrupted a cranky parking attendant on his cell phone who coldly told me I need to pay him $75 and they only take cash. Iâ€™m sure the hand written receipt he gave me will go over smoothly when I submit my expense report. Rooms are small. I had two single beds and my feet hung off the end. If I rolled any direction I would end up on the floor. I could hear the wind whistling, not sure but I think there was a problem with the windows. Staff was friendly enough but not very helpful. In addition to the whole cash parking fiasco when I asked front desk if they knew the address of a restaurant I wanted to go to, instead of taking 5 seconds to look it up on her computer, she told me an intersection which was WRONG! Thank-you to the taxi driver who knew better. Itâ€™s not all bad though â€“ itâ€™s cheaper than most hotels in the area and has a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall”
Reviews.Author: JackFrancis
Reviews.Content: Amazing location and the room looked like it had just been renovated. Great value overall and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovation”
Reviews.Author: jwp48
Reviews.Content: The Bond Place hotel is located near shopping malls and many reasonable restaurants. Also convenient for public transport . However the hotel itself is long overdue for a renovation. Breakfast is nothing special but there are enough delicatessens and other coffee shops nearby. More suitable for backpackers than anyone expecting any comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel, good location, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: RMac91
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were in Toronto for the weekend to basically party and shop. I chose the Bond Place Hotel because of the location and reasonable price. The rooms were nice and clean, we had a decent view and our stay was all around great. The concierge was really helpful and the only thing I would say was inconvenient was the parking which is located across the road, but that's just the way it is in the city. I was really happy with the location, just a couple of minutes from the Eaton Centre and close to great restaurants. We checked out a couple of bars on Queen St one night, taking a taxi there was around $10. The hotel has a nice espresso bar in the lobby which is nice for grabbing a quick snack in the morning. We checked in late without any problems and check-out was just as easy.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a central location”
Reviews.Author: MarkusMalahide
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Bond Place Hotel on two occasions on an accompanied work trip to Canada in November 2010. Found good deals and felt the quality-value-location ratio compared to other Toronto hotels was great. So decided to stay in the same hotel on the way back to Toronto on the way back. Location is great only two minutes walk drom Dundas Square near the shopping area and restaurants. Rooms were clean and spacious enough. On first stay I didn't get the room I had reserved, but in the second one it was ok. Internet access can be purchased. Breakfast wasn't included, but the variety for food places nearby is great. Parking in the hotel parking building a block away costs 15 dollars until midday the next day. Small gym in the second floor can be used free of charge. Service was working well when I requested glasses to be brought to the room and separately asked for a tooth brush to replace the forgotten one (was free of charge). With this value and quality in this location, I'd be happy to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE SERVICE! After being woken up 3 times because of renovations, no effort made to fix the problem”
Reviews.Author: Marc-Boris
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bond Place, NEVER AGAIN! I was woken up at 7:45 am by loud banging in the room directly above mine. Hammering and what sounded like a percussion drill. I called down to reception, they said they were sorry and would send someone up to stop the work. 10 minutes later the noise stopped, but not for long. at 9am, the same noise again. I called down and was told again they would send someone to stop the work. One hour later, at 10 am, the noise starts again. That was the end of it. I asked for the duty manager, and was told I could come down to the lobby to see her (not even able to come to the room!). I got dressed, went to the lobby, and proceeded to see if there was another room available, or any way to fix the problem. there were no other rooms, and I was promised the work would not continue, however, my colleague was in the room while I was in the lobby, and she told me the noise had resumed. I then proceeded to ask for a refund, as my night's sleep was ruined. the manager said she could not. When asked if it was because she did not have that authority, she would not answer. I was booked for a second night there, but cancelled and booked a room at the delta chelsea instead. It was only once I had booked the other hotel that all of a sudden they had other rooms, and tried to offer me another room. Too little, too late. It was a saturday, and the general manager was not there, so after much protest on my part, I paid, and got the manager's name and number. I called the manager 3 times in the week after that, also left numerous messages with the director of sales, and have not got a call back yet. Totally unacceptable way to run a hotel. I understand there might be work to do, but telling customners the noise will stop, only to have it start again 3 more times, is misleading and dishonest. not to mention there was no indication before hand that there was work being done there. When I asked if there would be no work on the sunday morning, they said "I dont think so"... not very reassuring. the manager on saturday was of no help to me, no effort to make things right, just a blank stare back at my protesting. I really dont think I should have had to pay for a night (I work late, and the point of getting a hotel is to get a good night's sleep) that was interupted 3 times, and that I was flat out lied to. At the very least I would expect the manager to return my calls... despicable! I will never stay there again, and I advise you all to stay away

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfy bed, overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: maisouiamelie
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, my boyfriend and I decided to try Bond Place out. When the cab dropped us off, I was a bit concerned by the outside of the building, but the lobby was very clean and looks like it was recently updated. I had booked a queen bed, but the concierge said that they were out of queens, and we could either take two singles or upgrade to a different queen room for an extra $20 a night. I showed her my reservation confirmation and she dramatically sighed and picked up the phone. It appears that no one answered, because she hung up and said reluctantly that she'd give us the queen room at the price I booked it at originally. The hallways upstairs were a bit shabby, but the room was alright. The furniture was old and the bathroom a bit dirty, but the bed was comfy, the neighborhood was quiet (though it is about a block from Dundas Square). We were able to walk from the hotel to all the museums, which gave us lots of exercise and time outside. I would have been much happier paying at least $20 less for the room, but I guess it is all about location.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, uncomfortable, but convenient”
Reviews.Author: baby_star2002
Reviews.Content: My aunt booked this hotel from hotwire.com because it was such a good deal. She called the hotel, to ensure there were no issues when i got there with her daughter.... made all the reservations, sent what they needed in order to make sure we had no hassle. When we arrived, the hotel parking was hard to find, but we found it. Upon entering the hotel we immediately checked in, and asked for a double bed for the additional quoted price of $12. The gentleman at the desk informed us that that was not the correct price, and it was almost double that. We decided against it, and attempted to finish our sign in. My aunt arranged that the deposit was to be put on her credit card, so we didn't encounter any issues. When we got to this point, the gentleman claimed we had to personally pay it, and they couldn't charge it to the card. We ended up paying debit for the deposit, and headed up to the room. The elevators were extremely slow, and the hotel looked and smelled more of an apartment building. Our room was extremely small and there were little black hairs all over the bathroom. We found the beds very uncomfortable, and the windows extremely dirty. For a low price, the hotel would be a decent one to stay in, and perhaps we just got a bad room, with some bad service, but we would definitely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: J_Try
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Bond Place several times. The rooms are clean and well-maintained, and the hotel was recently renovated. The front desk staff are friendly and helpful - they even opened up a conference room for my family for a birthday party at no extra charge. Room featured hardwood floors, comfortable beds, and all the usual amenities. The only downside is the area itself - though basically located in Toronto's answer to Times Square, there are lots of sketchy people around, especially at night. And it can be noisy with the traffic and crowds. Security is fairly tight at the hotel - only guests can use the elevator, and they can only go to the floor that their room is on. Hotel is close to restaurants and pubs. I'd recommend staying here if you want to stay in the heart of downtown and can afford the rates, which are a little high (but not bad for Toronto).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghArea
Reviews.Content: We visited Toronto in January for our anniversary and chose the Bond hotel for it's central location. That's exactly what it is- central! We were able to walk to everything, even in the middle of winter. There is a tram stop outside the door, a subway station across the road, and buses pass as well. The room was small, but recently renovated and VERY clean. Extra pillows are hidden in the dresser drawers and the bed has a pillow top (very comfy). Overall a great experience, it provided everything we were looking for. It was recently renovated, great value, and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “The reason to stay is the location”
Reviews.Author: Smithster100
Reviews.Content: You'll have gathered from other reviews that this place has one key feature...where it is. Being on the corner of Yonge and Dundas, 2 minutes from the Metro and the Eaton Centre, means it has a lot to offer for the city break crowd. However, if you are in anyway bothered by the services in a hotel, you maybe disappointed. The lobby is clean and functional and looks very much like you would expect if Ikea opened a hotel. Be warned - once you get onto the guest floors, it is like a motel from 1970's Wichita. Rooms are small & clean but the bathrooms are generally tired and really in need of a refit, like yesterday. Just as an example, the smoke alarms are not connected to the mains electricity and run off battery, so for the last two days of my stay I was subjected to frequent "Beeps" from the alarm telling me in the middle of the night (like I care or am going to do anything about it ) that the battery was running low. The only dining service is a small coffee shop in reception, but given the location, who's gonna eat in house? The main shock for me was the fitness room. It looks like it's going to be appalling from the website, but is actually...OK! Get a good rate from Expedia or Hotels.com and limit your stay to no more than 4 nights and you'll be cool with the place. Pay top dollar for this place and you may wish you had looked round a bit more. My big gripe...and this is really starting to p*ss me off with many hotels in the states and Canada (because if hotels in the UK can do it, anyone can!) ...NO FREE WIFI!!! $8.95 for 24 hours?? Get stuffed....It's free in Starbucks for crying out loud!! And no..I don't want to hear some hotel marketing manager tell me "it's about customer choice", the marginal cost of WIFI is not $8.95.

Reviews.Title: “Confirm things in advance”
Reviews.Author: adamstpatrick
Reviews.Content: No serious complaints other than the management. I thought I'd confirmed internet access, but to management at this hotel ``internet included'' apparently means that guests have the option to pay extra for access. At first I was willing to chalk it up to a misunderstanding but the manager made me feel as if I should have had my lawyer handle the matter instead, which motivated me to come here and warn people.

Reviews.Title: “Had an amazing time. Only one bad thing.”
Reviews.Author: krstnzz
Reviews.Content: My bestfriend and I(Two 21 year old females) were basically looking for a cheap, clean place to stay that was close to downtown Toronto. The rooms were kind of small however it worked out fine for us. We each had our own single bed. The room was clean. The staff were all very pleasant. The only thing that we thought was odd was that they charge you for wireless internet (~5$ an hour, $10 a day, $40 a month. We were also promised we'd have a fridge but did not. There were no microwaves. My friend had woke up a few times the first night saying she heard construction but this did not bother me personally. However, like I said, looking for a cheap place to stay downtown then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_travellers201
Reviews.Content: The concierge were USELESS!!! They have no intention to help you unless they will get a commission from your sale. The lady is horrible and the guy was just as bad. The only two friendly staff members were the Asian Males (forgot their names) behind the front desk, all other staff were rude and unhelpful. The room had a nice sized tv and three single beds, the bathroom was old but ok. There are shops close by and you can walk to the center where games and concerts are held.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, good location, nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: Olya_Olga
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for three nights on the last week-end of November. Very friendly staff Sampath (I may mistake the name) let me to check in at 8 am. The hotel looks like new - outside, lobby area, inside the room. The room itself was small, but I think there was enough space for two people; two double beds, linen was clean as well as the mattress. In the room there was an iron, ironing board, hair dryer, coffee/tea pot (they provide coffee, tea, sugar in the room), heater/conditioner with temperature regulation, TV with basic cable. Everything worked, just I didn't use the iron. For three nights I stayed there, it was quiet - nobody's sounds bothered me. I stayed at the 13th floor, so I also enjoyed the view. Everything, that is located in Downtown, is very close to the hotel - Hockey Hall of Fame, Air Canada Centre, Nathan Phillips Square, lake Ontario, many different places to eat and to shop. Shuttles to airport stop at this hotel, and Niagara Falls tours buses pick you up from downtown hotels as well. And of course I liked the price from priceline! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excelent location”
Reviews.Author: Vendy_St
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at Bond hotel. Everything is worked out perfectly. Fast check in and tastefully , modern designed lobby with two PC, caffe bar. Our room was at 9th floor with two comfort double bed with white very clean bed linen. For me that is most important thing at hotel room. Bathroom was very clean two. After long day of exploring it was nice to watch plasma tv from bed.At day of our departure check out was at 12:00 a.m, but our bus connection to Chicago was at 6:30 p.m and hotel staff put our luggage in a guarded room at reception which was very kind of them. Near hotel cca 2 min walk is big shopping center Eaton.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place!”
Reviews.Author: rodneyd44
Reviews.Content: I would have to say this in one of the best hotels I have stayed at. Great location, friendly staff, very clean rooms including bathroom with no flow restricting shower head! (I liked that a lot), good heating, and comfortable bed. About the only draw back about the Bond is the rooms are a little on the small size, but I didn't go to Toronto to stay in my room. The Chinese place with the ad in the room book has excellent reasonablely priced food, about 2 blocks east of the Bond.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, functional but not pleasant if two of you”
Reviews.Author: Crowley59
Reviews.Content: This appeared to be a great bargain when I was looking for accommodation in Toronto. Near underground rail, trams (streetcars outside) and on Shuttle bus run to Airport. All positives. However my wife and i were on a hectic RTW trip between moving from SA to Denver, CO. We were in Toronto to catch up with our Daughter and some of my work mates. Would have been fine if room was larger. Very small rooms didnt allow us to unpack or spread out comfortably and this made it quite uncomfortable. If had of been travelling by myself I would have been fine. If travelling as a young backpacker also no worries. Just not really suitable for a 50yr old couple with greater expectations. Staff were fine, location was great, really only the space spoiled it for me. Another plus was the gym which I enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap way to stay in TO”
Reviews.Author: ErnCasin
Reviews.Content: - There is not much service that we needed since we only stayed for one night. I do remember, however, a power outage cause I used hair dryer, and tv, and straightening iron all at once! We called the front desk and they fixed it very quickly without interrupting us in the room. -The room was alright. I didn't have any problem with the beds. They were comfortable. -Location was perfect! It's like hidden but close to major downtown TO attractions and close to a subway station. -Amenities were not much. There was a coffeemaker inside the room. We had to use the water from the washroom and that wasn't great at all. It was not clear water that came out so it was disgusting. -What I liked the best is its location and price. What I liked the least was the disgusting water for the coffee, which makes it disgusting to brush your teeth with as well. -There was also a buffet breakfast for like $12.50. It was actually pretty good. And one of the staff there told me to come back and grab a croissant later, for free. I thought that was really really sweet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jvduren
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, great location in the centre of Toronto in walking distance of Eaton centre and CN tower. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: mixedlollies
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum and my sister, and thought it was pretty good. We got it for a good deal and were there for around 4 days. It was close to everything, particularly the Eaton Centre and we didn't catch the train at all. It was a bit tired, but there was lots of space for the three of us. There was a massive TV for when we were so tired after walking round a lot. It was pretty clean. The bathroom was a little tired but you get what you pay for. I did read the other reviews and was a bit worried about it, but for the price we paid, I think it represented good value. The only part that annoyed me was the lack of free wifi/internet for guests.

Reviews.Title: “The location saves them”
Reviews.Author: Chuckelberry
Reviews.Content: I booked online and got a cheap deal. Around 80 dollars a night for two. Very cheap since you are in a great location on yonge and dundas. The service was great, it was the room that let's it down. I have stayed here twice. Once before it had it's renovations and after. The lobby is totally different and looks great. It has a cute cafe and seemed busy, it just seems weird that it's closed by 7pm. The rooms are pretty much the same except for the floors, tv, bed and lamps. The bathrooms haven't been touched at all. We found the walls in the bedroom and bathroom dirty. I took a cloth and wiped them down. Shouldn't that be done when the room is serviced? The room was small but we didn't mind as we were out for most of the day. We had asked for a high floor and city view which we got. You have to pay for wireless which seems a bit dated in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: LauraLACanada
Reviews.Content: We took the airport bus to the Bond Place Hotel and were dropped off right at the front door. We checked in without incident. Our room was small but clean. All the linens and towels were white as well as the bedspreads. Hardwood/laminate flooring and a big TV. The bathroom did need to be renovated. We were only a 2 minutes stroll to Dundus Square, Eaton Centre and the subway.

Reviews.Title: “RUN!”
Reviews.Author: rlimagon
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel, one of the worse I have ever stayed in my whole life. Except for the location, which is indeed very convenient, the hotel itself is very old and the rooms are small, bathrooms are bad and the lobby is horrible. Very bad first impression (and second, third). Staff is just OK, if that much. Our room faced Dundas Square and because of the old and low quality windows, is was terribly noisy despite the fact that we were at the 13th floor. We had a very hard time to sleep. Also, the price is far from good, all things considered. Maybe, just maybe, if it costed half the price (we paid around 130 CAD a night) it might have been an OK deal. Not recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location. Excellant Value.”
Reviews.Author: LaChatNoir
Reviews.Content: We got a room at the Bond Place for a song using an online travel booking agency. It was an excellant value for its cost and location. It is a no frills hotel, but all the necessities are covered and our room was clean. I do not understand negative reviewers complaining about the safety of the neighborhood. It is one block from the Yonge-Dundas square, which is bustling with people all night. There were always two or three people at the front desk and other hotel patrons coming in and out of the buildling. It never felt dangerous or unsafe. Two female 30s travelers and we walked back to the hotel after midnight all four nights. Somtimes from the Yonge-Dundas subway stop, sometimes all the way from downtown. We did have a slight mix-up initially, I had called to confirm two beds in the room, but upon check-in we were given a room with a double. After going downstairs to speak with the manager, they put us in a triple the first night, then moved us to a room with two single beds for the next three nights. They stored our luggage during the day and had it in the new room awaiting our return that evening. I was very pleased with the customer service we received from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Norfolktravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. Check-in was quick and efficient, and the porters were very helpful with our luggage. We were on the 17th floor and had to use our key cards to operate the lifts, which could be a bit slow when it was busy and people were checking-in. The rooms were a little bit small but very nice with great views of the city. Breakfast was in the cafe and was a selection of muffins, croissants etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and it was all very fresh. Excellent location being so close to Dundas Square. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms with great location”
Reviews.Author: Mimi76Bolbec_France
Reviews.Content: our room was big and fun on the 17th floor ... nice staff especially bell boys very helpful ... great view felt like being in time square again ..

Reviews.Title: “Bond Place - a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shirleyeSheffieldUK
Reviews.Content: This is a fab little place to stay. I can't praise it enough. We stayed 4 nights. The room was very clean, bathroom clean, big fluffly towels, comfy bed, spacious, quiet (we were on 18th floor but there are 3 lifts so no waiting) with hairdryer and ironing board. Everything a traveller needs at a good price. We ate breakfast in the hotel once very early in the morning as we had to catch a train, otherwise we ate at the Senator round the corner, a fab diner style place with wonderful breakfasts. The challah toast is fab. We also ate there one night and had salmon - it was lovely. Toronto is fab. This hotel is in a great position. The Irish pub opposite is also good. We took the Shop and Dine Sightseeing bus tour hop on and off, which was fab. We took the train to Niagara. it took 2 hours but was very comfortable and there was a buffet bar. Niagara was out of this world and you must not miss a trip on the Maid of the Mist boat. One night we went to see the Toronto Blue Jays play baseball and that was real exciting. Just had a thoroughly good time.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service- Not for Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoners55
Reviews.Content: We were on our honey moon in Toronto. We booked well in advance but to our dissapointment they did not have a room for us when we arrived. We arrived at 1 0'clock and the friendly gentleman told us he is sending us to another hotel. We told him that we chose the bond to celebrate our honeymoon so he should send someone else because we could see other people getting rooms but they gave away our room. I ask for the manager and he went somewhere to find them. After 5 minutes the manager came and did not make the situation any better. She said sorry and was so firm that we must go to another hotel and when we try to negotiate and explain that we booked a long time ago and keep demanding to stay at the bond, she throw her hands in the air and said she is done talking with us after we told her sorry will not help. That ruin our honey moon and we will never book with the bond again. The manager was not friendly, talk to us like we were kids and didnt care about our honeymoon. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Osiane
Reviews.Content: This hotel in downtown Toronto at 3 minutes from a subway. The outside is not too appealing but inside it is modern. It seems newly renovated, our room had a flat screen tv and new furniture. However our room was small but it is enough if you don't plan to stay in your room all day. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very average--and they charge for Internet”
Reviews.Author: chollinger
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I travel to Toronto once a year, so we're very familiar with the city and where to stay. We typically use Priceline to book our hotels, and The Bond Place was the "winner" this year. The hotel's location is very close to Eaton Center and Dundas Square, which is great, but the neighborhood borders on questionable, especially after dark. Contrary to other reviews, the hotel is not located directly in Dundas Square; rather it is about a block away, near the corner of Dundas and Victoria. It is exceptionally close to the TTC Dundas subway station and streetcars, which is great. If you're into going out at night to any clubs on Adelaide, a $10 cab ride is necessary to get back to the hotel late at night. We checked in around 3 p.m. and got right into our room. We had single beds in a tiny room, but it was clean and the beds were comfortable. The flat-screen television on the wall was a nice touch and there was adequate drawer space and hangers for clothes and other belongings. The "concierge" at the hotel seemed little more than a tour salesperson. Throughout our stay, she tried to sell us tours to Niagara and other places around the area. If I need information, I prefer to ask for it, not be heckled with it. The hotel charges $10 for internet access. That alone is the reason I didn't give the hotel a higher rating. In this day and age, there is no excuse for any hotel to charge for internet access. When low-end hotels offer it as a free amenity, it is worth noting and rebuking hotels that continue to charge for access to the web. Parking is $15 a day, in an underground, secured parking ramp. You must prepay with cash in order to park in the hotel's parking area. The hotel lobby has a great coffee bar that offers breakfast sandwiches and good coffee at a reasonable price. Overall, we had a nice stay at The Bond Place. I would stay there again, but with irritation about having to pay for Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: therenhere
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Bond Place Hotel during the Toronto Film Festival. The location was great, however there are a few things that should be mentioned about the Hotel itself. The rooms definitely are in need of updating. There were very noticeable patch marks on the ceiling where water must have leaked in at some point, rust covering the light fixture in the bathroom, the shower knob was very difficult to shut off...so it made a strange dripping sound all night. Also, for the ladies...very difficult lighting to get ready in. I have no idea what my face really looked like after applying my makeup because the lighting is a bit dim and yellowish, annoying when you are trying to look nice for a big event, LOL! If you are a fan of working out while on vacation you will be disappointed in what the gym has to offer. The "gym" is one of the Hotel rooms that they put some weights and a few treadmills in. The strangest thing, we were given a room with 3 beds?? Also, make sure you bring cash to pay for parking. The garage is located across the street from the Hotel, and the cost is $15 per day. You are not able to charge anything to your room like most hotels, and there is a also a charge for internet use.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mmmanuel88
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my cousin at Bond Place for a weekend to do some sightseeing in toronto and taste the nightlife. The location was really good at dundas square and its easy to find. We got a twin room with view from the square which was really nice. Eventhough we had a room on the streetside there was no noise. The room was clean the beds were comfy. The only thing that I missed was a minibar, but it wasn't much of a problem because there was an ice bucket in the room and an ice machine on some of the floors. The staff was friendly and the congierge was really helpful giving us a lot of information and advice. The wireless internet wasnt free unfortunately but overall I had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “skip it - the great location doesn't compensate”
Reviews.Author: hahaterri
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous - but the downside is that inside your room you hear the concerts outside at Eaton Center - whether you want to or not. Also heard a baby crying in a nearby room. Also the concierge, while friendly, gave us bad advice and ended up costing us money. Next time I will not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Location is key”
Reviews.Author: Masca
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel mainly because of its location downtown close to the Eaton Centre and subway and near where having a family celebration. Unfortunately, it was during the film festival and rates are highest then. Room tiny, so small that my husband sleeping on the bed by the air conditioner had to turn it off: it blew directly on him. So - so cleanliness, found hair in sink. But we slept well. Charged for internet which I expect in 5 star hotels but this was only a 3 star, if that. Location made up for its defaults.

Reviews.Title: “Earwigs!”
Reviews.Author: jenndermo
Reviews.Content: Hotel located in a great location 2 minute walk from the Eaton Center. Room was small but presented itself nicely, nothing too extravagent. After I had a shower in the room and reached for one of the towels i was surprised to see an earwig crawling on it! I didn't think much of it at first, it happens sometimes, but then when we went to bed, there was another earwig on the comforter! EWWW! price is somewhat cheap, but pay the extra money and go somewhere that is bug-free!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location.”
Reviews.Author: suttonteacher
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel, well presented, Family room had one double/queen sized bed and two singles, fridge, coffee-making machine, flat-screen tv etc. Very good central location. Very comfortable beds. Desk staff friendly but not able to give transport information, other than the tour which they promoted. (Came across great travel centre, near to the hotel, which answered all of our questions.)

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: ashleydins
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond disappointing. The service was sub par, and did not even compare to that of a hostel. We had to call for towels on two seperate days, 4 times before towels were delivered to our room!!!! There was also long black hairs all over our bathroom, and in our towels!! The front desk staff were incompetent and seemed very unfamiliar with the hotel and with toronto. Front desk staff hung up on me when I called to speak with a manager to recieve towels! Blow dryer broke in room, front desk staff said someone would be right up, an hour later I called back down and frint desk staff knew nothing about my call! ????? I feel that we would have been better off staying at a hostel, rather than spending $100+/night. I would not recommend this to anyone!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Very Disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Handy location”
Reviews.Author: eurorover
Reviews.Content: Stopped for five nights (accommodation only basis) during Canada tour. Hotel was clean, and of a 3-star standard. The staff were very friendly and helpful to us at all times when required. There were no restaurant facilities at the time (Aug. 2010), but rooms in basement suggest otherwise sometime previously. Adjoining coffee shop in first floor foyer for breakfast bites (but cheaper to go elsewhere). Coffee/Tea making facilities in all rooms. Recently modernised, the downtown location of the hotel is on the pick-up route for the airport shuttle (45 mins.) Very close to shopping/financial/theatre areas and Dundas/Yonge Square where it all seems to happen. Plenty of eateries of all standards in abundance. In all, a good hotel in a handy location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect when you have a small budget and want to be downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Christine1982
Reviews.Content: If your priorities is the same as me: downtown, cheap rate and clean hotel, this is the place! We paid about 100$ per night and we were just beside Yonge-Dundas Square and about 15 minutes walking from the CN tower. The hotel in general is clean, and the room too. The queen size bed room is not very big but it is ok, not as small as I imagine following the previous comments, and the bed very comfortable. The A/C is noisy, as in any hotel room I guess. We were at the highest floor,18th, and we heard some traffic noise in the morning, normal it's downtown. The hotel has an indoor parking lot in a building across the street for 15$ a night, very cheap compared to other hotel. The staff is nice and helpfull. I would go back to this hotel at that rate!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the value”
Reviews.Author: ericR1da
Reviews.Content: - worth the cheap price I paid ($67/night) - fairly clean, the staff were friendly enough - there seemed to be a bar in the lobby, but I'm not sure if it's ever open. The restaurant is quite small, but I did see some people dining there (price as advertised in the elevator was quite affordable) - one of the smallest rooms I've stayed in, but comfortable for two people - a good number of their rooms only have twin beds. I wouldn't recommend this for couples traveling together unless you are used to sleeping on your own bed. It's a good one for business trips though - gets a bit sketchy after midnight, with some questionable-looking fellows and homeless folks roaming the area - The somewhat noisy AC unit is placed right beside one of the twin beds, and it can get really cold (I used objects to block/redirect the airflow). If you're traveling alone, you can just sleep on the other bed - convenient location - 2 minutes from Eaton Center, AMC theatre, Yonge & Dundas

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful - excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: sars4619
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for here. It is cheap and cheerful and to be honest not as bad as I thought it was going to be based on previous reviews. Booked through quikbook and got a % off as we stayed over 3 nights. I was meeting my brother there who had checked in the night before. When I arrived at the hotel he was not there so I checked in with reception who gave me a key without even asking for ID etc. Strange yes! Anyways the reception area is bright and clean as is the coffee bar - although I did not sample the coffee there. Different story in the hall ways -- old dark carpet, smelly area and deffo no AC on. Thank God we only had to endur that from the elevator door to the bed room. The bedoom itself was fine for our needs as a base to explore the city. 2 single beds, flatscreen tv, wooden floors. Room overlooked a parking lot. Do not think there are any rooms with 'views' here. Bathroom was a little outdated. Needed extra towels - met the cleaning lady in the hallway and she said she would give us extra towels. She apologised for vacuuming - but it didn't bother me as I had just arrived! :) There was one day I was ill and had to spend the day in the room and the cleaning lady asked after me to my brother. Nice. :) Kudos to them. It was a long holiday weekend so there was plenty of activity in the hotel hallways. Got the impression there were gangs of people in some rooms - but we didn't hear them all the time. There was a mixed group of people staying there. Sits right off Dundas Square - 1 min to Yonge Street. You are in the heart of it here and for location purposes I would say yes book it. But if you are looking for more comfort, look elsewhere. We had breakfast at the Senator around the corner and then at Fran's 24-hour breakfast joint which is awesome. Frans Rocks! Airport shuttle bus drops you off and does picks up right outside the door. Book online to get a discount. 1 Vending machine on the lower floor. Very little staff floating around. Overall I would say its a cheap and cheerful option for a quick city stay. It is you basic hotel - I would even say its a step up from a hostel. I would recommend if you are on a budget. No frills but works!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, basic and ever so noisey”
Reviews.Author: Gideon44
