Reviews.Content: Bond Place Hotel is fairly cheap compared to other big Toronto hotels. the rooms are also clean and adequate and the location is fairly good, right slap bang in the middle of everything but it is basic with a capital B There is no swimming pool, no PC terminals, no breakfast arrangements (if your after more than an overpriced coffee), no laundry service and very few staff. It is also the noisiest place I have ever slept in my life, it was like a warzone at night, a factory of door slamming testing, an explosive mixture of paper thin walls, loud voices, creaking beds and loud bangs. So if your after a decent nights sleep, stay away. Not a hotel for young families but if your in Toronto for partying all night, then this may be your cup of tea. A breakfast recomendation would be the Eggspectation cafe bar which is on Yonge Street minutes away from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by the dingy hallways. The rooms are quite good! Good value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: nateno
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online and had no idea what it would be like. When I first walked in my first impression was that the hotel was stylish, clean and euro-chic. However, that look quickly disappeared when I went up the elevator. I stayed in the least expensive room and although the hallways were extremely hot, humid and rather dingy looking, the rooms were much better. Everything looks old and dated but the beds were comfortable, very clean and the hotel was extremely quiet at night. The staff was very friendly and helpful(especially the concierge) and the espresso bar served excellent pastries and coffee. The location next to Eaton Center was very convenient and the tours we booked through the hotel were also worthwhile. Overall a good hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “I LIKED THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: pahotel01
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very central on the square, also good rates!!! Would defo recommend this hotel only one problem i had - house-keeping comes around at 9am every morning (with out fail) banging on your door?? What that about - were on holiday!!! lifts were very slow - but it is a busy hotel and only 3 lifts. o and o computer in lobby for internet! overall id recommend - comfy bed and newly done up - go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel, reasonable prices!”
Reviews.Author: D0mi25
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very good: comfortable beds, not expensive for a hotel in downtown Toronto. I don't understand why there are so many people disappointed of this hotel... Anyway... The rooms are a little bit small, yeah, that's true, but like I said, it was very comfortable, it's a hotel! We were two people to pay the nights. Some youth hostels are almost as expensive as a room in Bond Place Hotel. I was very satisfied of my stay at this hotel. However, breakfasts were not included and we had to pay for Internet. That's my only negative point.

Reviews.Title: “What a Shame, never stay again”
Reviews.Author: Dovxcs
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel being in downtown and newly remodelled. Hotel is remodelled, but service quality needs remodelling. I called so many times at the reception, no answer, finally asked housekeeping lady to get some towels. Breakfast service was nightmare, there was no restaurant on sight as promised on the web site there was only coffee shop located in the lobby. We have to go out to find breakfast. As compared to the quality of serve, room rate was high. We do not mind paying over hundred dollars, if service is good. We asked to speak with the hotel manager upon departure, to express our displeasure, but after three attempts and getting answering machine we quit. We will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city, cheap and great quality”
Reviews.Author: ShiverZ66
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here and were very impressed with the location and service! The best factor about this hotel is that it's directly in the middle of Younge-Dundas Square, which to most is know as a "Miniature Times Square", which they're right! Right next to you is a Hard Rock Cafe (many tasty meals were eaten here) the Toronto Eaton Centre (A HUGE shopping mall that runs under the city, to save you walking in the elements in the Winter season) and the subway! You are also very close to the historical district, which has some of the oldest Cathedrals in Toronto. The hotels lobby was under construction during our stay, but we didn't really know any of it was happening, as they only worked during hours while we were out. The staff were very helpful and they even have a tourist service which can book trips to Niagra Falls for you, which my boyfriend and I gladly took the opportunity of going on! The room was very clean, not terribly spacious, but enough room for the amount of time we were staying there. I enjoyed the fact they had wooden flooring, which were always sparkling! They even had extra pillows, incase you needed them, the beds were very comfortable. There isn't much in the ways of a restaurant/breakfast bar in the lobby, but that didn't bother us as we easily sorted out renting a fridge ($10 per night) to store milk and bought our own breakfast from the many convenience stores around. The only bad part I can mention is not to go walking around the hotel late night, as the area close by may attract some unruly characters. Not really suitable for young women travelling on their own.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty water / Small Room / Comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: ParleGUnit
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is situated nicely near Dundas Square and a Subway that is across the street (I'm talking about the sandwich place) which was pretty helpful for when we wanted to grab a quick sandwich before our train ride out of the city...we were disappointed. Granted, we booked a stay there a day or two prior when we figured out we could not extend our hotel stay at the Holiday Inn for one day longer. We got a quick reservation with no problem. However...the water that came out of the faucets was dirty. Dark brown. Disgusting. We brushed our teeths with bottled water. The bathroom was tiny and a little grungy. The beds were comfortable, although small. I could not open up my suitcase on the floor without it taking up the majority of the space we had to walk around. The walls were EXTREMELY thin. We had drunk partiers as neighbors. Three times I had to call the lobby to ask for someone to knock on their doors and tell them to shut up. NOT PLEASANT when you want to sleep. I would not stay here again. It was disappointing. I am glad we got a hotel room for one more night, but I wish it wasn't this one. It wasn't the worse place I have ever stayed, and I do not mind a small room but this was VERY small. And the brown water is something I cannot forgive.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: GuyTravel
Reviews.Content: The room assigned was tiny. There's room for the bed, but not much else. The room was next to two vending machines (drinks/ice). The bathroom fan is tied to the light, so you must listen to an atrocious fan noise while using the facilities. With the combination of the above two, it sounded like a transport truck was idling in the room the whole night! Management asks for a $100 room deposit. A deposit of $100 US was given to the hotel. The market exchange rate for the week was $100 US = $105 CAN Upon check out when I requested the deposit back, I was given $95 CAN! The hotel kept $10 from the deposit, for no reason. I requested either $100 US back, or $105 CAN. They refused. I will never stay at this hotel again and will be warning friends/relatives about it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: lork
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a flight/hotel package, and got a great price. I arrived at the hotel at about 8pm on a Saturday night, after catching the Airport Express coach from Pearson, which stops right outside the door. Very convenient and, at $32.95 return, cheaper than a taxi. Check in was quick, thankfully, after a long flight from London, and I was given a room on the 8th floor overlooking Dundas Street. The room was a good size for me, with twin beds, a desk, two chairs, a coffee machine (which I did not try, as I'm a coffee snob!) and a full sized ironing board and iron. The rooms have recently been renovated with hard wood floors and big flat screen TV's. The bathrooms don't appear to have been touched and, whilst clean, are a little on the dated side. Not luxury by any means but a great base for exploring this wonderful city. The hotel is literally steps away from Yonge/Dundas Square (I could see the North East corner from my room) and no more than a 3 minute walk across the Square to the Eaton Centre, with plenty of shops and a couple of food courts. There is also an AMC cinema in the Square, in a complex that includes more shops and food options. On the Saturday and Sunday nights, the (free) NXNE festival was happening in Yonge/Dundas Square (I believe Iggy Pop and De La Soul were headlining on respective nights) and the music was LOUD. This is in no way the fault of the hotel, however. This is a fairly busy area (Toronto's equivalent of Times Square, only not as tacky) therefore there is a lot of street noise at times but this did not bother me, as it is part and parcel of city vacations. Some people have mentioned that the beds are uncomfortable. I would describe them as being a little like a pin cushion - very hard base with little padding on top. I did wake up with back ache a couple of times, however, I would much prefer this bed than a soft mattress with no support whatsoever. My room was on the whole really clean, however, I did drop a pair of black shorts on the floor and they were a little bit dusty when I picked them up. I would have liked a full length mirror - there are waist-level ones in the bathroom and above the drawer unit, but a girl needs a head-to-toe view! There was also no towel rail in my bathroom (but marks where one had been) so I had to hang my wet towels over the clothes rail. An in-room safe would have been useful too. I didn't hear much noise from other guests, other than the odd toilet flush or shower. The maid tried to service my room one morning at 8.30 but as I had locked the door, she couldn't get in and came back later. The Hop On/Hop Off buses stop at Yonge/Dundas and there are bus, streetcar (tram) and metro/tube stops in or around the Square. It is about a 15-20 minute walk down Yonge St to the harbour front and attractions such as the CN Tower. As a woman travelling alone, I felt perfectly safe in Toronto, and at this hotel. I loved my trip to Toronto and recommend a side visit to Niagara Falls - truly stunning! I would love to go back and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pool value .. does not deliver what it promises”
Reviews.Author: mgl795
Reviews.Content: Took a long time to check-in. The web site claims to have an on-site restaurant. The in-room TV promotes the onsite restaurant. There is no onsite restaurant. The website claims that breakfast is served. It is not. There is a coffee bar that sells muffins and bagels but no breakfast service. The website claims room service. There is a room service menu in the room. There is no room service. My room was the smallest I have seen for a long time. Necessary to perch on the end of the bed to use the desk. Staff claimed that all rooms were the same. Funny, none of the 5 pictures on the website look like the one I was given. This is not a cheap hotel. I am paying $160 per night. I expect more and will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value: perfectly clean, nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: phyll13
Reviews.Content: Hotel is being remodeled into a slick, elegant designer hotel which will certainly see prices go up sharply soon. The lobby and coffee shop are already done, our room on the 11th floor was not -- but very good nonetheless. Great beds, excellent location, great value! No free wireless and parking, though...

Reviews.Title: “Noooo, not the air conditioning!!!”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoris
Reviews.Content: Can't believe that's how I felt. It was a hot weekend in TO, and I wanted the A/C. The A/C worked really well. What was bad, was the bed location. Right by the A/C so that it blew directly on me. I tried switching to head to toe, and it still happened. I tried covering up part of the A/C so that it didn't blow on me, and that worked well, for me. It cut down enough on the circulation in the room, that the other person with me didn't have such a cool experience. I've stayed here before, it is a convenient location to core downtown. Rooms are tiny. No frills. Oh, did I mention that the bed sucked? What with the wind blowing in my face and the bed rock hard, I didn't really feel like it was a good experience. Last time I stayed here, I just don't think it was - or at least the room was - this crappy. I wouldn't have returned.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel shame about the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: argylefan99
Reviews.Content: My partner and me went to toronto and Niagara falls on a trip organised by our local radio ststion, the bond place hotel was our hotel for Toronto. The staff on reception were very friendly however there were 2 porter type people hanging around who seemd a bit dodgy as did the cleaning staff their eglish was quite poor and as im noty very trusting of people it concerned me especially having read reviews of thibngs going missing and another member of our party reported findinbg their expensve shoes swept under the bed as if the ceaning staff had hid them hoping for them to be left behind. We locked our suitcases when we wne tout uring the day as a reult of other reviews. Our air conditon had gone wrong and they sent 'Lee' up to have a ook a very vry friendly but slightly excentric man who fixed it very quickly which was nice but he made a point of telling us to bolt the door when he left which worried us somewhat. The room itself was very clean and very comfortable the shower was nice and bathroom seemed quite new and clean. The one big downside to this hotel is the breakfast which is ofered as a helo yourself aerican style it was all cold, greasey and most of it was gone by 8 am. e had this included in the price ut i would of been very dissapointed if i had paid the extra for it. The location is great right by dundas square and the eaton centre but just up the road the area was slightly dodgy with lots of people mulling around begging etc. I would recommend this hotel for a good nights sleep and for its location but the breakfast was woeful.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz but Excellent Value for Money and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Angbabes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous for the price. It's clean and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. When we were researching prices for rooms in Toronto this came out one of the cheapest - it is going through a refurbishment at the moment but it didn't impact on our stay. Breakfast is not that great value for money but it did for the first morning then we went to the Subway across the road. The concierge, door, reception and housekeeping staff are hard working, friendly and really go out their way to assist. The hotel is right next to the Eaton Centre so location was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, adequate hotel with excellent location..”
Reviews.Author: tunsttravel
Reviews.Content: The Bond Place Hotel is ideally located in the centre of downtown Toronto, practically across the road from the Eaton Shopping Centre and with everything within easy walking distance. Rooms were basic but adequate and clean, all you need for a city break if you are not spending all day in your room. When we arrived the hotel had no signage on it that it was the Bond Palace, I would hope they are going to correct this soon. Breakfast was disappointing and after the first day we found it better to walk a block and get breakfast elsewhere. But overall, if the price is right and you are staying a couple of days to sightsee then this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mollygreen
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location for this hotel is really good. It's located right behind Dundas/Yonge Square, which is like the downtown area, and where Eaton Center is. The Dundas square in itself is nice. There are chair and you can just sit in there and see the people walking by. On fridays they got street performers in the square, they are definitely fun to watch. There is a subway station in Dundas square too, so everything is nearby. Room was large enough and heater by the window was a god send. Room seemed clean. The bathroom is fine too. The only thing i didn't like too much were the towels. It seems they haven't replaced that in a while, so they were getting thinner. We got the room for around $80 including tax. for this price, you can't find another place with this location. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “staff and hotel a1”
Reviews.Author: len58
Reviews.Content: had a three day stay it is central to most activities ,rooms are clean and well main tained ,i would highly recommend a stay .my name isMR h j l cherrett I live in s/wales great britain .

Reviews.Title: “It is OK”
Reviews.Author: merrywind
Reviews.Content: Bid through Priceline.com and got a standard room at $45/night. When checked in, the front desk staff told us that somebody else had checked in to the room for me. She called many times that hotel staff who processed the wrong check-in. We had to wait for about 20min for this and eventually the guy showed up. After some talk, they told us a different room had only one bed and it could not accommodate three of us (we have a child). It was fair since Priceline only guarantees a double occupancy. We upgraded to a two beds room with $20 upgrade fee. Another overhead cost was parking. Their parking cost us $15 to the noon of the next day. The room was very nice and clean. The sheets and towels were very comfortable. Generally speaking everything inside the room was great. However, since the hotel is in downtown, if you are a light sleeper, this may not be ideal for you because of the noise from the traffic and business. We traveled with a car. With $50/night, there is no problem at all to get a 3* at this season out side downtown through Priceline. Those 3* hotelsâ€™ standard rooms typically have two beds.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Price”
Reviews.Author: jean2007
Reviews.Content: Can you have a New York Time Square in Toronto? I say " Yes you Can" .Younge and Dundas street Square is like the one in N.Y. The hotel room is just half a block from all the shopping,pubs and restaurants you can imagine. Your are 2 minuntes from the square and 20 minute walk from the C.N Tower. We took the Hop on Hop off bus tour for the two days we were in Toronto. Great way to learn the history of the city and to get you to and from all the places you would to visit in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent and good priced hotel 3 1/2 stars”
Reviews.Author: JasonHotelJunkie
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location for this hotel is really good. It's located right behind Dundas/Yonge Square, which is like the downtown area, and where Eaton Center is. The Dundas square in itself is nice. There are chair and you can just sit in there and see the people walking by. On fridays they got street performers in the square, they are definitely fun to watch. There is a subway station in Dundas square too, so everything is nearby. I got a two bed room. Room is big enough, and they probably remodeled recently, since we had a LCD tv in the room. Room seemed clean. The bathroom is fine too. The only thing i didn't like too much were the towels. It seems they haven't replaced that in a while, so they were getting thinner. There's an AC and heater in the room. it's not automatic, but works well. No fridge and no safe in the room neither. There's internet but need to pay. However, that seems to be a norm in Toronto. Finding free wifi was a bit harder than in the US. There are places, just need to look for them. The lobby looks great, and at the time we were there, they were remodeling the lobby and outside area also. we got the room for around $80 including tax. for this price, you can't find another place with this location. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Beats Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: babyboomersss
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews we had second thoughts. When we arrived at Bondplace we were greeted with pleasant welcome from the two young ladies Noory & Kay. We were introduced to the gym and buffet breakfast which could feature more variety for $10. Upon getting to our room, we found the bed to be too small for a larger couple and there was just a few hair on the towels. I dialed zero like the ladies suggested for any questions or assistance and was offered a larger room for only $20 extra. This room was more spacious and had queen(still small) with another bed. The bed was comfy. Aside from the minor hair delemna which we didnt mention since we change room, it was clean. For the price we pay, it was worth the one night and we felt welcomed. If you are not expecting 5 stars then its worth the try. The lobby has a nice beige colour that looks new with white leather couches , but like the reviews mentioned, renovation in the lobby is still in process and there is no room service so ignore the room service menu in the room.Perfect location and parking is only $15 but its not attched to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great for Frugal Traveler”
Reviews.Author: jwprice
Reviews.Content: Stay 3/12 - 3/15. Location is great, notwithstanding other comments that it is a seedy area. (There were some panhandlers, but they were not "aggressive"). Room (double bed) was small but I liked it; wooden floors, comforter on bed, new Phillips 52" TV. One of the female night clerks was somewhat rude. Biggest complaint is that there is no business center. In particular, as a tourist I needed to print out boarding pass for my next day's flights. I asked the clerk if they could please print one out for me. When I first asked at 6 PM (Sunday night) was told to come back later as they were busy. At 9 PM, I got my boarding pass. But was told that this was not normally part of their service provided. Another complaint was that on my floor whenever a door was shut on my wing of the floor, it was very loud !! And Saturday night doors were being open and shut up until midnight, so I did not sleep well. Overall, though, I would recommend this as a good hotel which can be had for under $100 including tax. PS: construction in lobby is still not finished as of 03/15/10.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, you get what you pay for. Good location, rooms a bit lacking”
Reviews.Author: cla598
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great for the budget traveller or someone wanting to go shopping at the Eaton's center due to its close proximity to Dundas Square (like a block away). While not in a super area of the city I found the area not too sketchy. I stayed in a room with a double bed. Bed was a bit lumpy and old and not super comfortable, and moved around. Lots of pillows though. Looked a little dirty so I laid on top with a blanket. The view wasn't that great from my room but I wasn't there much more than to sleep. Inside the room is a small desk, a couple of chairs, headboard with nightstand attached, dresser in the wall, coat rod at the entrance, small bathroom, flat panel tv, and not much each. Nothing fancy. Furniture seemed a bit worn to me. Bathroom was on the smaller side and dated. Shower curtain had some strange red marks (like lipstick) on it, but tiles were adequately clean along with the sink. Good selection of toiletries. Glasses were somewhat dirty when I unwrapped them, so I washed them with the soap. Not any worse than in other hotels I've been in though. Just dated. Most of the room was dated other than the TV. The hallways, elevator, and lobby are nicely updated though. Air conditioner/heater was loud but worked well. Nice hardwood floors instead of the usual grungy carpet. :) In all, it was OK not great but not a horrid place either. Good for a budget traveller or someone wanting to go shopping downtown but not for a business traveller. Internet is NOT free (~$8.99 per day, wireless, but it worked well). Restaurant was closed when I was there so i cannot comment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, helpful pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: B_loGirl
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through priceline. Priceline says all rooms will have either a queen bed or two double beds. Our room only had one double and when I asked the desk since we were told one either 1 queen or two doubles, they said they didn't have rooms with queens or with 2 doubles. This wasn't a problem for us since my husband and I are fine with sleeping together in a double, but it could be an unexpected problem for others who were expecting more room since it didn't match what priceline had guaranteed. We got there at 10:30 am and they allowed us to check in that early. The room was clean and comfortable. Other than the nice TV, the room was kinda spartan with small itchy towels and only one glass but I'm sure if we had asked the staff would have given us a second glass since they seemed accomadating. I can't blame them for not wanting to waste what won't be used but luxuary doesn't seem to be their priority. I am glad they don't provide unneccessary luxuary since it is what allowed us such a fantatstic price. The bed was fine. My husband thought the springs were a little uncomfortable but not enough to keep him from sleeping. I didn't notice them. We checked out the next morning and the front desk workers gladly allowed us to keep our bags in the back room until we came and got them in the evening. The lobby looked very nice. It must have just been redone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Bad Room Choice.”
Reviews.Author: Pixel331
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Bond Place in November and enjoyed my time, I decided to stay again when returning to Toronto for a multiple-night stay with friends. During my November stay, I received a room on the 9th floor that was not on the street side. It was a quiet, small room, and I was pleased with this. However, during my most recent stay, I received a room on the 3rd floor facing the street (Bond Street). This room appeared to be older than the 9th floor room, as some of the plaster was peeling along the floor and paint was chipped here and there on the walls. Yet, the rooms were clean. Aside from the wear/tear, there was not any dirt/grime to be seen. There was quite a bit of street noise, and I could easily hear everything through the walls. Fortunately, it was cold enough out that I could turn on the room fan and block out the majority of this noise. One thing that's hard to beat for this hotel--and the main reason I returned--is the location. It's located within a 1-3 minute walk from Dundas subway station, and it's right by Dundas Square. With Dundas Square so close, there are numerous restaurants and stores all within an easy walking distance. When we returned from our time of sight-seeing in the afternoon/evening, the rooms were cleaned by the staff. However, I did not have enough interaction with the staff to comment on them. Overall: The hotel is very clean and in an excellent location of Toronto, and I would most likely return to this hotel again. However, I would request a room on a higher floor away from the street to avoid the noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel -- good value”
Reviews.Author: KevinFromCanada
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline.com and got a very good deal. This is not a fancy hotel. The rooms are basic but clean & comfortable. The location is fantastic: very close to Dundas Square and the Eaton Centre for shopping. Buses and subway are easily accessible. Hotel lobby and restaurant were being renovated during my stay so I'm sure they will be even nicer the next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, great location but nothing fancy!”
Reviews.Author: lucy1038
Reviews.Content: I stayed here by myself on a leisure trip to Toronto in February. The hotel is in a fab location right on Dundas Square and straight across the road from the Eaton Centre and Dundas subway station. The airport express bus stops directly outside the door. They are currently renovating the hotel so some of the foyer and restaurant are closed. The rooms are clean and newly decorated with a huge flatscreen tv, comfy beds and wooden floors. They are of average size, not huge but not tiny. The bathroom is disappointing as the tiles are stained and the grout looks grubby. They really need to renovate the bathrooms in line with the new rooms. It is cleaned thoroughly daily. There is wireless internet available at 8.95 for 24 hours which is not expensive compared to other hotels I've stayed in. It is important to remember this is a BUDGET hotel and bearing that in mind I think it is great value for the location and service. My room rate was approx $80 a night which is super cheap for downtown. But if you are looking for luxury go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “It was unacommodating, cramped, and the staff didn't understand personal space.”
Reviews.Author: LozloOntario
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I was expecting a 3-4 star hotel. At the check in desk, my colleagues and I were hassled because a friend of ours was helping with our bags and showing us around the city, and they refused to believe that he wasn't staying with us and attempted to force us to get another room. After that mess, when we entered the room, we saw why they would have made us purchase another room; this room was very cramped. Our luggage would not even fit through the space between the far wall and the uneven and uncomfortable single beds. The room was also without any sort of refrigeration unit, which you would expect from a supposed 3-4 star hotel. The hair dryer was also broken, though the staff insured that it wasn't. I also like my things how I leave them, so when I did not wish for the staff to organize and clean the room, they became very nosy and suspicious, to the point where when I requested more towels, the manager himself attempted to convince me to let them come in and clean right then. I was not impressed. The walls are also paper thin, and all night I could only hear a man and a woman arguing in some Asian dialect. And upon check out, I was hit with surprise changes for one local phone call from my room. The new look and renovations certainly do not make up for the lack of hospitality. The organization and management of this hotel is very unprofessional. I would not recommend the Bond Place Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LessStuffMoreLife
Reviews.Content: We were hooked up with Bond Place through Priceline, and after reading the reviews here, I wasn't sure what to expect. We were very pleasantly surprised to find a clean, comfortable hotel in the heart of the city, that's easy walking distance to the subway, Dundas Square, Eaton Center, Nathan Phillips Square, etc. We paid $65 a night (through Priceline) for a corner "suite" which included a queen bed and two twins. TV, coffee maker, hairdryer, ironing board, all the usual stuff you'd expect in a hotel were there. The room was spotless and comfortable, we had a great view of Yonge Street. Like the previous reviewer,. we saw construction in the lobby, but really -- we weren't there to hang out at our hotel. I didn't need to request anything special of the staff, but they seemed friendly and helpful enough. Parking is across the street, $15 a day. Some reviewers have complained about the neighborhood. We came in the winter, and felt comfortable walking from Yonge to our hotel. I'm not sure what Bond Place was like before, but the updates have made it a great and inexpensive hotel right in downtown Toronto. We'll definitely stay there again next time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “rough area , filthy rooms”
Reviews.Author: MISSPICO
Reviews.Content: toronto had alot of hotels booked out so while i was waiting for my friend to get back into the city i was forced to stay at the bond place , i needed somewhere to put my stuff and i had some of my friends luggage has well .Even though the hotel is on a corner right by the eatons centre and downtown young street it is located behind young and is an area of town that is very rough with very rough people, even people are selling drugs by the front door , bums all around it .I was so scared in the room and was completly stuck there for that night. i put all our stuff on stilts in the hotel to keep it all away from anything and then i left the room , i didnt feel safe there at all , i had to pretend i was a street kid in that neighbourhood just so no one would bother me cause theyd thought i had nothing. I did not sleep that night , i stayed up and had to hang out in the streets like a bum i was tired and upset about it and had demanded my money back , i did get a full refund and that is great but it was such a horrible experience. I was so happy to see my friend when she came back , we got a much better room the following night , luckily a room became available for us . do not stay in this part of toronto , in toronto u really do get what you pay for . apon refund i had asked them if they had ever had bugs in there hotel and they said they have had to spray in the past . so be sure to ask the hotels before you stay . im lucky to be alive and wel lafter that one .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, service and Value”
Reviews.Author: Wxyz001
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Canada. We wanted to be in downtown, Bond Place choice was great. Price and location was good. We were nicely greeted by reception staff and concierge. During our stay we had problem with the room card, a fine gentleman at the reception was very helpful. Construction in the lobby was inconvenient, but what you can do. We liked the hard wood floor. Overall our stay was very good. If we visit Toronto in future, we will stay at Bond Place.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service - What's that?!”
Reviews.Author: MelbNYC
Reviews.Content: They say service can make or break a hotel - and that's what happened to me at Bond Place Hotel Toronto. We had a been on a 3 week trip of the USA and had booked a leg in Canada. Our travel agent organised the room at Bond Place Hotel. We arrived to the hotel at check in time and our room was not ready. The "robotic" staff behind the counter told us to take a seat in the lobby - only problem was there were no seats as a youth group of around 40 or so people were hanging around there also. It's fine that we had to wait - what's not fine is that rather than the desk clerks looking after us and checking back with us on the status of our room, we seemed to be forgotten and only the nice gentleman who took up the bag who kept checking back with us and asked us why we were still sitting there - I believe it was actaully him that got us our room otherwise we probably would have been sitting there all night. My travel agent had pre ordered me a Mini bar fridge for medical purposes (my life threatening medication needs to be kept in a refridgerator at all times when not in use). I then double checked with my travel agent in regards to this and she assured me a request had been made (as was on my paperwork also). When we checked in finally I reminded the receptionist of the fridge and she said it would be sent up right away. Once we got to our room (which I found to be neat and nicely newly renovated - nice big tv, hard wood floors, comfy beds and a fabulous heating system - bathroom was satisfactory but could do with a makeover also), we fell asleep due to being on an overnight flight. I thought I'd be awoken to the person bringing up the fridge but I was not - I then rang front desk and was informed quite bluntly that there were now no fridges available as a client had extended their hire. I proceeded to tell reception that I was a diabetic and my insulin had to be kept in the fridge at all times - and of course that I had pre ordered and confirmed the fridge prior to (not to mention at check in was told it was availible). I believe under the circumstances they should have tried to rectify the situation - it wasn't for alcoholic beveradges or snacks after all. I was then told they could bring me up a bucket of ice. If this was the best they could do, I would have to accept it. An hour passed and no one came up - by this stage I was quite irate. I'm not the type of person to ring up and abuse or demand at hotels - but this was the final straw. When I rang to ask where the bucket of ice was I was told rudely that I could go get it myself from another floor!! If I had known I could get it all along I would have - well after all this I went to get it myself and low and behold the ice machine didnt work! Luckily I ran into a more helpful staff member there and he brought a bucket up to my room. It seemed the service staff (except reception) were the helpful people in the place. This may seem like a stupid situation for some people - but when my health could possibly be affected by poor service from a hotel - I was genuinely distressed and upset. This situation tarnished what could have been a pleasant stay at this hotel. On a positive note - the location is perfect (especially if you like to shop, go out to restaurants or check out a film at the cinema)

Reviews.Title: “it was excellent”
Reviews.Author: far0ut
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to visit my sister in Toronto but we didn't want to stay in her house so we booked a room in Bond Place Hotel for 60$ a night only (through Easy Click web site) and it was excellent, much more than we ever expected for this price!! Though its 3 stars rated I would think it is 4 stars. It is very clean, very pretty, tidy and well set. The service was as well excellent. I would like to recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: OntarioFamilyGuy
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location right on the edge of Yonge-Dundas Square during the daytime for shopping, theatre and any other downtown Toronto visit. The block and a half from Yonge can be a little scary at night, but not if you're used to any other big city. Great little pub located across the street (Imperial Pub) with a jukebox that boasts lot's of Sinatra. But I digress, back to the hotel. A strange layout to some of the rooms, I think it may have been an apartment hotel at one time, so our triple occupancy was in three single beds, two in one part of the room, and the third in an adjacent area. Decent LCD TV and new wood floors and the bathroom had been redone. Clean enough and staff were all very helpful. Lobby and restaurants were being re-done, something that wasn't mentioned when we booked, but it wasn't really a hassle and there are lot's of eating places nearby. There is dedicated underground parking, but it's a little weird in that it is under a building across the street. It is supposed to be secure, and there is a call box to call the front desk clerk to let you in, but every time I went in and out, either the door was already open or someone else was coming out, so easy to get in. That being said, we experienced no problem with parking. So to sum up, ya get what you pay for, and the location/price are hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jianf56
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best budget hotel in downtown Toronto! Room: small but seemed totally new Bed: great, nice duvet cover Bath: very clean Only place left to makeover in Hotel are corridors. But you don't stay in the hall. Housekeeping: excellent Security: can't get to room floors without card key Literally only steps to the heart of downtown Toronto (Dundas Square)

Reviews.Title: “Tiny smelly room with worn out furniture”
Reviews.Author: Fiona1212
Reviews.Content: I have never been in an hotel room that was so small. The mattress was paper thin and the bed frame was rusted so every time I moved, the bed made a loud squeaking sound. It is more like a shabby motel than a hotel. The room smelled like toilet cleaner and the furniture was old and worn out. I spent as little time in the room as possible because it was so dumpy and depressing. The location was great though. I don't mind slumming it but not for $79 a night. You would get the same kind of experience in a youth hostel for a lot less money.

Reviews.Title: “ewww”
Reviews.Author: doodycalls
Reviews.Content: We did a montreal / niagra / toronto - all the hotels we stayed in were great, until we arrived here, simple requirements a clean none smoking room, when we arrived in the room it stank of stale smoke, the bathroom was dirty looking and the bed looked unclean, the final straw was the shower head was missing. We stayed in the raddison niagra, top floor, over looking at the falls - and to say this hotel was a come down is an understatement, I didn't expect it to be on par with the room we had in Niagra, but this was ridiculous, I wen't down to reception and asked to have a change of rooms, one that was clean, had a shower head and didn't stink of stale smoke. She refused, and was rude saying that she would go and inspect the room and also it's all non smoking ( as if she didn't believe me, I know the smell of stale smokey rooms - not smoke that lingers from clothing this was in the room), at this point , I said I am unhappy with the accommodation provided can you void our payment, which she did with childish unprofessionalism, we then went to the comfort quality inn (sorry can't remember the exact name), but down the street from the Bond. Compared to the Bond this was clean, comfortable and same price, my advice is compare prices of other hotels in TO, I would advice avoiding this one. Toronto is a fantastic vibrant place to visit, don't spoil it by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for teenagers, nice people”
Reviews.Author: meowmeow_9
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for teenagers visiting Toronto. The location is amazing, just minutes from the Eaton Centre and all the shopping, though it is a little far from the bar and club districts, it is still a great location. There is parking across the street in the deck for about 10-15 dollars a day which is a good price for a big city. When we visited, we had lost our car key at the bar the night before we were supposed to check out. (we live 5 hours away and locksmiths wanted $250 for a new key). After being so frustrated and not knowing what to do, we stayed in the lobby for hours trying to figure out a solution. The guy on the concierge noticed how upset we were and he helped us by calling Canada's roadside assistance program or whatever, under his name, so we could get into my car at least. They staff even let us keep our luggage behind the desk while we waited for someone to come get us. The staff there were probably the nicest people we've ever met in Toronto. Besides that, the rooms were okay. not amazing but certainly worth the price. The elevators were very slow and crowded and the lobby didnt have a bathroom, but besides this, We are going to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, and very cheap and well located”
Reviews.Author: GirlFromMay
Reviews.Content: 2 stays, 2 rooms as good, wide, clean, wonderful view. Very quiet, the staff is very helpful and you're right in the city center. For a ridiculous low cost !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Rileypup
Reviews.Content: This place is in a fabulous location - just next to Dundas Square! The hotel itself has been renovated within the last 18 months and it makes a huge difference. We had stayed there during a trip to Toronto in 2007 and it was ok but now it's much better. It's a lot brighter and the rooms are nicely decorated. The bed was huge and had plenty of pillows - which was great as a lot of places only give you one pillow. The room had a large flatscreen tv with a good variety of channels. The bathroom was fine - good shower! The staff were all friendly and the cleaners were very thorough. We never used the restaurant mainly because Toronto has loads of great places to eat but also the restaurant menu wasnt great and looked a bit over priced for what they were offering.

Reviews.Title: “Different price-”
Reviews.Author: sdffgg
Reviews.Content: I checked the price before I come over the Internet. when I reached Bond hotel they told me since I am going to pay cash they will charge me higher. After the taxes I went up paying 25% more than what I thought. anyway I asked the reception to let me choose the room put they say they have nobody to accompany me. i picked my room randomly. the room was clean, quiet, however the bed was squeaky. The location of the hotel was great and close to the bus station that takes you to the airport so it was really a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice average hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mountain820
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel, which is fine. It's clean, and is in a great location. At this price range it's good value in a place like Toronto. Room is a bit small but comfortable... I absolutely needed a good night's sleep and got it here. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but value for money”
Reviews.Author: fiferforever
Reviews.Content: The hotel was right in the heart of the city. close to all the action. The staff where very helpful and cheery. The room was basic but very clean. I was here for 2 weeks and did not have one problem. On several occasions i did not leave the room until afternoon, yet when i come back the room had been made. Excellent service i felt. I never tried the restaurant or bar as i eat out or got take away most of the time (gained a pound or 2 that fortnight) so i cannot comment of that. But very friendly staff and clean room with good service. What more do you need.

Reviews.Title: “Deffo stay again”
Reviews.Author: Nilias
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and thought it was an excellent hotel, considering the price of the rooms. Location is excellent, right in the centre of the city, 20 walk will get you anywhere you want to go in the city so excellent for site seeing and browsing around. While the reception area and restaurant might be basic enough, the staff are lovely and the rooms, while not 5* standard, are very well kept. Housecleaning serviced our room everyday, we had all the tourist brochures you needed in the room and a flat screen TV. Deffo recommend it, no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!! I awoke with my body covered in bugs and bites!”
Reviews.Author: bruno_andrea1
Reviews.Content: This place is horrible. Not only did I awake covered in bites and bugs crawling over me, but the onsite manager accused my friend and I of bringing the bugs in. They changed rooms, but upon checkout tried to charge us for local calls and then in the weeks following refused me emails and calls about my huge dry cleaning bill. The paranoia of bring bugs home consumed me for two weeks. I would never stay here or recommend anyone else staying here. They are jerks with a serious bed bug problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CarolJulieSarahBrian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bond Place Hotel from 4th to 11th October, we found the staff to be friendly and helpful especially the lady concierge who arranged all our trips, booked the restaurant at the CN Tower twice ( highly recomended) and even took us to the bus stop to buy our tour bus ticket. She also booked our tickets for a show, gave us directions to get there and even phoned our room to check we were ready as the theatre was out of the city and we had to get a train. we were booked for continental breakfast which was good with plenty of coffee. We found the hotel to be clean and our towels were changed every day. Again we would like to say thanks to the lady concierge as it was her day off when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Staff work hard to make it a good stay”
Reviews.Author: trudytravel
Reviews.Content: I agree with a lot that the last reviewer says: it is an ugly building, but the staff try so hard to be helpful. I was surprised to read the review where a complaint that there was no queen sized bed was met with rudeness. We asked to be changed from a double bed (it was so small!) to a twin room, and the delightful receptionist apologised for the error, and immediately directed us to another room. The lady on the Concierge desk was just as helpful and charming, and answered lots of questions and sorted out our trip to Niagara Falls. What I didn't like was having to give a Visa card for any extras. We like to pay as we go, and don't like having to check our Visa bill in case of mistakes. is this practice really necessary? The room was small and a bit scruffy, and I'm not convinced it was as clean as I would like, although I didn't do the flannel test! The hotel is in a great location, very convenient for shopping and nightlife. We found two great restaurants just up the road, The Senator, where the helpful manager told us the best place to go for an evening drink http://www.thesenator.com/ (and it's much better than the CN Tower, with its overpriced food and poor service) called the Manulife Centre, and a 24 hour cafe, where I got the best fresh orange juice I have ever had, called Frans. We also visited the Islands and were rewarded with a beautiful sunny, warm day. It's great over there, take a picnic and sit by the water and watch the wildlife. We hired bikes, but the bike shop was closing down on the day we went, and won't be open until Spring. We went to New York from Toronto - and what a contrast! In Toronto people are so helpful and laid-back, whereas everyone seems very uptight in NY. A number of times in Toronto, when we standing on a street studying a map trying to work out which way to go, people stopped to offer help, in one case actually walking to our destination with us. In case anybody from Toronto is reading this, thank you for your friendliness. I love your city and hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Kalvinsdad
Reviews.Content: My partner and I traveled to Toronto this past weekend for our friends 50th birthday party. We checked several on line travel web sites such as Expedia and Orbitz for the best deals. After several days of searching we decided to try PriceLine.com. We put in an offer of $60.00 per night plus taxes. To our surprise it was accepted by the Bond Place Hotel. Not expecting much for our $60.00 dollars a night I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is located in a very busy area of downtown Toronto. Near the Eaton Centre and several other stores and attractions. (The only negative thing in the area is that there are many homeless people that beg all day and night) Upon approach the hotel is less than pleasant to the eye. A drab brown building that needs a major facelift or a good paint job to cheer it up a bit. Inside the lobby is small and also a bit drab but if this sounds like a complaint it is not ,just the truth. We were greeted with smiles and hellos by the entire staff upon pur arrival. To our surprise our room was ready at 9:30am (we traveled from New Jersey on a 6:30 am flight). The front desk clerk was pleasant and wished us a good stay. Our room, 504, was a bit small with a double bed but it was bright and clean. (I checked by using a wash cloth and wiped the floor & bathroom to check for dirt, yes i am anal!) It did overlook the alley and building next door but it was quiet our entire stay. The service was excellent from this point on. Whenever we called for something it was done immediately. For example we needed extra towels and an iron. Housekeeping brought it up and thanked us for staying at the hotel. When we needed directions we went down to the small Concierge desk in the lobby and were given a map which the concierge high lighted so that we could read it properly. Again all with a smile. You may notice that I keep saying that the staff smiles and said hello. This is extremely improtant in the Hospitality business. I have worked in hotels for 29 years now and am atuned to the difficulties the staff has in dealing with guests. I worked for Four Seasons Hotels for 5 years and this company is noted for service. This staff really knows what they are doing. (May not be up to Four Seasons standards but good none the less). I thank you all fro making a special weekend even more special. Sincerley, Louis DiNapoli

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Everything else was Horrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KatelyndL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bond Place Hotel on a Friday night. I had called to book and they told me that I would be getting a room with a Queen bed. First of all they don't even have Queen size beds in this hotel. When we checked into the hotel it was a little after 3 (which is their check in time). They set us up with our room and told us we had a Queen bed. When we got to the room it was extremely small and had 2 single beds!! When I went down to tell the front desk that they had making a mistake. They were extremely rude and told us that they had booked all the queen size bed rooms earlier in the day and that they were charging me for the Queen room when I was really getting the 2 singles. When I got home and looked at my Visa bill they had charged me twice for the room. I sat on the phone for over an hour waiting to talk to someone about it and then they hung up on me! This was the worst experience that I have ever had with a hotel in Toronto. The staff was rude. Our washroom was nasty. We didn't get the room we booked. Overall I suggest paying the extra $10 to stay at a Best Western or somewhere where the staff is willing to be nice

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel and very good location”
Reviews.Author: Ney
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to Toronto in 5 years. Hotel rooms are basic with a bath/shower, LCD TV with just the basic cable channels and a tea/coffee maker. We was happy with that as we was out 80% of the time. The location of the hotel is very good as you are just a 5min walk from the big Eaton Centre and Dundas Sq. Staff at the hotel do try to be as helpfull as they can be. You are also a tram ride away from the CN tower or a 12/15min walk away. There is no bar at the hotal they class the bar across the street as the hotel bar as they have a deal with them for 25% off bar food for anyone staying at the hotel. Overall if you are just looking for a basic hotal for a few nights with a very good location then this is really the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for Bait & Switch”
Reviews.Author: MarcoCanada
Reviews.Content: Booked and paid for room via Travelocity.ca On arrival after some delay at counter Front Office Supervisor emerged to tell us that room was not available. However arrangements had been made at "sister" hotel Days Inn on Carleton Street and that manager there would be meeting us in the lobby. Explained that this hotel was inconvenient to our evening plans being about 10 blocks away. Meant nothing we were being consigned to Days Inn. On arrival there - no manager and when we asked to speak to him reply was "get in line like everyone else" When asked why Bond Place told us manager would be waiting he just said "take it up with the Bond Place" He needs a P.R.101 course. Anyway room awful and price $22 less than we apid Travelocity/Bond Place. No price adjustment offerred. Advice stay away from both hotels. Al D. Collingwood, Ontario.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at this downtown Toronto hotel”
Reviews.Author: Macabee87
Reviews.Content: My sister and I made a solo trip to Toronto (we are both under 22) this summer for an adventure. We went to a couple different shopping districts, the Royal Ontario Museum, and the Toronto Zoo. If you can believe it, we accomplished all of it in 1 and a half days! All thanks, of course, the the centrality and convenience our hotel. We stayed at the Bond Place hotel, and certainly were not disappointed! We were extremely nervous about staying downtown, but there was 24-security in the reception area, which made 2 solo girls feel very safe in and around the building. Sure, on first impression it felt like the neighborhood was rather shady, but the opposite is true. The room was IMMACULATE; extremely clean, pristine sheets, newly renovated flooring and storage space, and a beautiful view of downtown. We did not try the in-house restaurant, but walked instead to the Toronto Eaton Centre, which hosts a food court. There is also the Hard Rock Cafe, Milestones, Jack Astor's, etc. right nearby. Also within short walking distance is a gas station, several convenience stores and a delivery pizza place (can't remember what it was called). If you are looking for a large, luxurious room with all the amenities (such as a pool or fitness centre), perhaps the Bond is not for you. Besides, in downtown Toronto, why would you want to spend your time in the pool when there's so much else to do right next door? If all you need is a comfortable, safe place to sleep for less that $100 per night in downtown Toronto, you cannot go wrong! The rooms are quiet, despite the contrary when you are out in the halls. The front desk is open 24-hours, but if you reserve online they like you to let them know if you'll be checking in late, if you require a refrigerator, etc. Very close to TTC (Toronto's Subway system), and of course, easy to catch a cab. Overall, a great hotel to accommodate 2 shoppers/sightseers of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: sleeplesstrio
Reviews.Content: Booked The Bond Place Hotel for 4 nights (29 Aug to 2 Sept) some time before the trip based on the good reviews in trip advisor. I was quoted the rate of $117/night. I requested for a 3-bedded room on a high floor and asked for a confirmation by email, but received none. It was touted to have a good location at the junction of Yonge and Dundas Streets, with easy access to many attractions of Toronto. Not mentioned was that the hotel is located on the street junction of Yonge and Dundas East (where the seediness begins). The hotel is far from the Promenade of Lake Ontario, CN Towers, Rogers Centre and Entertainment District. Checked into the hotel late 28th August after a tiring flight from Vancouver. Felt immediately that it was a wrong choice. The Front Desk personnel quoted the rate of $159/night and retained my Visa Card. I objected the rate and asked if we could stay only for 1 night. Was told that I'd still have to pay for all 4 nights. Was given a 3-single bedded room on the 5th floor. I requested again for a higher room. The lady at the Front Desk appeared irritated and told me none were to be had. I asked for my card, but she said she had to make a copy of it. The very small room was not carpeted, the large aircon by one of the beds took up precious space, the table lamp wasn't working and the TV remote control wasn't working properly and jumped channels on its own. Both windows of the room faced a building construction site reaching up to the 8th storey and was so near that the workers could easily look into the room. As I had 2 teenage daughters with me, we'd to close the windows and draw the curtains owing to the noise and visibility. The bathroom was passable although the wall had mould stains. With our luggages on the floor, there was barely enough space to trip around. As we were very tired, we decided to take the room and make the best of it. The noise from garbage trucks woke us every morning at about 4.30am. Followed by the traffic and from Monday, the construction work. We spent as much time as possible out of the hotel and paid for all our undertakings with cash. So I did not miss my Visa card. Each evening when we had to return, I'd knots in my guts just thinking of the room which felt like an isolation cell. After sleepless nights to Tuesday morning, I decided not to stick it out anymore and complained to the Day Manager. He apologised and said that they had a couple of rooms on each floor with 3-single beds! He offered us a another much bigger room on the 11th floor with the windows facing the town and a discount on the rate of the first 3 nights. We went to Niagara Falls that whole day looking forward to returning to a better rest that night. We got to know the room better after dinner when we showered. There was no hairdryer, so I'd to go with wet hair to bed. The toilet leaked when flushed - a pool of water of unknown quality gathered on the floor, which we used the floor mat to soak up - yeeks! On Wednesday, we'd only 3/4 day to flight home. I went down in the morning to checkout and sign the bill. Knowing their checkout time to be 11am, I asked if we could hold the room till 3pm as our flight was at 7pm. The Front Desk personnel said that there would be a charge of $20. The presented bill showed full charges for all 4 nights. I asked what happened to the discount on the rate of the first 3 nights offered by the Day Manager and he replied he knew nothing of it. When I wanted to sign the bill he took it back, said that it was not necessary to be signed and that it will be booked against my card. I noted the total of the bill was Cn$741, but there was no copy given to me. They did not mention that they still had my card nor attempted to return it to me. After a short trip to town and lunch I returned to the hotel to get ready for trip to airport. I asked the concierge to book us a Taxi. There was an official flat rate of $50 to the airport. The Taxi charged me $55, the extra $5 being for the hotel, which made the booking. Upon arrival home, I noticed my card had not been returned and stopped it. This hotel is exceptional in its audacity to rip off its customers.

Reviews.Title: “what more do you need?”
Reviews.Author: krazykritik
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Bond Place since it opened in early 80's..simple, accessible, PERFECT location to all downtown attractions from the CN Tower to Roy Thompson Hall to Old Massey Hall, Eaton Centre, Rogers Centre, Air Canada Centre, subways, City Hall, Chinatown, Nathan Philips Square, Toronto General Hospital, Harbourfront, St. Lawrence Market, theatres, parliament buildings, etc.. affordable parking..it's no Taj Mahal but is clean, neat, desk people are always courteous and quick..ONLY drawback is no swimming pool which I believe if they got one would make this the ONLY hotel I'd stay at in Toronto when needing to access downtown..a very practical place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: HannibalNetherlands
Reviews.Content: We made a booking through Travelzoo.com. We had a spacious family room (one queen and two twin beds). The staff is very helpful and pleasant. Parking garage was close by and we had to pay CAD 15 (tax incl.) per night, which quite reasonable in this part of town. Location is terrific, with the Eaton Centre, as well as public transportation right around the corner. So if you want to be in the heart of the lively city, don't complain about a bit of noise. Looking for a place to have breakfast? Go to Wimpie's on 225 Church Street, which is accross the parking lot. Great breakfast and during the week the have a special for a great price. The staff (especially Cindy) is great. While visiting Toronto, do not forget the Distilery District. And if you don't have a lot of time, you can try the Hippotour (near CN Tower). In 1 1/2 hours you see and hear quite a lot of Toronto. We would certainly come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...but”
Reviews.Author: hluvsm
Reviews.Content: Great Location off Dundee into Yonge Street. Easy walking distance to downtown Toronto. But....there was a weird smell in the Hallway during our 3 day stay on the 4th floor. The rooms are very small with two twin beds, not doubles. Although I did o.k sleeping. TV was a nice flat screen and programming was fine. The bathroom was o.k it did the trick. The room was clean no carpeting on the floors, which I think is a nice change. They were hardwood. My brother like the fitness center, I didn't try it, I did enough walking around Toronto to justify all my eating there. No swimming pool, that was disappointing. Parking was across the street and a little cumbersome to get to. Should have walkway underneath or something. The have a restraunt, did eat there, thought they were a little more expensive then we wanted. Overall, If you are looking for extras, this is probable not it. If you can get a deal on the room it is a decent stay; but I wouldn't pay what they ask for without a deal. Front desk staff acted like it didn't really matter if you where there or not. A couple of times I heard a young lady there snap at room guests on the phone regarding inquires if wirelss internet was free. (Which it is not.)

Reviews.Title: “Noisy & noisy - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kippagh
Reviews.Content: If you're staying in the rear of the hotel and you're a light sleeper you've no hope of getting a decent night's sleep. For some unknown architectural reason they put the fans (there are about 5 of them and I can only presume they've something to do with the air conditioning system) about 10 feet off the ground and they belt out their noise 24 hours a day from the back of the hotel. Initially we were put on the 4th floor overlooking them and we requested a change. We were moved to a floor higher up but it didn't help much given the noise of the fans. I had ear plugs in and still the hum of the fans came through. They're loud during the day but at night when there nothing else to drown out the sound of them the noise is incredible. It's an architectural disaster whoever decided to put the fans where they are located. The hotel is in a great location, the rooms are clean and it is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget choice in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: malcognito
Reviews.Content: I selected Bond Place based on reviews on TA, a competitive rate from Expedia and the convenient location close by Ryerson University. I was here for a week on business and most of the uni is within a couple of blocks. My room was fairly small and the furniture was well worn although reasonably clean. The aircon was ancient and incredibly noisy so best turned off at night. The bathroom complemented the room - ready for renovation but plenty of hot water and clean towels. No complaints because it's what you expect in this price bracket. A better than average flat screen TV had a good choice of channels including BBC World. Wi-fi was expensive for short stays but almost reasonable on the weekly plan. The restaurant was disappointing. Breakfast was a total shambles with only one effective member of staff struggling to keep her head above water. On my second day the whole sequence took over an hour and I decided to look elsewhere next day. The restaurant was almost deserted in the evening and had a really depressing atmosphere. Service was grim with one unsmiling waiter who delivered food wordlessly. So, I didn't go back in the evening either! As an alternative try Senator Restaurant (www.thesenator.com) which is just round the corner, 2 minutes walk. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner - and everything about it is the opposite of Bond Place. Great food, friendly service, chatty staff, top background music! There's also a diner just down the street from Bond Place (on Dundas - just across the parking lot) but I didn't try it. Like other writers, I also found the hotel noisy from time to time. Worst was a massive party of kids (I think there were about 300 of them but perhaps it just seemed that way!) who took over the lobby and the lifts one evening. They weren't any trouble, just over excited and under supervised. The immediate vicinity isn't too attractive: there's a major building project underway right next door so lots of dust, sidewalks closed, construction traffic...... Many of the shops sell either trashy souvenirs or cheap fashion. There's a couple of food outlets in the cinema complex (AMT) and of course, loads of food court options in the Eaton Mall which is 5 minutes away. From the airport, the Shuttle coach takes about 1 hour and cost (I think) $34 CAN for the return trip. Good value but be warned - Bond Place is the last drop and first pick-up point!

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmills
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in Downtown district, close to main shopping area. Room was clean, with toiletries, coffee maker, flatscreen TV, hairdryer, plenty of storage. Restaurant area that served breakfast and evening meal, breakfast was fine and reasonably priced - didnt eat in evening. Gym was free to use, had two treadmills, one sit down bike and one cross trainer. One main weights machine, and plenty of free weights, mats and medicine ball. Hotel was fairly noisy at night, it wasnt too loud it stopped you sleeping but it was fairly audible! It is two minutes from main shopping area, 20 minute walk to union station, 30 minutes to harbour front, 30 minutes to entertainment district, one hour walk to casa loma, one hour 30 minutes to the Beaches - all accessible via public transport also. One pub opposible, not that great, smelt of chip fat and the food wasnt great. A couple of bars/restaurants in the shopping complex opposite (as well as a cinema). all in all, good value for money hotel, decent central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: Philwilltravel
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel for money, great loctaion, pity wi-fi not included in price as most other hotels in Canada, very pricey per hour.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located”
Reviews.Author: orense23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the city center near Dundas square ,the famous shopping mall Eaton centeris just 2min walk. lots of activity going on in this location ,well recommended, dont forget Woo chinese buffet..not to be miss

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: vircan
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for a better location, but could have used better double glazing as I found it very noisy from the outside traffic including helicopter at local hospital. Another point is that although there is 2 queen size beds in the room they are not doubles so a room for three was not big enough. even though it was booked onl;ine with the amount of people that would have occupied it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Desicooltraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my mother for 3 nights/4 Days. Its a great value for money hotel. It is close to and in a walkable distance for main attractions like Art Gallery of Ontario, Royal Ontario Museum, Hockey Hall of Fame. Toronto Eaton Center and PATH is actually couple of blocks away. Greyhound bus terminal is at a walkable distance and If you are traveling onwards to others cities nearby then this hotel is a good choice. The rooms are clean with a TV. The air condition in my room was making some noise and is really old fashioned. They did not have a centralized Air Condition. The toilets are well lit and was in good clean condition. For those who wants to grab something on the way, Subway is just across the street. The hotel staff are courteous and were good in service. I actually arranged for a Niagara falls tour from the hotel Concierge. The hotels website needs to be little more attractive. If you are looking for some place to sleep for couple of nights and do not requires fancy stuff like clubs, pools and like to save some money then I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: debster10
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the end of May and Bond Place Hotel fit the bill. The hotel is in a very central location and we were able to walk to many places. The room was spacious for two people (though the bed was just a double), had a flat screen tv, and a decent bathroom. On the downside, the room smelled a little, we could hear a lot of noise- both street level (we were on the 9th floor) and from the hallways (mostly slamming doors), the elevators seemed particularly slow, had to pay for internet connection, and parking was a bit expensive. But we didn't stay in our hotel room very much and basically just needed a clean room and bathroom. The hotel more than met my needs.

Reviews.Title: “great location, basic hotel to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: gofor3days
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent location. Came off the subway and was able to find in immediately. Eaton Center is right across the road. I was going to the convention center, which was about a 25 min walk, but could have taken the subway easily. Can walk around the TO core sightseeing ect no problem. No amenities, quite dated, but clean and when you are not going to there very much, perfect. There was quite a lot of siren noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: facube
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Good location. Rooms are decent. The concierge, Paul, was very helpful. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in downtown T.O.”
Reviews.Author: Dan-Hfx
Reviews.Content: We just love the Bond, Airport shuttle stops at the door, the staff is first class, the food in the resturant is very taste, but not fancy, just good food. The rooms are small actually very small but we spend very little time in our hotel when we travel so that really not an issue for us, we have stayed in much nicer hotels but the Bond is one of the best values we have even gotten in our travels. It is in a great location, next to Dundas Square which has T.O TKTS and close to the subway and some theatres.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter0511
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Bond Place and again i was impressed. Its a great value for money hotel in a good location for the Eaton centre and Yonge St. Since my last trip it has been modernised and has flat screens TV's in the rooms. I would recommend to those on a budget but want to be right in the centre of Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday for a long time.”
Reviews.Author: SACOOPER
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 13 nights. Hotel staff couldn't be more helpful. Concierge was extremely helpful, giving me directions, arranging trips, nothing was too much bother. Room had been redecorated, lovely new bed,flat screen tv, great shower, coffee maker, use of iron. All the comforts of home. I have no reservations at all in recommending this hotel, and it would be my first choice if I return to Toronto. Great situ for shops, movies, food, transport, sightseeing tours.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: shurryl--
Reviews.Content: I stayed there over the weekend and I really enjoyed my time there! I would definitely recommend and go back to this hotel in the future. The staff were wonderful: the asian girl working at the front desk (I think her name was Jackie) to check me out was very helpful. I had many questions about the bill and she explained it to me very thoroughly. She gave me suggestions for places for breakfast. Overall, she was very helpful and it really completed my stay there. The quality of the hotel really is average. The rooms are a bit small, but big enough to fit the beds in there. But for the price, it really wasn't half bad! We've had some problems with the TV but the front desk said that it was a newly renovated room so some things aren't functioning as well and they sent someone up to fix it. Housekeeping were very clean and efficient and they were really friendly ladies. The hotel is going under renovations and I saw the renovations in the lower level. I would come back in the future just to see the renovations!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Juliana_SP1
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, it's a perfect place to stay in Toronto, especially considering the price. As the price is low, you don't have free internet, for example. Although there's wireless in the hole building, you have to pay around $9, I can't remember exactly, to use it for 24hrs. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown location, dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: nikkimet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bond Place for one night while attending a Show in Toronto, the hotel is literally a 2 minute walk to Dundas Square and the Eaton Centre, it took about a half hour to get to China Town (walking) The room was a decent size and was well appointed but was not clean. There was hair in the bathroom (on the counter, floor and sink) . I could have dealth with this however when I turned down my bed I found hairs in the sheets I was repulsed! My friend and I also got stuck in the elevator for a few minutes, just before we began to panic it moved...... The location couldn't be better for the price, but if germs and dirt gross you out don't stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: laurameee26
Reviews.Content: The hotel was all we needed for a base to explore Toronto while we were travelling round the area, it was really good value for money, and in a really great location close to the Eaton centre, Dundas square and the subway station. Was also close to a lot of food places, which was great. The room was great, very clean, with very very comfy beds! Also had a big flat screen TV. The room decor was good, but the hotel corridors and lobby could do with a bit of updating. One other problem was that we often had to wait a long time for the lift, and we couldn't seem to find any stairs to walk down that wern't emergency fire exits. Room had a WiFi connection that was pay per day. It was $8.95 per day which is good value, and the internet worked straight away with no fuss, and was faster than some other hotel internet that we've experienced!! But overall a really good value, clean hotel, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trippa-Holic
Reviews.Content: For the price you have to pay, this Hotel is Brilliant! We got a triple room, and I thought it was pretty spacious, as the 3rd Bed was in a Room of its own, so it seemed as though it has 2 Rooms in 1, which was good and it was really clean too! Room was cleaned everyday and the Maids, were very kind! Air Con worked wonders, Bathroom was nice and clean! The Reception Staff were very pleasant and helped with our travel guide everyday! The Location was FAB! Right next to Dundas Square and Eaton Centre, which is great if you're a shopaholic like moi! Travelling was really easy too! Overall, a great place to stay, plus the price is great too! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good base for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: catherine0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at here for 5 nights while sight seeing and relaxing. The rooms are not very big but enough room for 2 people, rooms have flat screen tvs tea and coffee making facilities,kept very clean, bathroom was not over big but more than adequate with hairdryer in. We had breakfast in the hotel a couple of times this was good with good service. it is in ecellent location 2 minutes walk from metro, street cars and Dundas Square. Around the corner is the Senator Restuarant a must for breakfasts it is not cheap but very good food beware the portions are hughe.
