Also try the Superior resruarant faceing the Eaton Centre fantastic food , good wine and the service very friendly and homely while still keeping excellent standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bones45
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Toronto and the Bond Place is a great place to stay for a couple of reasons. 1. Awesome location. On the corner of Yonge and Dundas--two blocks from the PATH (underground walkway) and subway. North of the hotel on Yonge is all shops/restaurants/ etc that you want. South on Yong is the way down to the financial district/CN Tower/HHOF/ACC/Skydome, etc--about a 20 min walk. 2. You dont pay for what you dont need. I came up for a hockey game and didnt need to spend $150-$300 a night for a huge hotel with all types of amentities. All I needed was a clean basic room with a bed and shower. Room service and shower were fine. There was a small restaurant downstairs which was perfect for breakfast. The Imperial Pub right across the street will fill you needs for a bar and snack food. 3. Staff was great. I didnt use the concierge, but he was there. All people behind the counter were very friendly and helpful. Can't ask for better than that. 4. Airport Express Bus dropoff and pickup at the door. $15 each way. about an hour from the airport. If you just need a place to crash out after a long day--then this is the place! Def would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Cost!”
Reviews.Author: kjatkinson
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one-night stay at the Bond Place. We were looking for a relatively inexpensive night away. The hotel is nothing fancy, but we were pleased with our room. It was clean, and we found the bed to be comfy. The shower had lots of hot water and good water pressure. We didn't have any hassles checking in or out, and the staff were pleasant. You really can't beat the location of the hotel - we spent hours walking around the city, with the hotel as our home base. We got a "March" deal and paid $75 for our room, which was well worth it. Underground parking was safe and only $15.00 for 24 hours, which is good when you compare it to other spots downtown.

Reviews.Title: “tired hotel but excellent location for downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: FOODFANS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Feb, the hotel is in an excellent location just off Yonge street and 2 mins walk from Eaton Centre. Reception staff all seemed young and inexperienced. We were put in a room on 6th floor which had laminate flooring which made it very cold so we asked to move, we were moved to a room on 16th floor which was small but comfortable and clean. The hotel could do with some updating, especially corridors and the reception area. The airport express bus picks up and drops off outside the hotel which is handy, be sure to pre-book via internet for a discount. As we visited during off peak season the hotel bar and restaurant only opened for breakfast. The hotel took a swipe of my debit card on arrival and It looks like they have tried to take Â£40 off my card, possibly the lack of experience of reception staff, currently seeking advice off my bank to try to get the money back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad service though. Not too helpful.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, the location of this hotel was great. It really is in the heart of Downtown Toronto. However, I would say that location is one of the only plus' in this hotel. First of all, they try to charge you for almost anything. There is an extra charge to use internet. There is an extra charge to park your car. I understand the parking fee, but still maybe a little discount for its guests for parking? $15.00 a day for parking is a little bit too much. In an age where free WiFi internet is almost everywhere, they have to charge $3.00 an hour for it. It should be free for its guests. I stayed for 4 nights and I am not lying, 3 of the 4 nights, I woke up in the middle of the night because of disturbance. 2 of the 4 nights, I woke up to some worker drilling the wall at the hotel and 1 of the 4 nights, I woke up to a false fire alarm at 4 in the morning. I do not know if this is how it usually is there, but that was my experience. Again, the rooms and stuff itself is not that bad. I liked it. I just hated the fact that they try to charge for almost anything. Parking, internet, movies, etc.. Oh I booked a room and I requested 2 double beds instead of 2 twin beds, they said that I would have to pay $30 EXTRA per night if I wanted a 2 double bed room rather than a 2 twin bed room. To me, that was ridicules. And yes, while I was staying there, I am sure no one was using the 2 double bed room they had, but oh well, who cares about the guests. Once they pay and check it, too bad. Nothing they can do and nothing the hotel staff will do for you ... to accommodate you better.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: TheBusyMumAndDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Bond Place and our stay was hassle free. All the staff were very pleasant and accommodating. The hotel is in an excellent location which means a lot. The rooms were basic but clean and we knew this before arriving. We choose it because at that time (maybe still) we could have a room where smoking was permited. I think these rooms are limited. We would rather have clean and basic at the right price where smoking isnt a problem than crave that cigarette in a more high class place - it is a holiday after all and who want to pay for something they find important and cant have in a holiday? We had breakfast in the hotel and it was lovely with excellent service and friendly staff. It suited our needs for 3 nights perfectly and if they still have a smokers friendly policy we will return to Bond Place in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth saving a few bucks...”
Reviews.Author: Bansheecutie
Reviews.Content: My parents, my husband and I had such terrible experience by staying at this hotel. For starters, we arrived and had requested a non smoking room and we couldn't have got a more smellier room!! I called reception to confirm on the rates I was given as I got a little confused and I was confirmed a rate, then at check out, I was charged with a totally different ammount, I then tried to clear it up with the front desk clerk and she was very insulting! Not to mention the fact that there's no notice suggesting guests to take the room key, elevators only work after 9:00pm by using the room key. my room was on the 13th floor, I was in my first trimester of pregnancy and after 13 floors I almost get a miscarriage! I had an hemorrhage and my whole vacation in Toronto I had to be in bed not to lose my baby.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ali208
Reviews.Content: I got this as part of a package. But if I were to go back to Toronto I would only stay at this simple but excellent hotel. Location - excellent near the Metro (Underground) near the centre near the shops Room - Clean and very large for a city centre hotel Staff - Informative friendly I always ate out so food was not tried, yet don't let that leaving remark put you off, really superb hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good”
Reviews.Author: Jonesy777
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bond Place Hotel in April 2006 for 5 nights. This hotel is very basic but still good. Its in a good location with the Eaton mall just across the road. There was also a subway restaurant across the road. Breakfast was always good. I asked for a room with a high floor and we were 4-5 floors away form the top floor so I was pleased. The room was a good size as was the bathroom. We booked a trip to Niagra falls through the conceirge. That trip to the the falls is well worth doing. The CN tower is quite a distance away although is walkable. We always used to walk everywhere. The underground system is a bit different over there as the whole length is a shopping mall with a food court, so you can walk from the hotel to the CN tower in tunnels underneath the city. Great for when its wet outside. Overall this hotel is a great hotel, in a great location. Well worth considering in going to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: NY11373
Reviews.Content: I received this hotel via Priceline. They said it was a 3 star, but I would rate it 2.5 at the most.. Check in took 20 minutes, with each guest taking a good amount of time to check in. My room was on the small side, but adequate for me. It consisted of 2 twin beds that were very uncomfortable. The room and bathroom were clean, there was a small leak under the sink when the water was on. Since I was there only one night and out of the room most of the time, I did not bother to tell anyone about it. Check out was quick. The best part is the location, right down the street from Eaton Centre. I would say the rate I got was good for New Years Eve, but I would have preferred some of the other hotels, such as the Courtyard Marriott or Best Western, which I had won on previous occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: linzlinzx
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the bond place hotel because of it's location, it's right overlooking dundas square & it was reasonably priced. However after reading some of the reviews we weren't expecting anything fantastic. The rooms were very basic & could do with abit of updating as could the rest of the hotel, but it was extremely clean, we found the bed very uncomfortable, i woke up with a bad back most mornings. The only time we ate in the restaurant was for breakfast as we got it free when we booked the holiday, even though it was just toast & a croissant it was ok, we couldn't fault it. The reception staff were abit misserable whenever we went to them & the downstairs bar was never open, exept on one night when they had a private function on. All in all we had a good stay at the bond place hotel & we would definitely go back but if your looking for something abit more up market i wouldn't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Slayergirl78
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I've stayed at this hotel and both times were good experiences. I loved the fact that the airport bus came directly to the hotel as I didn't have a vehicle of my own. My view was great (right over Dundas Square) and considering it's in the middle of downtown I didn't find outside noises to be disturbing. Yes the rooms are basic but it was clean, the staff was friendly and the beds were comfortable. It's just half a block from the nearest subway station and about a 7 minute walk to the nearest streetcar stop. There are plenty of shops and places to eat right around the hotel. I wouldn't recommend eating at the restaurant unless you're too tired to go out (which is what made me go eat there). The food is just ok and a little overpriced for what you go and the wait staff didn't seem to understand English very well. All in all I enjoyed the convienence of it's location, the fact that it was clean and it was a less expensive option which left me more money to spend in the city! I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Great Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandKirk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a basic hotel in a fantastic location in the heart of Toronto (our room looked onto Dundas Square). The room and bathroom were clean and warm, although basic and quite small. Because of the hotel's location, there is unavoidable noise from the street below, but all-in-all, great value for money. Would not recommend eating breakfast in the hotel restaurant as, the one morning we did, it was terrible! There are, however, plenty of nice cafes and restaurants around the hotel where better breakfasts can be found for a reasonable price. Probably the best bit about the hotel was the Concierge, Donna, who was so helpful on our first morning and spent loads of time with us, mapping out our day and arranging our tickets for the open-top bus tour and a baseball game! She was so friendly and cheery and she even called us later that evening to find out how our day had gone! If only every hotel had a Donna!! Overall, this hotel is fairly basic but is clean and is in a prime location for sightseeing in Toronto. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: Stephengg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location. Our rooms overlooked Yonge-Dundas Square, and many of the tourist attractions were an easy walk or taxi ride away. The rooms were clean and fairly typical of a city hotel this size. The hotel's greatest asset is its Concierge, Donna. She was wonderful, fixing tickets and tours when we needed them, adising on where we should go, walking us to pick-up points, and taking a real personal interest in our experiences. I think that she really wanted us to have a great time, and she made sure that we did. The hotel's location is a close second. The worst aspects of the hotel were its restaurant and bar. The only morning we had breakfast there, it was almost empty and we were still ignored by the staff. When we were eventually served, our waiter spilled coffee all over the table, and gave me paper towels so that I could clear it up. We were also served food that we hadn't ordered. The bar is cavernous, underground, open to the public (some drunk) and totally devoid of any sense of welcome or character. So if you want breakfast, try the nearby and historic Senator, or better still, Fran's (corner of Victoria Street and Shuter Street). All in all, I'd recommend the Bond Place for its location and wonderful Concierge, but I wouldn't eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Bond Place Hotel--close to St. Michael's hospital Toronto”
Reviews.Author: zenitlady
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 days at the Bond Place hotel. A relative was in St. Michael's hospital, which is only about a 7 minute walk away. Got the "hospital rate" which was $119.00 + taxes. Room was a double twin bed, very small, quite clean. Very basic amenities, no note paper, cheap toilet paper and tissue. Restaurant on site, meals rushed, not at all nicely presented, just plopped down. Very noisy at night due to it's location--medivac helicopters, police sirens, but that was to be expected. Staff at front desk seemed very tense, low morale, indifferent. Had I been there as a tourist, I think I would have minded the joyless atmosphere more. Close to everything downtown, Eaton's Centre, Yonge and Dundas, bus terminal, just a few minutes away. Airport bus comes by frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel with an Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: Stunt_Girl
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel for travelers who will be spending most of their time outside seeing the sights. It is in the heart of downtown, near Dundas Square, which is considered the Times Square of Toronto. Whatever you need---shopping, restaurants, internet, cafes, sights, subway station/public transport etc---is within a ridiculous short walking distance of the Bond Hotel. The hotel is very basic, but clean. I've stayed at the Delta Chelsea (which was less well located) and the Bond Hotel was significantly cleaner and less run down. You can get wireless service in your room for $4.95/hr, or use their computers for $8.00/hr. However, you can take a 2 minute walk to Yonge/Dundas and use the internet cafe at $3.00/hr. There is an airport shuttle Toronto Airport Express that has a stop at the Bond Hotel, which makes it more accessible to the budget traveler than other hotels. A return ticket costs around $30 and if you buy your tickets online, you can save 10%. This hotel is also safe for the solo female traveler, as guests are required to swipe their room cards for elevator access after hours (around 8-9 pm). The staff were friendly and helpful. There is a hotel greeter in the lobby ready to assist, as well as a concierge service. They didn't have fancy offices like in other hotels, but at least the service was available. The only complaint that I have is that there is a lot of noise outside the hotel at night (garbage collection, sirens, partyers, etc.) being that it's in the heart of downtown. However, the price, location, and basic cleanliness of the Bond Place Hotel compensates for the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel. Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Cazcake
Reviews.Content: Good budget class hotel in an excellent location- 1 min to Eaton shopping centre and subway. Decor is dated, and the rooms are average size, but it is very clean, has a good size bathroom and supplies towels and toiletries. Rooms warm and beading fine. Reception good, bar fine an breakfast fine.

Reviews.Title: “Only ok”
Reviews.Author: SumoIreland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a decent location everything within walking distance. The hotel is dated and the rooms and bathrooms require updating. It was clean and did the job for us though. If you have to stay here it's fine. If you have a choice, go somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Disliked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights with a nights break in between. When we checked in we were very dissappointed to learn that dispite booking this holiday over a year ago our friends were on different floors to us. We were told that when we checked in only smoking rooms were available, after much discussuion they deceided to upgrade us to a so called superior room!!! The room was in very poor condition, the wall paper was hanging off, the curtains were filthy, there was definate smell of smoke with cigarette burns on the bedding and in the sink. The bathroom floor was wet from the leaking toilet which dispite being reported it was never repaired. The location was ok but noisy. The staff werent very helpful or friendly with the exception of the porter. We would never stay the hotel again and would certainly not recommed it to anyone. Thomas Cook rate this hotel as a 3* but we will be informing them that the web site states 2*.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills -- But that was the Plan!”
Reviews.Author: sonnierd
Reviews.Content: Simple room, simple furnishings, but still VERY clean. For just over 100 per night, this was a perfect alternative to the high priced hotels around the area. If you are coming to the Toronto Film Festival without a giant expense account, I highly recommend this hotel for those who basically use the room as a place to sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel - best location”
Reviews.Author: shellyMD
Reviews.Content: This is THE worse experience I've ever had. To begin, it was supposed to be a non-smoking room however there was a lingering smell of smoke. Next the bed was a spring bed-we woke up very sore-very unpleasant. Not to mention the sheets had a blood-like stain and a old dried up pee or substance on the mattress. We requested 2 extra sheets and the man who gave it to us didn't care to much for the stained sheet...he never asked for it back to investigate. The tub had old grime stains plus the tv show Adult programs - I'm assuming this was not intentional. The only good thing was it's location. Right next to Young and Dundas..the "Times Square" of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “close to the action”
Reviews.Author: markEurope
Reviews.Content: pleasant hotel right at the Dundas square. Close to all the action, transport and the airport shuttle express. Comfortable rooms with good bathrooms. Be aware of the construction site next to the hotel, you might want to ask for a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Small but CUTE!!!”
Reviews.Author: vacati0nsRus
Reviews.Content: I booked the Bond Place Hotel because of it's location, price and reviews. The location is PERFECT! Close to the subway, Eaton Center for shopping, restaurants. I booked through www.gtahotels.com and the price was unbeatable for downtown toronto. The room was small but Cute! When they say twin .. they mean twin beds. Hotel is very clean and staff is very friendly and accommodating. It's the perfect spot for price conscious travellers that don't spend a lot of time in their rooms! The restaurant meals were ok ... they automatically added a 15% gratuity on the bill (I don't go for that). There is a little breakfast restaurant down the street, full breakfast for $5.00 and a Tim Hortons just a little further down (very close). There is a Hard Rock Cafe near the Eaton Center and tourbus operators pick up there. All in all ... would definately book the Bond Place Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: tbe00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bond and chose it mostly for location. That is teh only thing that the hotel is good for. The room I had was small, outdated and in need of repairs. The things that needed fixing were small but noticable. When I checked in it took two staff to do it. They alternated between me and answering the phone and dealing with other guests. I looked at the book in the room that explains the services and at 10:20pm tried to order room service. In the book it said that room service was availible until 11pm, when I called the person told me that they closed early. After fighting with them I got them to bring up a couple of beers. When he shows up one bottle wasn't a twist off and he didn't bring a bottle opener. At 8am I had house keeping knocking at my door. I had forgotten to put out the don't disurb sign. I was checking out that morning so it stands to reason that they will have to clean the room after I left so why not wait for me to check out before knocking on my door. At the front desk I got my bill, paid and then brought up my concerns. I did it this way so that they didn't think I was just saying stuff to get a discount. Their response was that room service changed their time but they hadn't updated the books yet and that I should have put out the do not disturb sign. All this being said I will not be atsying at this run down POS hotel ever again. Find yourselves a better place folks. The location was good though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: princessvixen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July with a large tour group.The best thing I can say about this hotel is the location.It is close to everything and walking distance to almost everything.BUT the rooms were tiny.Try fitting 2 grown women and 2 large suitcases into this room-GOOD LUCK!It is so tiny and never in all of my travels have I seen a hotel room this small.It had 2 SINGLE yes single beds and not enough room to swing a cat(I wouldnâ€™t wish that upon a cat anyway).The bathroom barely had enough room to get inside!Would never ever stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....only.”
Reviews.Author: xmcnickyx
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a week in Toronto staying at the Bond Place. It wasn't the worst hotel in the world but it wasn't incredibly comfortable either. We were on the 8th floor in a double room. The room itself was clean and a decent size. The weather was hot and humid while we were there and the 'Air Conditioning' was rubbish. It just blew slighly cold air out and didn't make the room any more comfortable. Opening the window was a bit pointless as there was no breeze outside so we just sweated a lot! The location of the hotel is excellent. Right by Dundas Square with a street car that stops outside, which runs up and down Dundas. We found this the best way to get around although if you prefer the underground, the station is only a stones throw away. The Eaton Centre is right over the road as well as a shed loads of other shops and a new cinema. We got the feeling that Dundas Square, which is right next to the hotel, is trying to be Toronto's answer to Times Square. While we were there there was a Regae festival and a Turkish festival going on in the square so it was really busy around the area but we didn't notice much noise at night. In fact there was more noise coming from the pub opposite although it never kept us awake or anything. The staff were mostly really nice. They had their dim moments but when we needed help they were really helpful. Didn't eat at the restaurant because, well, it looked rubbish and with the amount of other restaurants around (Spring Rolls on Dundas was well nice) there is so much choice. I don't think I'd stay here again, especially not in summer! We didn't spend loads of time in our room anyway but it is nice to have somewhere to chill out after a hard days sightseeing and I just always wanted to get out of the room as soon as I could! I think it'd be alright for a couple of nights at the most. If it weren't for the central location of it, I'd have been dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: Chris&Carole
Reviews.Content: The Bond Place Hotel is very well located in the heart of the Eaton Centre district of downtown Toronto - easy access to shops, theatres, bus station etc. I'd classify it as a budget hotel and although it would benefit from a total makeover it was clean and fairly comfortable for the 3 nights we stayed. Staff were very friendly and very helpful re excursions, directions etc. Airport coach pick-up outside front door. We had the hotel selected for us as part of a Canadian Affair package but we were satisfied with it in the short term. Any small shortcomings are outweighed by the central location.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: lincguy
Reviews.Content: I was a lone traveller and found the hotel to be in a great postion in the city centre. I caught an airport coach right to the front door, the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was a good size and clean and warm, which was good as it was very cold outside. The food was good but i felt the menu was abit limited with choice. I walked everywhere as it was located in the centre, close to the shops and theatre. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Attitude”
Reviews.Author: TravelBird76
Reviews.Content: Although I have been staying at the Bond Place Hotel several times before, last weekend will be the last one thanks to an incredible amount of attitude coming from the desk person, his name is Ivan, apparently he doesn't know how to do his job to the point that I am still having issues with an unmatched amount of hold on my credit card; even-though the 2 nights I stayed have been already charged fully. The hold doesn't allow me to use my own money until the hotel drops it -and AGAIN the hotel has already been paid in full amount. Thanks for ruining a wonderful weekend in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: salswife
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us into this hotel as an overnight stay on our way to Niagara. We didn't arrive till 1a.m. as we spent 2 hours in the airport trying to find out which shuttle bus we should catch. The room was like a cheap motel room but we were tired and thirsty so had a cup of coffee and went to bed. The air conditioner rattled all night long and at 4a.m. we were greeted to a wake up call in the form of sea gulls outside our window screeching and swooping into a big green dumpster which was parked in the alleyway in front of our window. After having put up with this for 2 hours we decided to have a cup of coffee and a shower. It was not to be - there had only been enough coffee for one cup and we had that when we arrived. Ok lets have a shower then, which one of us was going to have a shower, as there was only 1 towel for 2 people. I tried to ring housekeeping and got no answer so my husband went to the front desk to ask for another towel and was told that housekeeping comes on at 8.30a.m. After he explained (in no uncertain terms) that we were actually having a shower now and not at 8.30 we were eventually given another towel. I cannot comment on the breakfast as after this fiasco we decided to eat elsewhere. When we checked out we were asked if everything was ok and upon telling them no it wasn't we were told - oh, sorry. I have told my travel agent not to book anyone else into this place unless he informs them that it is a cheap motel which pretends to be a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: OzGirl_1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bond Place Hotel for 3 nights with my husband in June 2008. We had a room on the 10th floor, with 2 single beds and a large bathroom with a tub. No fridge in the room but ice machines available at the hotel. Coffee facilities in the room. There is a restaurant on the ground floor where we dined on the evening we arrived as we were tired. Restaurant had no ambience, very sterile and dull. Food was okay but restaurant could do with a little bit of piped music so you couldn't hear the next tables conversation. Hotel is in a central location, very close to the Eaton Centre for shopping. We ate at Pickle Barrell on two nights - the best variety of food to chose from at a great price. Would stay at Bond Place again.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: nathanmuir
Reviews.Content: I have read many of the other reviews of the Bond Place (and in fact used the reviews to book my hotel on Expedia) and agree that this is a pleasant, centrally-located budget hotel. The rooms are small and the beds and bathroom are equivalent to a Best Western but the staff was pleasant and I have no real complaints. It's location is ideal and for budget hotels, it's near the top of my list. Just don't expect any "boutique" charms.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION!!”
Reviews.Author: elainak
Reviews.Content: We had a quick trip into Toronto and needed a hotel that was close to the financial district and close to trains and things to do. Bond Place was perfect for all those things. It was right beside Dundas and the Eaton Centre, half a block to the subway and 5 min to the financial district. We had taken a red eye flight in and the hotel was more than accomodating and allowed us to check in at 8 am to get some sleep before meetings. The rooms were not huge (but really, why would you spend much time in your room?) nor were they tiny. Since it is right in the bustling area that it is, if you want a quiet place, this may not be it. There was a three day concert at the square on Dundas. We don't mind the noise so it wasnt a big deal. If you require internet access, they have wireless access for $9.95 per 24 hours. It worked fine in the afternoon and in the evening, we couldn't log on. Plenty to do around the hotel and lots to see. Take advantage of the information booth beside the entrance to the subway, those guys had tons of ideas on where to go and what to do. There is a tiny Thai restaurant around the corner called Salad King. Very good, very cheap and quick. We only found out about it because of the info guys. The hotel could use a remodel. It is becoming dated. However, with such a vibrant area around you, it really isnt a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel...nice locatation!!!”
Reviews.Author: buck3
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in totonto and niagra I travelled with my girlfriend and another couple. we booked the holiday as a late package deal through Thomas Cook in Dublin. We were wary of the hotel prior to travel but upon arrival was plesantly surprised with the hotel and its staff. The hotel is 'no frills' but very clean and ideal for a short stay in Toronto. The staff were excellent and only too delighted to be of assistance. The hotel is right in the centre of things and would have no hesitations staying there again. Hope this report is helpful. Noel

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: rzldzl
Reviews.Content: booked teh hotel based on reviews on tripadvisor.com....just wanted clean, quiet room close to everything...perfect on all requirements...only used cab to and from airport, the 6 days spent there, was able to walk to everything...didnt like the restaurant, but there are 11ty others close by...$110 for 5 of the nights, one night was $160...great deal for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful - no problems to report”
Reviews.Author: jimbojetset
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a great deal on this hotel (3 nights for the price of 2), and to be honest had this one pegged as our budget choice and therefore the one that we we expecting to be the least nicest. I must say that we were pleasantly surprised with the overall standard of the hotel and the service given. Check in itself was efficient and friendly. The room was adequate in size and clean enough with an average sized bathroom. Outside of the room some of the public areas were a little tatty and run down. The corridors and the areas around the ice machines could have done with a good scrub, but to be honest who sleeps in the corridor? The hotel could not have been in a better location. The centre of Toronto was literally a 2 minute walk. The Eaton Centre, the PATH and all transportation was only a stones throw away. If on a budget again i would not hesitate to stay in this hotel in future. I must say that we found Toronto to be rather dull and lacking in must- see sights. The nightlife was the least exciting i have encountered in any major city. Gimme Montreal any day of the week.

Reviews.Title: “Well-priced basic hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: MoominTraveller
Reviews.Content: I had to spend the night in Toronto while waiting for a connecting train, but I didn't want to spend much since I wouldn't be there for very long. The Bond was a good choice, as I got a room for under $100, and the hotel was centrally located/ close to the train station. I have nothing but praise for the front desk staff--they were friendly and very helpful. They switched my room immediately when it turned out the first one I had been put in reeked of cigarette smoke. They directed me to an all-night diner (I arrived quite late in the evening) and even lent me some scotch tape so I could wrap some presents! The room was perfectly adequate; the decor could be more modern, but I personally prefer to pay less money and live with older furnishings. :-) All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a clean, well-priced place to stay in a safe, central Toronto area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice location”
Reviews.Author: MartaZanchi
Reviews.Content: The Bond Place Hotel is located in downtown Toronto, wonderfull location, on a streetcar line and a block from the Yonge Street subway. Decent sized rooms and helpful staff. Great place, very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Bond Hotel a wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: amysk85
Reviews.Content: I went to Toronto at the end of January 2008 and stayed at the Bond Hotel. What a wonderful hotel! The staff was polite and very helpful. The room was very clean. Aside from the room being a little small (which I knew thanks to other reviews on TripAdvisor), it was perfect. The rates were excellent for the location also. Within walking distance is Eaton Center, the Hard Rock Cafe, and several other little eateries and shops. Parking is across the street in a garage, but it was so much easier to jump on the metro which has a station right in Eaton Center. We never took the car out of the garage until the day we left. I would highly recommed the Bond Hotel. I would like to go back to Toronto and would look to stay at no other hotel. What a way to make an expression for a first time visitor!

Reviews.Title: “Bond Place Hotel = go0d deal”
Reviews.Author: PollyPlague
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night from Dec.8 to the 9th. We were in a smoking room on the 17th floor. Clean beds and clean bathrooms. The only problem was a couple fighting in the next room, but the hotel can hardly be faulted for that. The view out the window was awesome, Toronto is such a beautiful city. We were a bit leery about the place at first because it was relatively inexpensive and right downtown, but it turned out to be a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: sundinkc
Reviews.Content: The Bond Place Hotel is fabulously located in downtown Toronto, on a streetcar line and a block from the Yonge Street subway. Decent sized rooms and helpful front desk staff were a plus. Although housekeeping "forgot" to visit our room one day and there is a charge for wireless internet access (steal it from the pub across the street instead), the location more than made up for these drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable, Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Drusilla43
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is terrific. Only steps from a subway transfer spot and all the shopping you could want. The room I stayed in was on the small side, so if you are planning to stay in your room, maybe this is not the hotel for you. The property needed some improvements, but it wasn't too bad. Pretty clean, but it would have been nice to have an extra blanket as opposed to pillows. The heating had a blower function that you had to manually switch on and off, otherwise it was too hot/too cold. They didn't offer a free breakfast, but if you do your homework like I did, you can find plenty of places around close, like the The Pickle Barrel in Atrium on Bay or The Senator on Victoria. If you need a place to sleep only, this may be your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “great service for the price”
Reviews.Author: stillatit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for the price not only for the facilities but the staff are great and offer 110% service. I checked out the hotel on the internet before leaving home so was aware of what to expect. Stayed 4 nights as part of a world tour and have no negative memories of this hotel compared to some of the others we stayed in. Great location. Good food in snack bar. Here you get MORE than what you pay for in service alone.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious...for a broom closet”
Reviews.Author: SonofPezcore2
Reviews.Content: Had been planning a trip to Toronto for the WinterCity festival for the end of January. When searching for hotels we found the location of the Bond Place to meet our needs being right in the heart of Dundas Square. This provided easy access to the Canon Theatre, Eaton Centre, and the Air Canada Centre. Upon arrival, the location was excellent. However, that was the only thing this hotel had going for it. We arrived at our room to find two single beds(if they were even that big - my feet were hanging off the end by a good 4-5" and I am only 5'10") in the smallest room we have ever stayed in. We had a lovely view of a construction site which was outside our room. However, I think the construction workers enjoyed the view more as we constantly felt their stares forcing us to close the blinds. We decided we would make the best of things and we could deal with the cramp space if we spent as little time in the room as possible. We set out on the town...returning around 10:30 pm. Tired after a long day of walking, we decided to relax and watch television. Well, the remote didn't work and after about five minutes of watching television the picture froze with John Stossel from 20/20 repeating the same sentence over (Doesnt it make you angry when..doesnt it make you angry when...) and over again for 5 minutes with his face alternating between pink and green. At this point, I climbed out of bed, turned off the television, and began counting the hours until we were awake and checking out. Location is great, but not when you sacrifice quality and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: momof4boys_8
Reviews.Content: Small rooms -- but clean & helpful staff. parking (underground) for $15/night. it was great for the price. Great location. We lost keys & staff couldn't have been nicer. when we checked out at 9am, another traveler was trying to check in the hotel. they told him to wait 10 minutes & they could give him a room!! I would go back here again. no questions.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Montalivet2
Reviews.Content: The Bond Place Hotel is well situated just off Yonge. Theatres and shopping malls are just around the corner, as is the Bond square and Hard Rock Cafe. We found it an easy walk to CN Tower, The Rogers Stadium and The Queens Quay, whilst in the other direction, Chinatown etc.are also on the doorstep. The Hotel is a little tired and dated but the staff and service are 1st class and it is clean. Besides, the room rates are so cheap compared to some of the larger hotels down by the waterfront, (that donâ€™t have â€™genuinelyâ€™ friendly and helpful staff), that itâ€™s a comparative bargain. Restaurant was also good value and staff very friendly. This hotel is on the list of â€™pick-upâ€™ points for tours by Grayline for Niagara etc. So no worries, we were just picked up at the front doors. We stayed 3 nights and had no problems. This is good short stay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Students”
Reviews.Author: myvoicecarries
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic find if you are just coming to Toronto with your friends for the nightlife and/or shopping. The rooms are exactly what you'd expect to get for such a low price. Pretty unappealing visually and not too much space, but if you are only using the room for a place to sleep you won't care. The staff are very friendly, the location is great (we had a great view of the hardrock cafe intersection) we didn't notice any noise, and had a great snooze. Parking was simple, close, and cheap. This hotel made the trip so easy. Would definitely stay there again and recommend it to any of my friends looking to party in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Don't overlook this one!”
Reviews.Author: Dave_1984
Reviews.Content: Booked my stay in this hotel through Cityandshow.com where they had a very good deal. I chose this hotel on location and price and was not left disappointed!! The Airport Express bus took me straight outside the door, and upon entering the hotel's reception, I was greeted with a smile and a welcoming look. The staff always made you feel welcome and felt as if you did have a problem, then it would be sorted! The room was basic, but very, very clean. You are literally a minutes walk from the closest subway station (Dundas) and the famous Eaton Centre. The hotel's restaurant was clean and the food was very nice and affordable. I don't think I could praise this anymore, as a hotel can make or break a trip/holiday, and I had an amazing experience, so I would recommend this every time.

Reviews.Title: “city break couldnt have been better”
Reviews.Author: lauraloo18
Reviews.Content: During a visit to a friend in toronto, we decided to catch the musical we will rock you in toronto. as we stayed approx 1 hr away from toronto city centre we booked this little hotel for a 2 night stay. we took the offer of underground secure parking and full breakfast for a great price. the bathroom was v clean as was the bedroom. the bedroom was a little small but perfect for a city break where we only required a place to stay. would definitely recommend this little place to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: dillonpanthers
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Bond Hotel was great! We were there for five nights and it started to feel like a second home somehow. The hotel was very conveniently located for everything we wanted to do while in Toronto including shopping at the Eaton Mall and eating great meals and seeing shows. On check in the receptionist gave us a room "with the best view" and we were up on the top floor of the hotel which looks over the Dundas Square. Our favorite thing about our stay was the staff they were the best!! Christine at the reception and the bellhop Jing are the friendliest people we've ever met on vacation and both of them helped us arrange things we had to do around the city. There isn't a conceirge at all times but the lobby staff can book almost anything for you at any time of day which is a treat. Overall the Bond was clean and comfortable and to top it off affordable! We got a lot more then expected for what we paid and we will be back next time we are in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: RockDoctor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bond Place Hotel for four nights in mid-November and were pleased to find that the reviews on this site were largely accurate. We only paid AU$80 per night (via asiarooms.com) and, for the price, this place is a bargain. The location is spot on if downtown attractions are your reason for being in Toronto and there always seemed to be plenty of people milling around the area due to the proximity to Yonge Street and the Eaton Centre. While it's true that the decor and rooms are a bit tired, the place is clean and tidy and the staff friendly (all concierges we dealt with were very helpful) so it's a good spot to lay your head for low cost while enjoying what Toronto has to offer. No complaints here (and the airport bus service stops at the door, well handy!).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Cheap!!”
Reviews.Author: Bill912
Reviews.Content: I'd rate the Bold Place as a 2/3 star hotel but it's very good value for money (Â£42 per night) and right in the centre of town. Excellent location for seeing the sites and shopping. Good links to subway and streetcar systems within a 2 minute walk. The hotel bar is a bit naff but there are plenty of good pubs in Toronto (I recommend C'est What by the St Lawrence Market for proper beer). Didn't use the hotel restaurant so I can't comment on that. Overall the hotel is cheap & cheerful and clean & central, what more do you want? I'd stay there again if I visit Toronto in the future.

Reviews.Title: “1 Star Quality at 4 Star Prices!”
Reviews.Author: travelguy1972Chicago
Reviews.Content: This is a no-frills place with small rooms, small, uncomfortable beds, and cheap pillows, towels and room amenities. Basically its like a lower quality motel chain, but without the low prices. I was traveling with my wife and infant son, and they tried to insist they could only give us a room with two single beds! I haven't stayed at a place with single beds since summer camp days as a child. Then they told us for $30 more we could have a room with one (small) double (not queen, king, etc) bed and a sofa. We had booked on priceline, so we couldn't just leave, otherwise, we would have. If all you care about is location- and you need to be right downtown- you might not mind this place, if you don't care about comfort too much and don't mind paying a lot for parking. I certainly don't recommend it- not for $100 plus per night.

Reviews.Title: “excellant location”
Reviews.Author: traveller2371
Reviews.Content: we stopped for 6 nights in this hotel and found it very clean and tidy .rooms were cleaned and tidied every day .decor was a bit out of date but was more than compensated by the service .food was ok but theres was a little cafe just over the road which served a good breakfast at half the price .the bond is in an ideal location for shopping ,eating and site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lady_456
Reviews.Content: Right near Eaton Centre, subway, and live theater. Literally steps from shopping areas where masses of people walked to and fro well into the evening. Never felt unsafe. Small rooms - smaller than rooms American are used to. But rooms were clean. Staff was attentive and helpful. Airport express stops right outside the door. Good Value.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: travelerBristol
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel well positioned in centre of city

Reviews.Title: “great location in downtown toronto”
Reviews.Author: smellymel74
Reviews.Content: this is a great value hotel in the heart of downtown toronto. the staff were extremely polite and helpful, the rooms were of a decent standard with air con, satellite tv and a nice big bath and good shower and free paper. the best thing about this place, though, is the location - right in the heart of downtown toronto just opposite the Eaton Centre. It's a great value place for such a fab location. it's just a few stops from the main bus/train station (walkable if you've a map) and there's a subway 2 minutes walk away. the flyglobespan bus stopped right outside the hotel's door too. it's not super luxorious but it's got everything you need (hairdryer, tv, bath, coffee stuff) and it's in a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Not flash just convenient”
Reviews.Author: markthefish
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a few times and I know the initial impression is not good due to the exterior brown tower and then there isnt really a lobby to speak about. You enter, the elevators are in front of you, there is an open plan restaurant on the left which is open for breakfast lunch and dinner. There are some very small rooms in this hotel. I would say just use it as a base. It's so close to everything, there's always something going on in Dundas Square then cross the road and there is the Eaton Centre, a huge shopping mall open til 9pm and they have 2 food courts in there. The Hard Rock Cafe is also on block from the hotel. The Canon Theatre is currently showing We Will Rock You and that's around the corner from the hotel. The hotel is also on the streetcar line which goes to Chinatown and the Subway station is 2 mins walk in Dundas Square. The reception staff are very helpful and the porters are all hard working. All in all a good value place to stay but don't go looking for chandeliers!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge the nicest women in the world”
Reviews.Author: crawfol1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for four nights as past of a six night holiday in canada like others stayed here then the skyline in Niagra! Hotel is an older style hotel and if you are looking for style dont stay here! But as a base for holiday its great right round the corner from the eton centre (huge shopping mall) and city bus tour for $30 (Â£15) you get a week pass can jump on and off and goes to all the sites. Back to the hotel Rooms are compact but really clean and well designed for two girls getting ready for a night out the two dressing tables and mirrors are great. Shower did not look anything special was hot and powerful exactly what you want. Bar was great (again nothing special looking) and barmaid was a great laugh and if you go in and have drinks between 5pm-7pm you get free nibbles (chicken wings, eggrolls and onion rings and stuff). Got a good cocktail list as well and drinks reasonably priced. Restaraunt was a let down would give it a miss only had breakfast there and was not impressed so many other places to go that are better (Cora's is a must!!!) And Finally the thing that made this hotel stand out and why i would def go back again. The concierge a women who's name i have forgot sorry! But she is the kindess friendliest women alive. Not only did she give the best advice and discount coupons for everything we wanted to do but she took a geninue interest in us and if we enjoyed our activites! She made our trip! So if you are just looking for somewhere as a base that clean and where the staff are great i advise you to go here!!

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchair users - forget it !”
Reviews.Author: Tesremos
Reviews.Content: Interesting that the last review posted was 26 August 2005. Location is good and at $119 CAN cheap for the area. Lots of short stayers on tour and probably one or two nights is more than enough with small rooms and asthmatic AC. However, if you are a wheelchair user - forget it! This property does not have the faintest idea how to provide the essential facilities and with the exception of one or two very good porters the impression is that they do not want disabled guests. St. Michael's Cathedral is 100m away - pray for guidance to a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leen2112
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for its location and the fact it was cheap. Its location downtown Toronto is fantastic, and is next to Dundas square and to shopping, bars, and the metro. We had heard that the lifts were quite noisy but our room was right across from them and didnâ€™t hear a thing, infact the whole place was quiet except for the usual bustle of the check in desk. We didn't use the restraint so can't comment on that but found the bar staff friendly and not too pricey. The beds werenâ€™t the biggest but the rooms were clean and tidy. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money-great location”
Reviews.Author: aberdeenlass1903
Reviews.Content: mmm not sure what to write about this hotel. My boyfriend and I were visiting relatives and decided to stay 2 nights in Toronto before catching our flight home. We got in to the main bus station in toronto city centre and didnt have a clue where we were going to stay- there was a tourist kiosk at the station and an old guy there was SOOOO helpful. He asked us our budget and what kind of place we wanted to stay and had loads of hotels and prices on the wall in front of him. He found us the Bond place hotel which was just round the corner and from what i can remember it was around Â£50/60 a night which was music to our ears! When we got to the hotel is was really busy and when we got to our room it was a none smoking room but it did have the stale smell of smoke so perhaps it used to be one. Bathroom was nice and tidy and bed comfortable. Aircon was in good working order which was needed! The woman sitting at reception trying to sell tours etc was really nice and helpful too and although we had thought she would be selling over priced stuff to us we later compaired and we actually got all the best deals. We booked our Niagra falls tour through her and it was excellent. The hotel bar was a bit of a bummer to say the least- the bar owner/barmaid reminded me on the female version of Mo off the Simpsons and the place was dead. We just went to bar accross the road. There were a couple of cafes that sold cheap quality cooked breakfasts along with the usual maple syrup sweet things nearby. I forget the name but u come out of the hotel and u can see them before the petrol station. Overall I wasnt expecting bling bling but i got value for money in a clean friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonJones
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here at the start of 14 day trip. Room was fairly nice, clean, and comfortable although there was a lot of noise from road traffic and trolley buses. Staff were friendly and approachable. The hotel is only about a 2 minute walk to the Eaton Centre and Hard Rock Cafe, although its around a 25 minute walk to the CN Tower, Blue Jays Stadium and Harbour Front etc. We chose this hotel as we flew from the UK with Flyglobespan into Hamilton airport and they offer a transfer to this hotel in downtown Toronto with Niagra Airbus for Â£5 per person each way. Also it is within walking distance to Alamo car hire on Yonge Street. Overall we were very happy with the price paid for this hotel and would recommend it for a short stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: nisaq
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 4 night stay at the Bond Place hotel and can say that we wil definately return. The Airport Express bus drops you right outside the hotel which is very convenient. Albeit the room was a touch on the small side, we didnt find it to be a problem (we had a triple room). The room was also very clean.The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is a big plus. The Hard Rock Cafe, Eaton Centre & Dundas Square are a stone's throw away. Quite a few of the major attractions (CN Tower, Harbourfront, Chinatown) are walking distance. We didnt have breakfast included in the price, but there are some great cafes/ restuarants very close by. For what we paid and the convenience, I would definately stay there on my next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “O.K central hotel”
Reviews.Author: ash108
Reviews.Content: Centrally located hotel within easy reach of all shops and subway. Eaton shopping centre is just across the square. Decor is getting very tired and it is need of modernisation. Rooms are a little on the small side but clean. Staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good and service was prompt and friendly. If you not looking for 5 star and just need a central location then its fine

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: StapletonSteve
Reviews.Content: It was OK, good loaction as it is near main shopping areas and near restaurants bars etc.. Poor location as these streets can be a bit seedy at night and the area immediately around the hotel isn't very inspiring and doesn't feel very inviting late at night. Very small bedroom compared to many other hotes I stayed at in Canada. Bathroom a litte tired. Breakfast very good and hotel staff very good. Room was quiet which is always a plus. Notthing bad about the place really and no complaints and OK for a quick overnighter but I would look for somewhere else if returning to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Return!”
Reviews.Author: Purrz14
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the location of this hotel. A 5 minute walk to Eaton Center, Hard Rock Cafe, St. Michael's Cathedral. The room was little, with 2 twin beds, but the mattresses were very good. Ate at the restaurant 3 times. Wish they had a daily special to try! The food was adequate. The workers were very helpful, especailly Jing, the concierge. Made us feel like very welcome guests.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: UkShell
Reviews.Content: The Staff at this hotel made the stay a joy, and the help and assistance they provided were exceptional. We arrived about 2.45pm and went to check in, this is not the first time we have stayed so we had a good idea of the procedure, the receptionist looked a little concerned and said that the 5 year old twin had not been booked by Globespan,(no-one has had a good thing to say about Globespan in our who visit) I had the booking confirmation from my travel agent who had advised Globespan of their existance , they advised that the room booked was small and did we want to see it, whilst I did this the receptionist checked things out and confirmed the twins were not booked in, but as a courtesey and to make our visit more pleasant they upgraded us to a family room, this had a double bed for the twins and 2 single beds for me and my disabled mother, we were so releaved! The room was very clean had a coffee machine and plenty of storage space, Maid service was excellent, 5 year olds x 2 make so much mess! The Garden Cafe offer excellent value and service and you are only 1 block away from the Eaton Centre and Dundas Square. The Hotel is secure and friendly and well worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: N24ickie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel this was the 4th hotel i stopped at within 2 weeks but by far the best. Located by the Eaton Center (huge shopping place) Easy walk on a nice day to CN Tower. Services good and food nice. Donna at the day trip booking desk was fantastic really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beware non-smokers”
Reviews.Author: travelle07
Reviews.Content: I booked and confirmed a non smoking room. On arrival there was none available and I was told by the staff the booked room may not be available. It was the most stinking room I had ever stayed in. I got no compensation for this. Beware non-smokers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ottawachick7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online and went on this website afterwards and was shocked by the horrible reviews. My friends and I decided to try it out anyway and we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is right downtown, the lobby was beautiful and had very curteous staff, the room was clean although the decor is slightly outdated. The pictures on their website are accurate. This hotel is great for someone who wants to stay in the hub of TO and doesn't want to spend a fortune on a hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: shellyship
Reviews.Content: Booked a twin bedroom through Expedia - Â£320 for 6 nights for 2 of us - bargain for what we got. Room was clean, great location, no noise, fast lifts, friendly staff, hot shower/bath- would go back, no question! First night requested to change from a smoking to a non smoking room - this was sorted in 2 minutes flat!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but...”
Reviews.Author: dizzyt
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a group of friends so we had 5 rooms. My room was terrible. It was tiny . Two single beds barely fit into the room. The smell of smoke was disgusting(had booked non-smoking) but the windows didn't open. Tv was fuzzy, bathroom door didn't close, the paint was peeing from doors, kettle didn't work, sheets were dirty. Corridors were dark, dirty and the smell of cigarettes was unbearable. Only plus is the location. Across fron eaton centre. Easy walk to chinatown, yorkville etc. However, one member of group did get a larger room with a sofa which was clean. But if you are in a room like most of us were it is not worth it. Even for the location. There are better hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: betsywanderlust
Reviews.Content: After reading a few previous reviews I was unsure wether to book this hotel, I did mostly because of the location, and I was pleasantly surprised by it. It was fine really. The room was clean and comfortable and had a bathroom. The bed was comfy I seem to remember, and the TV had cable, so lots of channels. If you want a clean and comfortable hotel in a handy location go for this hotel. We were mostly sightseeing so we never spent much time there and it was nice and cosy to get back to. As long as you dont want or expect the finest luxury and a fashionable / cutting edge hotel you will be fine. There was a few fast food places very near to the hotel which was handy when we arrived late and were tired. Its ideal for sightseeing. The eaton (shopping) centre is very close and you can get the subway (underground) from next to shopping centre too. All in all would I stay there again? Yes definately.

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what some of these guys are talking about.”
Reviews.Author: dannyshaw7
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to be staying at the hotel for a total of 7 nights, through no fault of the hotel it ended up being only 2 nights. I checked in, staff were friendly and helpful, and changed my room, due to me having changed my plans. I got to my room, which was nice and clean, nice and big, and nice view of the city from my window. The Bathroom was nice and clean, nice hot bath and lots of nice complementary goods, free newspaper etc. There is a nice internet cafe opposite, $5 for 2 hours. Also if you come out of the hotel and go to a cafe just past the car park, cheap food and really nice stuff, go there! Also hotel is in a great location, so well worth a stay, only $82 a night. Also they did refund some of my money due to me having to change my booking. I was sceptical reading those views from before, but seriously they are all out of context, it is a nice hotel, in a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Bond hotel”
Reviews.Author: boojazz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just visited Toronto for 5 days before Thanksgiving. What a great city! After hearing many great reviews through this website, we reserved the standard room at the Bond for a few nights. We were a bit skeptical, since The Bond is an older budget hotel, but thought we'd give it a shot. We ended up showing up a day early, since we were free to do so. They accepted us early with no problem. They even upgraded us to a large room with an excellent view of the city, when we told them it was our anniversary. The stay was perfect. Comfortable and quiet. We had the best sleep here, compared to any other hotel we've stayed in. It's a great location, though a bit of a walk from a lot of the nightlife. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Totally happy with the hotel and the price.”
Reviews.Author: ChillyLilly
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Toronto and had to pick a hotel from the reviews. After many hours of researching I picked the Bond Place Hotel. We got a "Toonie" deal. The first night was two dollars and the second night was regular price. It worked out to about $85. a night, which is an excellent price for downtown Toronto. It was a Mom and Daughter weekend...so we asked for a non smoking room with two single beds and also requested a room with a view. We got everything we asked for. The room was on the 16th floor and overlooked Dundas Square and the giant tv screens in the square. It was only a 5 minute walk from the subway, the Cannon Theatre and Eatons Centre. We thought the location was fantastic. The rooms are small but spotlessly clean with nice new bedding. Very comfy. We never ate in the restuarant but it looked plain, clean and nice. There is a small bar in the basement that was also nice and it serves free snacks for an hour in the evening. The staff were pleasant and welcoming. We asked for late checkout and it was instantly provided. They will also store your luggage for you if you are leaving late. There is an airport bus that stops right outside the hotel...you can buy your tickets in the hotel or on the bus. (Leave early because the bus stops at a lot of other downtown hotels) There is also a scruffy little restaurant directly across the street...it only has three tables..that sit two people to each table. Go there for breakfast. Its cheap and very good. Just like Mom's home cooking. There is also a pub across the street. Not the nicest looking...but a good place to sit down and have a drink after a long day shopping. The "Red Lobster" restaurant and and the "Hard Rock Cafe" is also just down the street...going towards Eatons centre. I had a sore knee....but managed to walk to City Hall, The University, China Town, Kensington Village and the C.N. Tower. Its quite a walk....so wear comfy shoes. All I can say is that I would definatley recommend the Bond Place Hotel, its great for a weekend get a way or a shopping trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: LovinNS
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business for 3 weeks. Location was amazing, I don't think it could have been better. The rooms were small, dated and even smelled a little musty. Overall they were well cleaned and the beds were comfy. If you are just looking for a place to lay your head its great, anything more and I wouldn't suggest it.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: CanadianaSunshine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the beginning of November for my boyfriends birthday. we were going to a concert andso the location was amazing. the hotel is ok too...the rooms are clean, we never had to ask the front desk foranything...the elevator is a moving elevator...it has two doors and the blankets are up to protect the wall from scratching. That was it. we mainly used it just as a place to sleep since it was so close to the downtown theatres

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: poonet
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stay at the hotel last weekend. Its location is just amazing, its almost in front of the eaton center and right next to the canon theatre. The service was great one of the bell boy even booked us a great italien restaurent call donatelo. The room at the hotel are clean, the bed is a little hard but for the price this hotel has the best location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: italia123
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in the best possible location. We went to toronto to shop could have not have stayed in a better place. Hotel is located right across the street from Eaton Centre. Walking distance to the subway station. It cost about $45 from the airport to the hotel. Rooms are small, but location makes up for everything. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful !

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value for money!”
Reviews.Author: pineman
Reviews.Content: I agree with some of the other reviews that the rooms are a bit on the small side but who wants to spend a lot of time in a hotel room when you have downtown Toronto literally on your doorstep. The location is unbelievable, right in the centre of everything that is happening but once you are in your room, with the air conditioning on, you can't hear a thing and are perfectly comfortable. From our window we could see out onto Dundas Square and while we were there they had a couple of concerts. We couldn't see the stage directly but it was transmitted to a large screen outside the Eaton Centre and we could see it all! The hotel reception was very efficient, as was the concierge who was most helpful without trying to sell you a trip or something. We had the continental breakfast which was included in our price and certainly kept us going until we had coffee and a cake later in the morning! The room was cleaned very well, and towels replaced,daily. The Hotel is a pick up point for most of the tour buses as well as the Airport Express. We spent eight days in Toronto using the hotel and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: ilari
Reviews.Content: I visit in Toronto from Finland about once in a year, and every time I book myself to this hotel - in a way it's my home in Toronto. Location, price and staff are great, and I don't mind staying in a small room as long there is a good bed, clean toilet, shower, television and friendly atmosphere. What else does one need? I can't even imagine looking for other hotels in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 days during June 2006. I found this hotel to be excellent value for a traveller on a budget. The location is perfect (minutes to Dundas Station and streetcars), the rooms were clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to visitors to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Location but.........”
Reviews.Author: kelad
Reviews.Content: I first must say the location of this Hotel is fantastic, being only 1 minutes walk from the Eaton centre. Although as the saying goes "you get what you pay for" Upon arrival we were given a double room, we had requested a queensize but were told that the hotel was fully booked during our stay. We found our room was very small, the fittings and furniture were very old and the bed for tall people was small and quite uncomfortable. After our first night, my partner spoke to the manager to explain that he was in need of a longer bed as the double was just not big enough, He was told that they could accomodate us but we would need to pay an extra $30 a night, this was very strange as we were told the day before the entire hotel was booked out for the duration of our stay. As we were on a budget we could not afford this and made do with what we had. Can highly recommend a day trip to Niagra Falls we hired a car and it is an easy 1.5 hour drive. We would not to choose to stay at this hotel again it is in desperste need of renovation. Would only recommend to someone for 1 night stay because of location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location!”
Reviews.Author: SRNAlberta
Reviews.Content: This was a really great place to stay if you want to experiance downtown Toronto. It was just 2 blocks from Dundas square and Eaton shopping centre. It was our first time in Toronto, and my boyfriend and I were very impressed with the service. I will definetly stay at this hotel again. You do get what you pay for in the sense that the room is a lil small and the bedding isn't great quality. The service and location makes up for it though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and service”
Reviews.Author: chipnchair
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I expected good value because of its price and location, but was concerned about service and the rooms. I am happy to say my concerns were all for naught. The only drawback is not knowing the parking garage is NOT onsite. It is nearby (diagonal from the hotel, entrance on Bond) and paying for parking is upfront. You do get in/out privileges and the attendants always seem to remember you so getting/in out is not a hassle. The front desk was super helpful, particularly with directions and advice about area attractions. I watched one gentlemen patiently describe the one day Niagara Falls trip to a woman who asked about a million questions (often the same ones) and he never lost his cool. The location is very close to the Eaton Centre, theaters, shopping, ground transportation and Dundas will take you right to the Don Valley Parkway (404) if you're looking to get out of town.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: PWF
Reviews.Content: 2 of us stayed at the BP at the end of May for 5 nights. We were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and both in our 50s (tho young at heart). Air conditioning (essential given the temperature) worked fine but could probably be heard back in Scotland. So, stay cool or sleep, but not both. Room small but adequate. Shower fine. Bizarrely, teabags but no facility to boil water ! No decaff coffee. Breakfast limited menu but quality food and served by the chirpiest waiter in town. Location good, Eaton Centre and subway 2 minutes walk. Monika's Bar a real plus, pool tables, good beer, convivial atmosphere to meet other guests. Incredibly, the bar is shut on Sundays and Mondays (can always try the Imperial Bar over the road). Overall fine for the money, staff always helpful (like all Canadians). Only minor gripe about the holiday (nothing to do with the hotel), but can't they put the prices on items INCLUDING taxes, so that the mystery is taken out of what you finally pay ?

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sammi_1983
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel from the period of 5th may till 12th may and found this hotel a very comfortable place to stay, yes the rooms were on the small side and weren't much facilities but this hotel did offer a good service and good value for money. the location was great with only 2 mins from eaton centre and 10/15 mins from hockey hall of fame and cn tower n harbour front, i def recomend the shop, dine bus tour inwhich you pay one fee and you can hop on and off at which ever attraction you wish to visit for $36 dollars averagin about Â£18 and you can use it for good form of transport. also theres this little shop jus a minute away that offers a day excursion to niagra falls for $78 which include everything the hotel excurson provide except lunch but their price with lunch cost $118 but lunch does not cost that much

Reviews.Title: “Give it a big miss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel should not even be considered by the average traveller. We knew the rooms were on the small side, but our room was ridiculous. You could not move without bumping into each other in any part of the room. The bedside light and clock did not work, and we requested a repair, which we believed happened, as it worked on ou r return that evening, but all that really happened was the plug had been transferred to another hidden power point. The table lamp flickered on and off every time you passed, and we considered the wiring in this hotel very unsafe. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Gamma7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bond Place Hotel at the beginning of May, and thought the hotel was very dated with uncomfortable beds, but this was evened out by the convenient location. It is only a stones throw from the Eaton Centre and a 15 to 20 minute walk down Younge Street to the harbourfront, with The Rogers Centre & CN Tower a further short walk away. If you are too tired to walk, the hotel also is very close to a metro station. We certainly didn't enjoy the nights sleep (or lack of it) in the hotel, but we were compensated with great weather in a wonderful city. A trip to Niagra Falls is worth the trip alone, and we also enjoyed a night at the Medievel Times show (expensive but a very different experience).

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Angelco
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Bond Place Hotel during Easter weekend and it was good. The room was adequate, clean, and quiet as it was on a corner of the building. The hotel is very close to the Eaton Shopping Centre and subway, and the Airport Express shuttle stops right outside. There are many places to eat within a short walking distance and we ate breakfast in the restaurant one morning... omelet was greasy but the service was pleasant. It wasn't flashy but when you try to keep the expenses down some sacrifices need to be made! Would recommend to other travellers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “helped me 'Bond' with Toronto”
Reviews.Author: capo_dean
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days in April 2006. I was pleasantly surprised with the interior of the hotel as well as the location of the hotel, which is excellent and just steps away from the Eaton Centre, Yoong Street and a 15 minute walk from the excellent sports stadia (air canada - Ice Hockey/Basketball, and Rogers Centre - Baseball) and CN Tower. The rooms were very well kept although maybe a bit on the small side if you do enjoy spending a litle time in the room. I was impressed with the selection of TV Channels in the room. The staff were very very friendly. I can't see anyone having any problems at this hotel. It seems to be very professionally run. I would return, no doubt at all. There is a restaurant downstairs and a nicely sized foyer. Although the menu is limited, the usual breakfast choices of French Toast, Eggs, Pancakes etc were good enough for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Bond place is basic enough but fine, the location is great, especially for shopping...the only one thing I would say is that its the LAST hotel stop on the airport express shuttle bus from Toronto airport so it took us over an hour with traffic. We got a room on the top floor and it was clean, functional and for the price, brilliant. Would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast???!!?!?”
Reviews.Author: chakstoneboo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a getaway weekend in toronto it is in a great location 5mins walk from the eaton centre. the room was clean however the free breakfast was a joke..1 cold croissants and a choice of drinks oh and there was some jam!?! not impressed oh and do check your bill because they do have a habit of putting on extra charges. not bad overall if you dont get up for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place just OK to stay a few days, and in terms of accomodations it is barely OK. However, be aware that they will try to charge you those side, minor, services unfair prices. I was charged for watching a film on TV CDN12 !! The room daily charge was CDN75, how can a movie cost 12?! On top of that they charged twice the movies! Another example: the ride to the airport, the luggage carrier was too interested in booking a taxi for CDN45, when there was a bus shuttle for CDN16 which he "accidently" forgot to mention. I will never return and I do not recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Rich096
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for a week. The airport express bus has its drop-off/pick-up stop at the door of the hotel. My room was a good size, clean, comfortable and great value for money.
