Location was ideal, with the subway and Eaton shopping centre just a few minutes walk from the hotel and it took, around, 20-30 minutes to walk to the CN Tower. Last, but not least, I found the staff to be most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “not really good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not the best hotel ive been in my life. Its quite old, needs big big investment. Ok if you are in your student days and want to have a tour round Toronto. Location is good. Room quite small and again ageing... Some people in the front desk can be quite rude, although some others quite helpful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: nacyr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bond Place Hotel from March 23 to the 28th, 2006 while my husband was having heart surgery at Toronto General Hospital. It was an easy walk to the hospital, the room was spotless and the rate was very affordable. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for exploring”
Reviews.Author: Chutuk
Reviews.Content: Ok first things first, this isn't a luxury hotel. It doesn't boast olympic sized swimming pools, amazing views or anything else associated with hotels of a higher and more expensive calibre. What this hotel does offer is a small but comfortable room for a great price in an amazing location. Myself and a friend spent a week here last October and it provides the perfect base for getting out and exploring Toronto. The rooms were small but efficient, cleaned and serviced daily and were on the whole of a very acceptable standard coming equipped with cable tv, air conditioning and all the normal hotel room facilities. Staff were helpful and a travellers cheque cashing and concierge service was available at reception. For the budget traveller this is an ideal choice for a base in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Not really good”
Reviews.Author: JouKb
Reviews.Content: If you stay in this hotel, there is only one advantage, the great location!! The hotel is not very clean, is old and some people of the staff are rude.

Reviews.Title: “Grotty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The non smoking room was STINKING of smoke you could smell it as soon as the lift door opened, a thank you for not smoking sign was in the ashtray! The staff did nothing when I complained. The rooms were small and dated and the air conditioning was loud.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annt
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to Toronto from 28th December to 9th January. We had a great time. The Bond Place hotel is excellent. It is across the road from the Eaton Centre and the subway station and next to the Olympic Spirit building. The Airport express stops outside the hotel. We had a good view from our 16th floor window. There are three elevators and they all work. Our sheets and towels were changed daily. The room was kept clean, and the maids were friendly. Reception staff were very helpful and Donna the concierge deserves special mention for her enthusiasm and the accuracy of her information. We had a complimentary breakfast daily, during which we watched a black squirrel climbing on a tree outside the window. A budget priced hotel with excellent service and a clean and comfortable room. The downside? No fridge, but there were ice machines. No room safe, but safety deposit boxes in reception were readily available and swiftly brought when they were needed. A good hotel, centrally situated and very well worth its cost.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Bond Place Hotel was a great place to stay for 3-4 nights. The location is great. It's a very short walk to the Eaton Centre shopping mall. It takes a bit longer to walk to the CN Tower and the Distillery District. The room was a good size and there was a good selection of TV channels! Room was clean and comfortable, but wasn't by any means luxurious, but for the price, it was great. One of the best things about the hotel was the concierge service. On my first day, I was told about the day trip to Niagara and the time it left and bought my ticket from the concierge on the day of the trip. On another day, being a New Zealander, I wanted to watch the All Blacks play a rugby union game against Wales. Even though the concierge on duty didn't really know much about rugby (he was Canadian after all), he managed to find me a bar to watch the game in - and it only took him about 5 minutes. He was also really good at suggesting things to do and where nearby facilities were (e.g. places to have breakfast, where to get internet access etc). All in all, the Bond Place Hotel was a great place to stay. It's easy to find somewhere to eat nearby and the price is quite reasonable (but if you want a luxury hotel, it's not for you).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: chall32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in October 2005. It has a great location with all the main attractions in walking distance. The nearest subway station and Tim Hortons coffee shop are also within one minute's walk. The hotel is also one of the stops on the Airport Express bus which we found to be very convenient. If you are a non-smoker, make sure you ask for a non smoking room - we weren't asked at reception when we checked in - but this was easily changed. Overall, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “recomend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: roachy04
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the bond place for 7 nights late October, as stated previously the location is excellent, rooms are smallish but clean and tidy, staff are great, very friendly and helpfull, there is a bar downstairs which was o k but we found this to be closed twice our week .all in all the bond is excellent value for money and would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 6 days in Toronto and stayed at the Bond Place Hotel in downtown Toronto. What a perfectly located hotel right on Dundas Street, just 1 minute away from Eaton Center, the TTC subway, and within walking distance to the CN Tower, the Sky Dome, Kensington Market, Chinatown East and West, PATH, the Art Gallery of Ontario, the Theatre District and many other attractions. We did not need to rent a car at all to get around. Although our room was small, it was very clean and well maintained and contained hair dryer and coffee maker. While there was no safe in our room, the hotel did provide safes at the front desk for guest use. The staff was both very friendly and helpful. My husband and I definitely plan to return to both Toronto and the Bond Place Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean ... perfect location !”
Reviews.Author: GRojas
Reviews.Content: I would say the intersection of Dundas and Yonge Streets is the heart of Toronto! and this is what I could see from my window at the hotel, just one block away from Eaton Centre. The rooms are small, but clean, everything good quality, many people from different countries stay at this hotel so it feels like the UN. The small restaurant downstairs is OK (is like a nice dinner kind of thing), but being so centrally located, is better eating out.

Reviews.Title: “good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: goldenknut
Reviews.Content: HI we stayed at the bond for 7 nights from 27th september, found all the staff friendly ,special mention to donna who was great fun , very helpfull getting tickets ,tours ect The location as all been said before is great downtown to air canada center, harbour area 20 mins cn tower skydome a bit further to walk, dundas subway close to hotel enter at eaton center 5 mins walk from hotel. Rooms were on the small side but very clean, great value for money this hotel, save your money go here , use the money saved over other hotels to treat yourself lol:-) will use his hotel when next return to toronto

Reviews.Title: “Good location, drab rooms”
Reviews.Author: UKSMF
Reviews.Content: Great location and not expensive but the decor is that horrible brown colour and the rooms are a bit shabby. The service was good though.

Reviews.Title: “freindly and clean”
Reviews.Author: vekdad
Reviews.Content: hotel was clean the staff very helpfull meals a bit expensive but the sevice was second to none. a stone throw away from the eaton centre and loads to see and do. the city tour is a must will definatly be going back

Reviews.Title: “Bond Place Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shivvey31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first four days of our trip to Toronto on 17th August 2005. The hotel is close to the central bus station and is easy to find. There is also a shuttle bus from the airport that goes downtown and stops at all the hotels. It leaves every half hour and is $15.50 one way. Our room was clean but small and the only complaint I have is that we were given a room at the back of the hotel and the fans for the air conditioning were quite noisey during the day and night but other than that we would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to the shops/restaurants and the local bus stops for tours of the city. [Recommend the grayline hop on hop off - we used this to travel around the town during the day] We could not fault the hotel staff as they were courteous, efficient and approachable with many questions! we actually booked this hotel because of all the good reviews on this site. If you want clean affordable accommodation this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: TUUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bond Place in Toronto for 7 nights and found it to be an excellent hotel. It was my first trip to Canada and the Hotel was booked through United Vacations. I have read some bad reviews about staff and reservation problems, but I didn't experience any. I found the staff could have been a little friendlier, but i guess it wasn't too bad. The location of the Hotel is excellent, especially with one of my favorite sandwich places, Subway, right across the street. :) The room was suitably sized for me, not too big but not too small either. Standard Cable in the room and all usual stuff. The bathroom was well looked after with the best shower I've ever used. The pressure was excellent, in fact, too sore to use at full pressure. Excellent. The view from the window wasn't great as it faced away from downtown, but you don't really pay for a view, do you? There were a few dodgy people hanging around outside in the neighbourhood at night and we witness suspect people sneaking into the hotel and being removed by the manager which made me worry about security but we used a safety deposit box at reception and the door had a safety chian which helped. The only place to get drinks when we stayed was from a vending machine on the floor below reception which was a long trek and at night reception was deserted and it felt a little creepy, but that may just have been me. :) The Hotel also had a day trip rep that set up in the Lobby in the Mornings and we get a great deal on a day trip to Niagara Falls from them. We were picked up from right outside the hotel and the rep was kind enough to let us know when the bus arrived to save us waiting around in the snow. Great trip and they offered quite a few good deals. Worth checking out if it still happens. To sum up, for the price, the hotel was great. Being just a block away from the Eaton Centre, right next to a Hard Rock Cafe and Subway and having to walk just a block or two to get downtown made the stay worth while. Staff could have been a little cheerier, but they did offer free storage of our bags between checkout and heading to the airport, which is a bonus. if I visited Toronto again, I think I might pick a different place, but that's through no fault of the Bond Place, would just like to try out a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lngkparr
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Bond Place in April and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location is excellent, littlerally 2-3 minutes walk to shops, subway, streetcars. The hotel has a small restaurant with room service, we ate there twice when we were too tired to go out and had great meals with good service. I would definately stay here again if I visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: paddle01
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the hotel and truly enjoyed our time there. This was our first time in Toronto and we were interested in sightseeing. Consequently, luxuary amenities (e.g. pool, spa, etc) was not a requirement. The lobby was nice and the staff was helpful. We had rooms on different floors and each room had a nice view. The location was excellent!! We were close to shopping and it was a short walk (about 2 blocks) to the train station. We took the train to the CN Tower and to other museums. On the day we were to check out of the hotel, we were concerned that we did not have an area to store our luggage until our train departed that evening. Much to our surprise, the hotel offered free luggage storage. My only minor issue with the hotel was that the vending machines on most of the floors were out of order. Bur overall, I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I satyed at this hotel for 1 week as i was traverling though canada and america, The staff were very nice, the hotel is very clean and in excellent location, i would return tomorrow if i could. They also offer trips in this hotel i did them all and had a very fab time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Cheap - Exactly what I needed!”
Reviews.Author: SL-WpgTraveller
Reviews.Content: If you are simply looking for an inexpensive, clean and comfortable place to stay for a few days, especially if you are going to Toronto to shop, this hotel is for you! Literally, this hotel is located across the street from Eaton Centre, close to the boutiques on Bloor Street and close to the clubs on Richmond Ave. The staff were very friendly. I asked for a iron to be brought to my room and it was delivered in less than 5 minutes. The rooms were very clean, towels and sheets were changed daily. The shower was very clean and had great water pressure. Beds were comfortable. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: arakal
Reviews.Content: The location is great. I walked just about everywhere. Bloor/Yonge intersection is about a 15-20 minute walk. There are many stores and restaurants and even a mall in the immediate area. The room itself was small, the bed was extra firm, and the air conditioner didn't cool the room well. But the staff was friendly, everything was clean & I felt safe in the area. If you just want a place to rest, shower, & save some money, this is the best place I found. But if you want luxury, this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just back from a 4 day stopover at toronto i couldnt have found a better situated budget hotel than bond place excellent value for money and no hidden extras complimentary news papers even an iron and ironing board on request everything i wanted to visit was in easy walking distance i would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling on a budget i paid around Â£50 a night for a double room for 2, continental breakfast included to sum it up,its clean, cheap,and cheerful

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Battersea, London but from Melbourne, Australia
Reviews.Title: “The name is Bond...Bond Place Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calm-Identity
Reviews.Content: Not as classy or stylish as the British Spy but it still gets the job done. As other reviewers has already mentioned, the hotel is within walking distance of Eaton Shopping Centre (this place is massive), Yonge Street and the Dundas Street Subway. The Entertainment District, Chinatown, CN Tower, Skydome and Air Canada Centre is about 20 minutes walk away but the flat, grid pattern streets of Toronto makes it easy to walk to. And the other suburbs of Toronto such as Greektown, Little India and Little Portugal are easily accessible by the TTC (Toronto's Public Transport). The hotel is very basic with roomy accomodation, clean amenities and comfortable beds. We had the breakfast special (booked directly through the hotel's website) and enjoyed lovely pancakes, bacon and eggs and fruit juices all served by the friendly and cheerful restaurant staff. Check in staff were very helpful and very courteous. Highly recommend this hotel if you want to be in the experience the T Dot Oh!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good location being central for all tourist attractions, restuarants and shopping malls. Staff extremely helpful and curteous. Rooms clean and tidy. Breakfast was good and plentiful and came quickly after ordering. All in all a good value for money and conveniently located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Budget Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bootle45
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Toronto after spending six nights at The Bond Place Hotel. This hotel is is very good value, depending on what your requirements are. We are a family of four with two teenage daughters and we needed two rooms, we paid the same price for two rooms here compared to one room at the more upmarket hotels. The location is perfect within walking distance of all amenities, includingsubways,trams,restaurants and Eaton Shopping Centre. The hotel itself is similar to a Travel Inn here, we had a clean room, clean towels each day, a free newspaper and coffee making facilities in the room. We never used the restaurant or bar. The staff were friendly and the concierge was extremely helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a convenient, no frills budget hotel in a very good location. Toronto was great as well!

Reviews.Title: “perfect on a budget in the heart of T.O.”
Reviews.Author: Kris080
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel at an excellent location in Toronto (around the corner from the Eaton's Centre and steps away from the subway). Although rooms are small, the price is right. Be sure to check out package deals (such as including breakfast and parking) on their website. I found a much better deal booking directly on their website rather than through expedia, hotels, etc.

Reviews.Title: “FAB”
Reviews.Author: fred69Scotland
Reviews.Content: just returned from 4 nights in this hotel. the location is excellent, eaton centre within sight, subway across road, sightseeing bus stopping right outside the door. the hard rock cafe is in the same street - perfect. our room was very comfortable. layout similar to a travel inn back home but more homely. would recommend this to anyone. the breakfast choice is excellent. the bar downstairs is perfect for chatting no loud music. dont hesitate book today

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: angelabMaidstone
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from Toronto. We booked into the Bond Place for 4 Nights. Checking was okay, but no offers of help with Luggage. We were put on the 15th floor. The room we were allocated had defintely seen better days. The carpet was wet from a leak on the Air conditioning unit. You couldn't swing a cat in there. We decided after only being there 2 hours that this hotel was not right for us and booked in elsewhere. When we checked out we were not asked what was wrong, so do they get alot of this!!!!! If you book a trip to toronto book a better hotel it is worth it in the end.!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Bond Place Hotel, starting on 29 December 2004. The best aspects of this hotel are its location and the express bus from YYZ airport stops at the front door of the hotel. The hotel is located only two blocks east of Yonge Street and the northern end of the Eaton Centre. This is convenient for shopping, food and the Toronto subway system. The room I was given was located on the sixteenth floor facing Dundas Street with a queen bed and desk. The room would be considered small by American standards but was clean. Room amentities are basic. The room decor and the hotel in general is fairly old and could do with a renovation. At US$92/night (including taxes), I believe the hotel represented reasonable value for money in Central Toronto if you are on a budget. However, if you have more money to spend, you may find better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Room smaller than a closet for $200!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Bond Place quite a few times over the past couple of years. I have always been very satisfied with the hotel and staff up until this past New Years Eve. My husband and I booked a room online through another site and we asked for a non-smoking room with a double bed. We got to the hotel at 2pm that afternoon all ready to shop for a couple of hours, relax, have friends over to the hotel for some drinks before heading out for our New year's party. My husband went to park the car while I went up to the room. To my shock we were assigned a tiny room, no bigger than my guest room at home with two twin beds. We're newlyweds, and without being too risque, we preferred to share a bed. Phoning down to the front desk did us no good, as we were informed that there were no rooms to switch us with. What annoyed me was the receptionist asking us for smoking or non, which indicates that there are in fact other rooms to be had. There were a lot of people complaining at the front desk later on that night about wanting rooms with double beds as that is what they had booked. So we weren't the only ones sleeping like we were in 1952. Despite the staff being friendly and helpful at all times, we came home with bites of some sort. Needless to say, after spending $200 on this hovel of a room, I will be staying elsewhere from now on. The Bond Place has lost my business.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, we have booked this hotel via expedia.com. A double room for less than US$100/night. When we checked in, we gave them our names and there's no room booked under our names. So we told the reception lady that we booked it via expedia.com and finally got our room - the room was booked under our 'First' name and the address was in US which is the address of expedia.com! Room and the bathroom were tidy and clean. Small after 4 nights at Sheraton Toronto. The main problem was the A/C. It's noisy but couldn't be adjusted, i.e. either with or without A/C. How can you live in a hotel room in July without A/C?! I had to put on my jacket to sleep. My friend found the noise unbearable and said that she would not choose this hotel for the second time.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Brambo67
Reviews.Content: 1 week staying in august 2004. I don't have any kind of complaint. That's what I can say : - wonderful location / good price - clean room and lines - clean washroom - rooms maybe are small for american standards but not for european standards ( bigger than many Paris or Rome hotel rooms...) - good food and onest price at the restaurant - professional staff - airport shuttle stop at the hotel - Toronto is a wonderful city

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Hong Kong or Orlando, Florida or London, England
Reviews.Title: “No frills but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mypet
Reviews.Content: My husband and my 14 year old daughter stayed with me at this hotel this weekend. We came to Toronto for the Caribana so we only wanted a place to bathe and sleep. Granted it's not a four star hotel but the floor was very quiet, the room was small but clean, I checked the linens and mattresses! The air conditioner worked! There was maid service every morning and the staff was helpful. For security purposes you have to use your room card to access the ice machine room and. also, the elevators at night. The best part about staying here is the location, everything was within walking distance. My daughter loved the Eaton Center Mall, about 2 blocks from the hotel. There are several cheap breakfast places closeby. We didn't try the hotel's restaurant, so I can't say how the food was.
